ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE PROVIDES PAYMENT OF THE GRANTS TO THE STUDENT AS A CREDIT TO THE STUDENTS' RECEIVABLE ACCOUNT; THE GRANTS ARE NOT DIRECTLY PAID TO THE STUDENTS. FOR THE GRANT TO BE AVAILABLE TO THE STUDENT, THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE STUDENTS ENROLLMENT AND THE STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED AND ACTIVE FOR THE TIME PERIOD THE GRANT IS OFFERED. IF THE STUDENT LEAVES THE PROGRAM EARLY, THE GRANT IS NOT REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT AND THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT IS RATABLY ADJUSTED TO REFLECT THE INCOMPLETE PERIOD.

GONZAGA UNIVERSITY IS NOT A "GRANTMAKER" PER SE IN THAT ITS FUNDAMENTAL MISSION, AND PURPOSE FOR TAX-EXEMPTION, RELATES TO EDUCATION. HOWEVER, IN THE COURSE OF THESE MISSION-RELATED ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY DOES MAKE PAYMENTS THAT MEET THE CRITERIA FOR "GRANTMAKING" AS DEFINED BY THE INSTRUCTIONS TO SCHEDULE I OF THE FORM 990. THESE PAYMENTS FALL INTO TWO CATEGORIES. (1) STUDENT FINANCIAL AID STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT, THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES WHO QUALIFIES FOR LOANS BASED ON ANALYSIS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. LOANS ARE AWARDED AS PART OF A PACKAGE CONSISTING OF FEDERAL GRANTS, FEDERAL AND UNIVERSITY LOANS, FEDERAL WORK-STUDY AND UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS. IN ALL CASES, THOSE WHO RECEIVE LOANS HAVE DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AND HAVE COMPLETED A FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION FORM. THE AMOUNTS RECEIVED ARE ADDED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION AND FEES. (2) CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS ARE MADE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE UNIVERSITY.

SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS OFFERED AT GRADUATE SCHOOL OF BANKING (GSBC): 1. GSBC OFFERS GENERAL SCHOLARSHIPS THROUGH VARIOUS STATE BANKER ASSOCIATIONS IN WHICH CANDIDATES FILL OUT A GENERAL SCHOLARSHIP FORM (INCLUDED) WITH THE SUPPORT OF A SUPERVISOR AND THE SCHOLARSHIP IS REVIEWED BY THE STATE ASSOCIATION AND GSBC. IN MOST CASES, ONE GENERAL SCHOLARSHIP PER STATE WHERE IT IS OFFERED IS AWARDED TO A NEW STUDENT EACH YEAR. 2. GSBC ALSO OFFER SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO TOP GRADUATES OF THE INTERMEDIATE LEVEL STATE ASSOCIATION SCHOOLS SUCH AS THE KS/NE ADVANCED SCHOOL OF BANKING; IOWA SCHOOL OF BANKING; MISSOURI SCHOOL OF BANK MANAGEMENT; ETC. IF THE TOP GRADUATE DOES NOT ACCEPT, SOMETIMES IT IS OPENED UP FOR ALL GRADUATES TO APPLY OR THE SECOND-HIGHEST GRADUATE, THIRD HIGHEST, AND SO FORTH.
THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE PRACTICE OF DIRECTLY APPLYING SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT AT THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET TUITION AND FEES.

The scholarship related records are maintained in the Financial Aid office of the University. There is a scholarship committee established to formulate guidelines and procedures as to the eligibility and criteria for each scholarship being awarded. Additionally, records supporting non-scholarship type grants are also maintained between grant accounting and the Office of Grants and Sponsored Research.

THE UNIVERSITY UTILIZES THE POWERFAIDS FINANCIAL AID MANAGEMENT SYSTEM WHICH REQUIRES THE END USER TO TIE HIGHLY SPECIFIC ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA TO INDIVIDUAL FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. DURING EXECUTION OF THE AUTOMATED AWARDING MODULE WITHIN POWERFAIDS, AID IS ALLOCATED BASED ON THE PRE-ESTABLISHED CRITERIA ENSURING THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE ONLY DISTRIBUTED TO APPROPRIATE, QUALIFIED RECIPIENTS. POST AUTO-AWARDING A SERIES OF MIS INFORMATION REPORTS PERFORM A STUDENT-BY-STUDENT TEST OF AWARD EFFICACY MONITORING THAT STUDENT GRANT AID HAS BEEN APPROPRIATELY DISTRIBUTED. WITHIN THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS SYSTEM AND GENERAL LEDGER STUDENT GRANT PROGRAMS EXPENDITURES ARE ASSIGNED SUB-CODES THAT UNIQUELY IDENTIFY THEM AS SUCH THUS PROHIBITING ANY INADVERTANT OR INAPPROPRIATE DISTRIBUTION. THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED APPROPRIATE CONTROLS THROUGH SEPARATION OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND INTERNAL AUDIT PROCEDURES THAT PRECLUDE ANY ENTITY WITHIN THE ADMINISTRATIVE STRUCTURE FROM DIVERTING STUDENT GRANT AID TO NONQUALIFIED USES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN D
ExplntnTxt: THE "NON-CASH ASSISTANCE" REPORTED ARE CREDITS AGAINST STUDENT TUITION CHARGES.

There is a publication of available scholarships and the criteria to qualify for each one. Students complete an application indicating which scholarship(s) they are applying for. These applications are reviewed by the registrar's office during the registration process and qualifying students are determined. Of the $180,269 of financial assistance awarded during the FYE 5/31/18, $174,156 were scholarships which were applied as a credit against the students' tuition. The remaining $6,113 of financial assistance was distributed as cash to students who qualified for scholarships funded by outside sources.
ALL FUNDS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS ARE DONE SO IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL AID POLICIES.

THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS BASED ON VARYING AWARD CRITERIA INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED AND ESSAYS. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS RANGE IN NATURE FROM SIBLING AND LEGACY SCHOLARSHIPS TO ATHLETIC AND PROGRAM SPECIFIC AWARDS. THE HARCUM GRANTS AND COMMUNITY BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE NEED BASED AND DETERMINED BY THE STUDENT'S EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION. ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO DISPLAY SUPERIOR ATHLETIC ABILITIES.

Student financial aid is awarded after an application and eligibility verification process, using FAFSA for establishing financial need, and GPA and recommendations to establish merit. Competitions and other award qualifications are used to determine eligibility where applicable. Records are maintained in the Financial Aid office; scholarships and awards are applied directly to student accounts.

ALL SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA AS SET BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID POLICIES. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE POSTED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO BE APPLIED AGAINST CHARGES FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM, AND BOARD.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STUDENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS.

REGIS UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS BY ENSURING EXPENSES COMPLY WITH ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL LAWS, REGULATIONS, AND GUIDELINES, INCLUDING THE DEPT OF EDUCATION'S STUDENT FINANCIAL AID HANDBOOK AND THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S POLICY GUIDELINES AND AUDIT GUIDE.
The College manages Federal Title IV grant and loan funds in accordance with Title IV regulations. The College undergoes an annual A-133 audit to monitor the use of these funds.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID SERVICES AWARDS FINANCIAL AID IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE HIGHER EDUCATION ACT. FEDERAL AND STATE AWARDING GUIDELINES ARE USED IN AWARDING STUDENT'S FINANCIAL AID. STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS ARE REVIEWED ON A BI-WEEKLY BASIS TO ENSURE THAT ALL STUDENTS ARE CURRENTLY ENROLLED ACCORDING TO APPROPRIATE GUIDELINES. A QUALITY CONTROL CHECK IS IN PLACE IN THAT A FILE AUDIT IS PERFORMED OF A RANDOM SAMPLE OF FILES TO ENSURE THAT PROPER PROCEDURES ARE BEING FOLLOWED. AN ANNUAL AUDIT IS PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE COMPANY TO ENSURE THAT THERE ARE NO GROSS VIOLATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS.

A LIST OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS IS ON FILE AT THE INSTITUTION AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALL RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS ACCORDING TO THE REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP AND/OR AID FOR WHICH THE RECIPIENT IS APPLYING. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID HAVE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS WHICH THE RECIPIENTS NEED TO MAINTAIN TO CONTINUE RECEIVING AID. STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE CASH GRANTS. RATHER, ALL FINANCIAL AID IS TREATED AS A REDUCTION TO TUITION.

PRIMARILY STUDENTS ARE AWARDED BEACON SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT AID (DISCOUNTED EDUCATION COSTS) BASED ON DEMONSTRATING FINANCIAL NEED AS DEFINED BY FEDERAL STUDENT AID GUIDELINES. THE DISCOUNT APPLIED IS AWARDED ON A FORMULA ASSIGNING THE LARGEST BEACON DISCOUNT TO THE NEEDIEST STUDENTS. THERE ARE A FEW SCHOLARSHIPS(DISCOUNTS) AWARDED BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS FROM EDUCATIONAL PROFESSIONALS(PROFESSIONAL EDUCATOR SCHOLARSHIP)AND/OR A GRANT (RAISE ME) OFFERED TO STUDENTS WHO ACHIEVED SPECIFIC ACCOMPLISHMENTS IN HIGH SCHOOL. IN THESE CASES EVERYONE AUTOMATICALLY RECEIVES THE SAME LEVEL OF REDUCTION BASED ON PREDETERMINED CRITERIA. INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS ARE ALSO ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE AN EDUCATIONAL COST REDUCTION BY DEMONSTRATING FINANCIAL NEED. THESE GRANTS VARY AND ARE DETERMINED BY THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. IN ORDER FOR STUDENTS TO CONTINUE TO RECEIVE NEED-BASED BEACON COLLEGE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENTS MUST RE-APPLY EACH YEAR USING THE FEDERAL APPLICATION FOR STUDENT AID. STUDENTS MUST ALSO REMAIN IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING AS DESCRIBED IN THE BEACON ACADEMIC CATALOG. SHOULD THE STUDENT/FAMILY FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCE CHANGE, THE STUDENT MAY RECEIVE A REDUCTION OR INCREASE IN A BEACON GRANT. IN THE CASE OF NON-NEED BASED BEACON COLLEGE GRANTS; STUDENTS ARE MONITORED ANNUALLY TO ASSURE THEY ARE MAINTAINING GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

The College maintains records for all Muhlenberg students receiving financial assistance administered by the College. Records include academic performance and information regarding family/household income.

Within the limits of available resources, the University makes every effort to make financial aid opportunities available to needy and academically eligible students. Students must be enrolled in full-time undergraduate or graduate degree programs to be considered for University academic scholarships, grants and/or need-based financial aid. With the exception of some academic scholarships and graduate aid, students who wish to apply for grants, loans, or work-study must submit the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). Awards are considered on the basis of financial need and/or a student's academic profile. Awards are packaged using a combination of grants and scholarships, loans, and work-study assignments. Students must be in good academic standing and achieve the minimum standards of academic progress. The University uses the College Board's PowerFaids software to manage our financial aid database and awarding procedures.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES A STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY BASED ON THE FAMILY'S FINANCIAL STRENGTH, WHICH INCLUDES CONSIDERATION OF FAMILY INCOME AND ASSETS, NUMBER OF CHILDREN IN COLLEGE AND, IF APPROPRIATE, SPECIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. FINANCIAL AID WILL BE REVOKED WITHOUT ADEQUATE PROGRESS.

ASSISTANCE IS GIVEN TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE FORM OF CREDITS TOWARD THE COST OF TUITION, AND A RECORD OF THE ASSISTANCE PROVIDED IS RECORDED IN SEPARATE ACCOUNTS MAINTAINED FOR EACH STUDENT/RECIPIENT. IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE INSTITUTION'S BUDGET PROCESS, EACH SCHOOL DETERMINES SCHOLARSHIP SPENDING FOR THE YEAR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS FINANCIAL AID TO APPLICANTS AT EACH SCHOOL ACCORDING TO THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED FOR EACH AWARD TYPE. THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE COMMUNICATE ABOUT AND RECONCILE DISBURSEMENTS. THE INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT DEPARTMENT PROVIDES ANNUAL REPORTS TO THE DONORS REGARDING THE USE OF DONOR-CONTRIBUTED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS.

Financial aid to individuals is awarded by the College's financial aid professionals in accordance with College policies. Awards to sub-recipients are in accordance with College policies and provisions under federal Uniform Guidance.

PRE-AWARD SUBRECIPIENT MONITOR: Federal awards are identified by informing each subrecipient of CFDA title and number, award name and number, award year, and name of Federal agency. If any of this information is not available, the pass-through entity shall provide the best information available to describe the Federal award. The subrecipient is advised of requirements imposed by governing laws, regulations, and provisions of contracts or grant agreements and supplemental requirements imposed by the pass-through entity. The subrecipient's activities are monitored to ensure awards are used for authorized purposes in compliance with laws, regulations, and the provisions of contracts or grant agreements and performance goals are achieved. Assurance is ascertained that any subrecipient expending $750,000 or more in Federal awards during the subrecipient's fiscal year must meet the audit requirements of Uniform Grant Guidance (formerly OMB A-133). A management decision on audit findings must be issued within six months after receipt of the subrecipient's audit report and ensure that the subrecipient takes appropriate and timely corrective action. A determination is made as to whether subrecipient audits necessitate adjustment of the pass-through entity's own records. Each subrecipient is required to permit the pass-through entity and auditors to have access to the records and financial statements as necessary for the pass-through entity to comply with this part. POST-AWARD SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING: The Principal Investigator (PI) or Program Director (PD) is responsible for monitoring the activities. The subrecipient should submit progress reports, technical reports and other deliverables to the PI/PD by specified due dates. The PI/PD is responsible for forwarding copies of the subrecipient's report(s) to the Office of Sponsored Programs and Research (OSPR). Subrecipient invoices submitted to the university must contain the following information: invoice on subcontractor's letterhead, date of invoice, invoice number, period of performance covered by the invoice, itemized description of services and backup documentation, current period costs including cost sharing, cumulative project costs and subrecipient contact person with respect to invoice. Invoice must be signed by an authorized official of the subcontractor and must contain a certification that all payments requested are for appropriate purposes and in accordance with the agreements set forth in the application and award documents. The PI/PD is responsible for reviewing and approving invoices from subrecipient(s) for adherence to the budget and submitting invoices for payment in the procurement system. Grant Accounting will review the subrecipient's invoice(s) for the following: period of performance is within the contract period, appropriate invoice format and level of detail, signature by authorized subrecipient representatives, evidence of cost sharing, if applicable, and availability of funding. Grant Accounting is responsible for ensuring that subrecipients that expend $750,000 or more of Federal funds each fiscal year submit an Audit Certification Letter along with a copy of subrecipient's audited financial statements. The following is required to close out a subrecipient award: receipt of final invoice, receipt of cost share documentation, if applicable, time and effort certifications, final progress and technical reports, annual audit certification letter. Grant Accounting is responsible for tracking payments made to individuals or organizations and where payments are sent when outside of the US as required by the Schedules F and I - Form 990. EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE: Educational assistance is awarded based on financial need and merit. Need based assistance is awarded after review of the student's FAFSA, tax return information, W-2 statements, and other relevant financial documents. Students are required to maintain satisfactory academic progress in order to continue to be eligible for need based assistance. Students' Grade Point Averages and earned units are reviewed each academic year to ensure satisfactory academic progress is achieved. Merit based educational assistance is awarded to students via Committee. Students who are awarded merit based assistance are required to maintain satisfactory academic progress in accordance with the terms of the assistance received. Need and merit based educational assistance are funded directly to the student's accounts receivable balance to offset tuition, fees, and room and board. Any resulting refunds are issued to the student. Students are granted research awards by their academic departments and work with faculty advisors who monitor the research performed by the student.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE HAS A VERY EXTENSIVE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID WHICH IS CONSISTENTLY MONITORED AND SUBJECTED TO EXTERNAL AUDITS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE HEADED BY THE ACADEMIC DIRECTOR AND WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF REGIONAL ACADEMIC DIRECTORS. ONCE AWARDED, THE REGISTRAR MAINTAINS ALL OFFICIAL RECORDS, NOTIFIES RECIPIENTS AND CORRESPONDS WITH STUDENTS REGARDING THEIR ACCOUNTS. THE FINANCE OFFICE, HEADED BY THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER, IS RESPONSIBLE FOR UPDATING STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND REPORTING TO THE DONORS. THE CHIEF EXCUTIVE OFFICE REVIEWS FINAL ALLOCATION OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grants and Other Assistance in U.S. PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and grants are awarded as financial assistance to students attending Stevens Institute of Technology. Distribution and application of financial assistance are based on the specific criteria of each scholarship and grant and are administered consistent with federal, state, and institutional student aid policies. Situations such as changes in financial need, changes in federal aid eligibility, changes in enrollment and receipt of aid from outside sources may affect a students eligibility to receive funding. Stevens' administration monitors these situations on an on-going basis and makes any appropriate adjustments.

MERIT AND ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS AND CURRENT ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. OTHER INTERNAL AND ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SPECIFIC TO THE SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID AND THE FINANCE OFFICE OF THE COLLEGE.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S. AFTER A STUDENT HAS BEEN ACCEPTED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF MOUNT UNION, THEY MUST FILE A FAFSA. MOUNT UNION CONSIDERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FEDERAL GRANTS AND STATE ELIGIBILITY IN THAT RESPECTIVE ORDER. IF THE STUDENT NEEDS FURTHER ASSISTANCE, THE COLLEGE OFFERS FEDERAL LOANS, COLLEGE GRANTS AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED IS AWARDED ON FAFSA CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL AID THAT IS TO BE MET. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA, CLASS RANK AND STANDARD TEST SCORES. NEED-BASED GRANTS CAN BE ALLOCATED TO RETURNING STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS AS LONG AS FINANCIAL NEED IS STILL PRESENT. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS CONTINUE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AT THE END OF THE YEAR.
THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE BASED UPON THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: HANOVER COLLEGE ONLY AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL AND PRIVATELY FUNDED FINANCIAL AID AWARDS AS ASSISTANCE FOR STUDENTS BASED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS, BASED ON MERIT, NEED AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. IN DOING SO THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ADHERES STRICTLY TO ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROL REQUIREMENTS OF 0MB-A133, IN WHICH THEY FOLLOW ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES.

Emergency aid: Students are required to substantiate a legitimate need for benevolence before money is awarded. No attempt to verify the use of the money is made.Tuition assistance: Tuition is discounted to apply aid.

THE COLLEGE DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS ANY EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS OVER THEIR CHARGES, THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE COLLEGE HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTING MANAGER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER. THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE COLLEGE'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

Scholarships are monitored through the financial aid office, to ensure that all scholarship monies are used for housing, tuition, meals and books. No cash changes hands and funds are directly tied to student accounts.

THE PROCESS FOR MONITORING TUITION DISCOUNT OR GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AT LEES-MCRAE IS DONE BY UTILIZING A MATRIX THAT DETERMINES AND LIMITS THE AMOUNT OF ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP AWARDED. THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ADMISSIONS AND ENROLLMENT AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID MEET REGULARLY TO REVIEW THE MOST CURRENT AMOUNT OF AWARDS BEING AWARDED TO ENSURE THE COLLEGE STAYS WITHIN BUDGE AND AWARD GUIDELINES. A FINAL REVIEW IS DONE BY THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ADMISSIONS AND ENROLLMENT AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID PRIOR TO AWARD LETTERS BEING MAILED.

INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED BASED ON BOTH A FINANCIAL NEED AND MERIT BASIS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS AND THE USE OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA AND THE INSTITUTIONAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA. MERIT AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET CERTAIN ACADEMIC CRITERIA WHO MAY OR MAY NOT ALSO HAVE FINANCIAL NEED FOR ASSISTANCE. CAMPUS BASED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM FEDERAL AND STATE SOURCES IS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AS STIPULATED BY FEDERAL OR STATE GUIDELINES. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS AND THE USE OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA.

LIPSCOMB UNIVERSITY HAS AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL AID AWARDING PROCESS (CALLED THE THE UNIFORM GUIDANCE AUDIT). IN ADDITION, FINANCIAL AID COUNSELORS ATTEND CONFERENCES AND TRAINING SESSIONS ON FINANCIAL AID AWARDING POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND CONTROLS.

Students requesting financial aid are screened for financial need, academic merit, and other scholarship criteria prior to the awarding of scholarships. The combined total of scholarships, grants and other tuition related awards may not exceed the cost of tuition. Students must meet the enrollment guidelines and maintain satisfactory academic progress to retain awards received. Monitoring of these criteria is a combined effort of the Financial Aid office, the Registrar's office and the Business office.

The Chicago School - Washington, D.C., Inc. gives need-based and merit-based scholarships. Need-based scholarships are monitored through the Department of Education FAFSA form. Students with $0 estimated family contribution (EFC), based on the Department of Education guidelines, will be automatically awarded a scholarship. Merit-based scholarships are granted to students who submit all required documentation by certain deadlines and apply with a 4.0 undergraduate GPA or GRE score of 1,300 (test taken prior to August 1, 2011) or a combined GRE score of 314 (test taken on or after August 1, 2011). The Chicago School and its partners award fellowships to students who contribute to the academic community in and outside the classroom. Fellowship recipients dedicate 10 to 15 hours a week of work to the specific department through which the fellowship is offered. Applicants are judged on their ability to demonstrate a commitment to learning, developing, and participating in the programmatic, research, and adminstrative activities within the department or office.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: AFTER STUDENT HAS BEEN ACCEPTED, THEY MUST FILE A FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY CONSIDERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FEDERAL GRANTS AND STATE ELIGIBILITY IN THAT RESPECTIVE ORDER. IF THE STUDENT NEEDS FURTHER ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS FEDERAL LOANS, COLLEGE GRANTS AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED IS AWARDED ON FAFSA CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL AID THAT IS TO BE MET. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA, CLASS RANK AND STANDARD TEST SCORES. NEED-BASED GRANTS CAN BE ALLOCATED TO RETURNING STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS AS LONG AS FINANCIAL NEED IS STILL PRESENT. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS CONTINUE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

THE UNIVERSITY ISSUES GRANTS AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS, WHICH ALLOWS STUDENTS TO FURTHER THEIR EDUCATION. GRANTED FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S UNIVERSITY BILLING ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, AND OTHER COSTS OF EDUCATION. IN THE FISCAL YEAR 2017-2018 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED DOMESTIC FINANCIAL AID TO SUPPORT 1275 STUDENTS

VANGUARD UNIVERSITY AWARDS MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO TRADITIONAL UNDERGRADUATES AND MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO GRADUATE STUDENTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA INCLUDING ACADEMIC, TALENT AND PARTICIPATION, AND INCENTIVE INCLUDING DENOMINATION, MINISTRY/MISSIONARY DEPENDENT. CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY INCLUDING MAINTENANCE GPA IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. NEED-BASED AWARDS REQUIRE DEMONSTRATED NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA AND REQUIRES FILING THE FAFSA BY THE MARCH 2 PRIORITY DEADLINE EACH YEAR AND CONTINUED DEMONSTRATION OF NEED. THE MAJORITY OF THE AWARDS ARE FUNDED BY THE INSTITUTIONAL AID BUDGET BUT SMALL NUMBER ARE FUNDED BY THE ENDOWMENT AND HAVE DONOR SPECIFIC CRITERIA. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH UNIVERSITY ADVACEMENT AND FISCAL MANGEMENT TO AWARD THESE FUNDS.

A FILE IS CREATED FOR EACH GRANTEE, WHICH CONTAINS THE OFFICIAL INSTITUTIONAL STUDENT INFORMATION RECORD FROM THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR FROM WHICH ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED ACCORDING TO FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES FOR THE AWARDING OF FINACIAL ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: UNIVERSITY OF THE NATIONS, KONA, INC. IS PART OF YWAM (YOUTH WITH A MISSION), A GLOBAL MOVEMENT OF CHRISTIANS UNITED IN A COMMON PURPOSE TO KNOW GOD AND MAKE HIM KNOWN. YWAM STAFF SERVE IN OVER 180 NATIONS AND A FAMILY OF MINISTRIES. EACH YWAM LOCATION IS LEGALLY SEPARATE BUT IS HELD ACCOUNTABLE TO YWAM FOUNDATIONAL VALUES AND CHRISTIAN BELIEFS. UNIVERSITY OF THE NATIONS, KONA, INC. IS A MULTIPLIER FOR MISSIONS AND MAKES GRANTS AND DONATIONS TO VARIOUS YWAM LOCATIONS AROUND THE WORLD. WE WANT TO HELP YWAM LOCATIONS AND STAFF WHO ARE SEEKING TO PRESENT THE WHOLE GOSPEL FOR THE WHOLE PERSON THROUGHOUT THE WHOLE WORLD. THE ORGANIZATION CONTROLS THE DONATED FUNDS AND RESERVES THE RIGHT TO WITHHOLD FUTURE GRANTS AND DONATIONS. MISSION SUPPORT DONATIONS REQUIRE A COMPLETED APPLICATION AND FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED ONLY TO ACTIVE YWAM LOCATIONS. YWAM LOCATIONS OPERATE WITH TEAM LEADERSHIP THAT HOLDS INDIVIDUALS ACCOUNTABLE. A GLOBAL NETWORK OF LEADERS FURTHER ASSISTS TO HOLD YWAM LOCATIONS ACCOUNTABLE. FOR A YWAM BASE TO RECEIVE APPROVAL FOR A MISSION ACCOUNT THEY MUST HAVE A KONA STAFF SPONSOR, A PERSON WHO WILL VOUCH FOR THE YWAM LOCATION AND LEADERSHIP, THAT THEY ARE A PART OF YWAM, AND FOLLOW YWAM FOUNDATIONAL VALUES AND CHRISTIAN BELIEFS. FOR OFFERINGS AND RESTRICTED FUND DONATIONS, APPROVAL BY THE ORGANIZATION'S LEADERSHIP IS REQUIRED. APPROVAL OF THE FINANCE WORKING GROUP IS FURTHER REQUIRED TO SET UP A NEW RESTRICTED FUND. APPROVAL FOR DONATIONS AND GRANTS CAN ONLY BE GIVEN BY RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE AWARE OF THE VARIOUS NEEDS AND TYPICALLY HAVE A PERSONAL RELATIONSHIP WITH THOSE RECEIVING THE FUNDS. KONA STAFF GENERALLY SEND OUTREACH TEAMS TO YWAM LOCATIONS RECEIVING FUNDING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The financial aid office notifies students when our comprehensive endowment scholarship application goes live (first week of february). Once notified, students fill out an application to apply for the respective scholarship. If the scholarship is for a specific program, the dean or other faculty member for that program will review the applications and make recommendations to the financial aid office and who should receive the award. Financial aid verifies again if the student is still eligible for the award and issues the funds to the recommended students. The financial aid office monitors the use of the funds to ensure that they are used for their intended purpose.

CUI awards scholarships and financial aid to students based on financial need, talent, and/or other academic merit and programs. Federal and State programs are awarded based on respective program requirements. Federal and State programs are compliance tested yearly in conjunction with the independent audit and auditor reports/newsletters are submitted to all organizations as required by the programs.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON ESTABLISHED CRITERIA FOR EACH GRANT. THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS, THE NEED PER FAFSA, AND THE DATE OF THE APPLICATION ARE ALSO CONSIDERED. THE FUNDS ARE AWARDED AND DISBURSED AFTER ALL ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA HAVE BEEN CONFIRMED. TUITION WAIVERS MUST FOLLOW THE APPROVAL PROCESS OUTLINED IN THE HUMAN RESOURCES HANDBOOK. WAIVERS ARE AWARDED AND DISBURSED BASED ON THE SCHOOL YEAR AND SEMESTER REGISTRATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The Financial Aid Office and Business Office operate together to ensure grants are used for educational purposes. Grants are applied to students' accounts by the Business Office after the grants are approved and disbursed by the Financial Aid Office.

INITIAL MERIT AID FOR NEW FIRST YEAR AND TRANSFER FULL TIME DAY STUDENTS IS DETERMINED BY VARIABLES SUCH AS ACT TEST SCORES, HIGH SCHOOL GPA, TOP % OF HIGH SCHOOL CLASS, AND TRANSFER GPA. THIS INFORMATION IS DATA ENTERED INTO THE SOFTWARE AND THEN A FACTOR IS DETERMINED. THAT FACTOR DETERMINES THE MERIT AID THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. RULES IN THE SOFTWARE ALERT MANUAL AWARD ENTRY ERROR. RENEWAL OF MERIT AID IS DETERMINED AT THE TIME OF AWARDING THE AID FOR THE NEXT YEAR BY REVIEWING GRAND VIEW GPA AND SEMESTERS OF RECEIVED AID. AS A FOLLOW-UP FOR THOSE AWARDED PRIOR TO THE SPRING GRADES, A REPORT IS REVIEWED TO DETERMINE IF THE GPA CRITERIA WAS MET AT THE END OF THE TERM. GRAND VIEW IS A MEMBER OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS AND OFFERS ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS IN BASEBALL, BASKETBALL, BOWLING, CROSS COUNTRY, FOOTBALL, GOLF, SOCCER, TRACK AND FIELD, WRESTLING, VOLLEYBALL, TENNIS AND SHOOTING SPORTS FOR MEN, AND BASKETBALL, BOWLING, COMPETITIVE DANCE, CROSS COUNTRY, GOLF, SOCCER, SOFTBALL, TRACK AND FIELD, VOLLEYBALL, TENNIS AND SHOOTING SPORTS FOR WOMEN. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ABILITY AS EVALUATED BY THE COACHES. TO QUALIFY, STUDENTS MUST VISIT CAMPUS, INTERVIEW WITH AND BE RECOMMENDED BY THE COACH, APPLY AND BE ACCEPTED TO THE UNIVERSITY. COACHES ARE GIVEN A BUDGET FOR THE YEAR TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN PLAYERS. APPEALS FOR ADDITIONAL DOLLARS ARE MONITORED BY THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT. BUDGETS ARE MONITORED BY ATHLETIC ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR, ATHLETIC DIRECTOR, FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT. ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE ATHLETIC SUCCESS COORDINATOR AND THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR. COMMUNICATION OF STUDENT AWARDS IS DONE VIA EMAIL BETWEEN THE ATHLETIC ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR AND FINANCIAL AID. ART, MUSIC & THEATER AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO FULL TIME DAY STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE TALENT. TO QUALIFY, STUDENTS MUST VISIT CAMPUS, MEET WITH THE CHAIR OF THE DEPARTMENT, APPLY AND BE ACCEPTED TO GRAND VIEW. RENEWAL IS BASED ON GPA OR GOOD STANDING. EACH DEPARTMENT HAS A BUDGET TO USE TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN STUDENTS. COMMUNICATIONS FOR INITIAL AWARDS ARE GIVEN TO THE ADMISSIONS DIRECTOR AND FORWARDED TO THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR. ROSTERS OF THOSE TO RENEW ARE SENT TO THE CHAIR TO EVALUATE BASED ON GPA, ACADEMIC STANDING AND PARTICIPATION. BUDGETS ARE MONITORED BY FINANCIAL AID. AN ALERT WILL BE GIVEN IF AN AWARD IS ENTERED OVER THE BUDGETED AMOUNT. ANNUAL AND ENDOWED AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON DONOR QUALIFICATIONS. ADVANCEMENT, BUSINESS OFFICE, AND FINANCIAL AID SIGN OFF AND RECEIVE COPIES OF NEW FUNDS CREATED. THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID WORKS WITH THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND ADVANCEMENT TO DETERMINE WHICH FUNDS AND THE DOLLAR AMOUNT TO BE AWARDED IN A GIVEN YEAR IN JANUARY. NOTIFICATIONS GO TO DEPARTMENTS OF FACULTY PICKS. FINANCIAL AID PICKS ARE DETERMINED BY RUNNING A REPORT TO GET STUDENTS WHO MEET DONOR REQUIREMENTS. MOST OF THESE AWARDS REQUIRE A SCHOLARSHIP ACCEPTANCE AND THANK YOU TO THE DONOR. DISBURSEMENT RULES WILL NOT ALLOW THE FUND TO BE DISBURSED UNTIL THIS DOCUMENTATION IS RECEIVED. PACKAGING PROCEDURES ARE DEVELOPED EACH YEAR AND UTILIZED TO DETERMINE A STUDENT'S TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. IN THIS WAY, AID IS GIVEN IN A FAIR AND EQUITABLE MANNER.
Institutional scholarships and grants are monitored by disbursing funds from financial aid to the business office.
THE GRANTEES WERE APPROVED BY THE UNIVERSITY PRESIDENT AND CONFIRMED WITH THE VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCIAL AFFAIRS.

Most students receiving need-based financial aid from the University must complete an annual Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form and make satisfactory academic progress in order to retain their aid. Reviews are also conducted on each student to ensure that their grades, academic standing, and major continue to qualify them for the financial aid. These review processes are conducted annually at the end of the University's spring term, prior to the renewal of financial aid packages for the students.
THE UNIVERSITY FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON DOE TITLE IV REGULATIONS AND UNIVERSITY APPROVED POLICIES.

ALL UNIVERSITY STUDENTS ARE CONSIDERED FOR GRANTS AND/OR ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED BASED UPON INFORMATION PROVIDED ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MANAGEMENT AWARDS MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY BASED UPON DONOR STIPULATIONS AND AWARD FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE NEED-BASED AWARDS BASED ON FEDERAL OR OTHER GUIDELINES. STUDENTS RECEIVING AWARDS PROVIDE INFORMATION AND PARTICIPATE IN INTERVIEWS TO ENSURE THAT GUIDELINES AND RESIDENCY RULES AND REGULATIONS ARE MET.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TOWARDS THE PAYMENT OF TUITION AND FEES IN WHICH CASE THE GRANT AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED FOR VARIOUS REASONS TO STUDENTS, FACULTY AND STAFF FOR EDUCATIONAL OR WORK RELATED ACTIVITIES. IN THESE CASES EXPENSE VERIFICATION IS REQUIRED IN THE FORM OF RECEIPTS AND OTHER APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 ALL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE WHICH IS TO PROVIDE AID TO STUDENTS WITH FINANCIAL NEED TO COVER THE STUDENTS' COST OF ATTENDANCE. THESE GRANTS INCLUDE FEDERAL PELL GRANTS, FEDERAL SEOG GRANTS, AND STATE PHEAA GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS DONOR RESTRICTED GRANTS THAT ARE PROVIDED FROM FOUNDATIONS, ALUMNI SCHOLARSHIP DONATIONS, AND OTHER DONORS. ADDITIONALLY, THE COLLEGE PROVIDES INTERNAL INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS. THE GRANTS ARE AWARDED AND POSTED TO THE ELIGIBLE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THESE ACCOUNTS ARE RECONCILED BY THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ON A MONTHLY BASIS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES AS WELL AS ANY DONOR RESTRICTED GRANT GUIDELINES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REPORTS STUDENT GRANT AWARDS TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND PHEAA THROUGHOUT THE YEAR AND ALSO SUBMITS THE REQUIRED ANNUAL FISAP REPORT TO THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. AN ANNUAL A-133 AUDIT (FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORT OF INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133) IS CONDUCTED BY THE COLLEGES' EXTERNAL INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

GRANT FUNDS DISBURSED BY THE COLLEGE ARE PREDOMINANTLY AVAILABLE AS MERIT OR NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO PAY FOR TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. THEY ARE THEN MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS OFFICE, BOTH OF WHOM ARE NOTIFIED IF THE STUDENT'S NORMAL ENROLLMENT STATUS CHANGES DURING THE SEMESTER. THESE OFFICES MONITOR WHETHER THE GRANTEE IS TAKING THE NECESSARY CLASSES AND IS THEREFORE UTILIZING THE GRANT AS IT WAS INTENDED. IF A STUDENT'S ENROLLMENT CHANGES, AWARD ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE. OTHER GRANT FUNDS ARE DISBURSED BY THE COLLEGE THROUGH ACCOUNTS PAYABLE. QUALIFICATION AND USE OF THESE PAYMENTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPECTIVE DEPARTMENTS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DISBURSEMENT.

EACH STUDENT IS REVIEWED BY TWO OR THREE INDIVIDUALS IN THE AWARDING PROCESS. STUDENTS ARE THEN AWARDED GRANT FUNDS BASED ON FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS, GUIDELINES AND INSTITUTIONAL MATRIX PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING FUNDS ARE ALSO BUILT INTO THE COMPUTER AWARDING SOFTWARE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 The college provides scholarships to students matriculating at the University; these scholarships may only be used by students to defray the costs of tuition and/or room and board. Since the students may not exercise any discretion on how the funds are spent, the college is not required to monitor the grants (other than to ensure that the student is fulfilling the requirements for earning the scholarship).
STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA SET FORTH BY THE ORGANIZATION.
GETTYSBURG COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE DESCRIBED ON SCHEDULE F, PART V.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO ENROLLED STUDENTS. GRANTS ARE CREDITED TO THE RECIPIENTS' ACCOUNTS FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD.
STUDENTS ARE VERIFIED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND FUNDS ARE POSTED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. ACCOUNT IS REFUNED IF NOT USED IN SPECIFIED TIME OR IF STUDENT WITHDRAWS.

MEREDITH COLLEGE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OFFICE HAS SYSTEMS AND INTERNAL PROCEDURES IN PLACE THAT ENSURES THE PROPER DETERMINATION, DISBURSEMENT AND MONITORING OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SYSTEMS AND PROCEDURES COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL STUDENT TITLE IV AID REGULATIONS, NORTH CAROLINA STATE EDUCATION ASSISTANCE AUTHORITY RULES, AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES.
PAY-IT FORWARD SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A STUDENT'S STATEMENT OF NEED.

FOR FINANCIAL AID GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS, THE COLLEGE AWARDS THESE TO STUDENTS EACH SEMESTER BASED ON SEVERAL FACTORS. THE AWARDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BALANCE FOR TUITION. FOR FACULTY DEVELOPMENT GRANTS, THE COLLEGE COLLECTS A DETAILED ACCOUNTING OF ALL GRANT RELATED EXPENDITURES ALONG WITH ALL CORRESPONDING RECEIPTS. ALL EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE RELATED TO THE GRANT AND THERE IS PROPER DOCUMENTATION. THE GRANT RECIPIENT ALSO SUBMITS A REPORT TO ACADEMIC AFFAIRS SUMMARIZING THEIR EXPERIENCE. ENTREPRENEURSHIP GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS, GRADUATES AND ALUMNI WHO ARE LAUNCHING OR GROWING BUSINESSES IN BALTIMORE. A PANEL OF JUDGES DETERMINES THE AWARDEES BASED UPON SEVERAL FACTORS. ALL GRANTS ARE MONITORED THROUGH PROGRESS REPORTING WHICH INCLUDE DESCRIPTIONS OF GRANT SUPPORTED ACTIVITIES THAT HAVE BEEN UNDERTAKEN SINCE THE GRANT PERIOD START DATE. THE GRANTEE ALSO SUBMITS A FINAL REPORT DESCRIBING BUSINESS ACTIVITY INCLUDING: LOCATION AND STATUS OF BUSINESS, JOBS CREATED OR LOST, CLIENT LIST AND LOCATIONS, STRATEGIC ADVISER LIST AND PAIN POINTS FOR ANY ADDITIONAL SUPPORT NEEDED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 BALDWIN WALLACE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND MAKES NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ONLY TO ITS OWN ENROLLED STUDENTS. THE AWARDS CONSTITUTE PART OF THE COST OF ATTENDING. ADDITIONAL NEED-BASED AID USUALLY CONSISTS OF FEDERAL DIRECT STUDENT LOANS AND COLLEGE WORK STUDY FOR JOBS ON CAMPUS. THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAKES NEED-BASED GRANTS ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED USING NATIONALLY ACCEPTED FORMS AND METHODS. THE SAME OFFICE AWARDS MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS USING BALDWIN WALLACE CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY DISBURSES THE GRANTS AS CREDITS TO STUDENT RECEIVABLE ACCOUNTS, OFFSETTING AMOUNTS BILLED FOR TUITION AND OTHER FEES.
Students seeking financial aid must file a FAFSA to determine their eligibility and need for grant and scholarship assistance.

GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED IN TWO AREAS, DEPENDING ON THE USE. GRANT FUNDS FOR FINANCIAL AID ARE MONITORED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE, WHICH OVERSEES THE AWARDING AND COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FINANCIAL AID TO UNIVERSITY STUDENTS. GRANTS FOR RESEARCH AND FACULTY DEVELOPMENT ARE MONITORED BY THE ASSISTANT TO THE VPAA FOR FINANCE, ADMINISTRATION & SPONSORED PROGRAMS. ALL GRANTS ARE MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE AND PROPER REPORTING BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY, OVERSEEN BY THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE & OPERATIONS.

GRANTS CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA AND ELIGIBILITY EACH SEMESTER FOR EVERY STUDENT. WITHDRAWALS FROM CLASSES REQUIRE THE STUDENT TO HAVE A FORM SIGNED BY THE ACADEMIC OFFICE, THE BUSINESS OFFICE, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED IS PRO-RATED BASED ON FEDERAL REGULATIONS.
ALL STUDENTS RECEIVE A FULL SCHOLARSHIP.

In 2013, Wongu University offered the "Founder's Class Scholarship" to all incoming students. After the student's first quarter the Scholarship is continued based on specified performance standards including a minimum cumulative GPA. All students were informed of these standards. Students were also informed that the scholarship program would be continued until such time as the student receives the Masters Degree in Oriental Medicine. From 2014-2015, new students were offered a President's Award Scholarship for 4 quarters or until the University qualified to offer Title IV funds, whichever came first.

GRANTS ISSUED BY THE SEMINARY ARE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS FOR THEIR EDUCATIONAL ENDEAVORS AT THE SEMINARY. SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE BASED ON DONOR INTENT AND INTERNAL GUIDELINES, SUCH AS ACADEMIC ELIGIBILITY.

THE ACADEMIC PROGRESS OF FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS IS MONITORED A MINIMUM OF ONCE EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. STUDENTS SHOULD CONTACT THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH QUESTIONS REGARDING THE INTENT AND/OR INTERPRETATION OF THESE STANDARDS. COMPLETION RATE AND GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) REQUIREMENTS FULL-TIME STUDENTS (STUDENTS ATTEMPTING 12 OR MORE CREDIT HOURS EACH SEMESTER) MUST PROGRESS ACCORDING TO THE FOLLOWING SCHEDULE: MINIMUM CREDITS MINIMUM REQUIRED SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED CUMULATIVE GPA YEAR 1 24 1.70 YEAR 2 48 2.00 YEAR 3 72 2.00 YEAR 4 96 2.00 YEAR 5 123 2.00 THESE CREDIT HOURS MUST BE EARNED DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR (FALL, WINTER AND SPRING). HOWEVER, IF A STUDENT DOES NOT MEET THESE REQUIRED HOURS, THEY MAY BE EARNED DURING THE FOLLOWING SUMMER SESSION(S). FAILURE TO ACHIEVE THIS STANDARD BY THE END OF THE SUMMER WILL RESULT IN THE LOSS OF FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY UNTIL THE COMPLETED CUMULATIVE HOURS MEET THE MINIMUM STANDARDS. LOSS OF AID IS NOT THE SAME AS ACADEMIC SUSPENSION, WHICH IS HANDLED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS. PART-TIME STUDENTS MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE ONE-HALF OF THE CREDIT HOURS THEY ATTEMPT. COMBINED STUDENTS (STUDENTS BLENDING TERMS OF FULL- AND PART-TIME ENROLLMENT) MUST ACHIEVE A CUMULATIVE TOTAL THAT SATISFIES THE COMBINED FULL- AND PART-TIME STANDARDS. STUDENTS WHO DO NOT ACHIEVE THE MINIMUM CUMULATIVE GPA ARE GRANTED ONE PROBATIONARY SEMESTER IN WHICH TO RAISE THEIR CUMULATIVE GPA TO THE MINIMUM. FAILURE TO ACHIEVE THIS STANDARD AT ANY POINT FOLLOWING THE PROBATIONARY SEMESTER RESULTS IN THE LOSS OF FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY UNTIL THE CUMULATIVE GPA MEETS THE MINIMUM STANDARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Procedure for Monitoring Use of Grant Funds Inside U.S.
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part 1, Line 2 Financial aid and scholarships are based on need and merit from applications submitted by students. Once awarded, the funds are placed directly on the student's account to offset the cost of tuition and fees.

ALL STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID ("FAFSA"). THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA, WHICH DICTATES WHAT AND HOW MUCH FEDERAL FUNDING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. IF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AS DETERMINED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS THE STUDENT THE APPROPRIATE FUNDING. STUDENT FILES REGARDING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

IN ORDER TO BE AWARDED INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS, STUDENTS MUST BE ENROLLED FULL-TIME AND MAKING SATISFACTORY PROGRESS. UNDERGRADUATE ON-CAMPUS STUDENTS COMPLETE A CROWN FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION TO HELP DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND DISCOUNTS. SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND DISCOUNTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT AND SPECIFIC CRITERIA. THE CROWN GRANT IS NEED-BASED USING PERCENTAGES AND MINIMUM AWARD ADOPTED FROM NOEL-LEVITZ.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WHICH IS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY OF APPLYING SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS, DONOR RESTRICTIONS ON ENDOWMENT INCOME TO BE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND INTERNAL POLICIES FOR INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS IN RELATION TO ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE RESULTS FROM FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ALSO MEET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS IDENTIFIED BY THE DONORS. INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS ALSO AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET SPECIFIC MERIT OR AFFILIATION CRITERIA. RECIPIENTS OF TUITION REMISSION AND EXCHANGE PROGRAMS FOR WILSON COLLEGE EMPLOYEES ARE VERIFIED FIRST BY THE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES. RECIPIENTS OF TUITION EXCHANGE PROGRAMS FROM OTHER COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES ARE VERIFIED FIRST BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT.

A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF INSTITUTIONAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS IS BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT, FOR WHICH THE UNIVERSITY HAS A PREDETERMINED GRID THAT PROVIDES THE AMOUNTS TO BE AWARDED BASED ON THE STUDENT'S ACTUAL GPA AND TEST SCORES AND, AS NEEDED, EVALUATION BY THE UNIVERSITY'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. OTHER INSTITUTIONAL AID CONSISTS OF RETURNED MISSIONARY SCHOLARSHIPS, TALENT, AND OTHER NEED-BASED GRANTS. RETURNED MISSIONARY SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,500 PER YEAR TO ALL FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHO HAVE COMPLETED A MISSION FOR THE CHURCH OF JESUS CHRIST OF LATTER-DAY SAINTS OR SIMILAR SERVICE. TALENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED IN VARIOUS AMOUNTS, TYPICALLY BETWEEN $500 AND $2,000 PER STUDENT, AND ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE NOMINATION OF THE UNIVERSITY FACULTY, ART/THEATRE/MUSIC DIRECTOR, ETC. AND APPROVAL OF THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE. UNIVERSITY NEED BASED GRANTS AND VARIOUS OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED AS DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR. FEDERAL & STATE GRANTS, INCLUDING PELL, SEOG, AND VTAG ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND MEET THE VARIOUS QUALIFICATIONS. FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS ARE VERIFIED INTERNALLY BY OUR FINANCIAL AID STAFF AS DICTATED BY APPLICABLE REGULATION.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, CHAPMAN UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.CHAPMAN.EDU.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED UPON THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED WITH EACH GRANT. FINANCIAL AID PERSONNEL MONITOR EACH GRANT ALONG WITH THE TOTAL AID RECEIVED BY EACH STUDENT TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS COLLECTIVE AWARDS ARE WITHIN THE GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY STATE AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES.

Grants and scholarships are awarded to students based on specific criteria detailed in the various grant/scholarship agreements. Members of the financial aid office and various scholarship/award committees review records for all potential recipients to ensure that the scholarship/award is being awarded properly.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS ELIGIBLITY REQUIREMENTS AND MONITORS GRANTING OF AWARDS TO STUDENTS AND FOLLOWS U.S. FEDERAL AID REGULATIONS AND ALL STATES' REGULATIONS FOR GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS.

The organization has a Grants and Contracts management system for ensuring compliance with federal, state, local and private grant stipulations and requirements. Each program is responsible for monitoring the individual grants and contracts. The College retains independent auditors who prepare the federal OMB Circular A-133 audit for compliance.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO INSTITUTIONAL CHARGES. DIRECT COSTS INCURRED TO SUPPORT THE PRIMARY FUNCTIONS OF WALSH COLLEGE ARE SPECIFICALLY IDENTIFIED TO THE BENEFITING ACTIVITY. RESTRICTED FUNDS, INCLUDING FEDERAL AWARDS, ARE RECORDED IN SEPARATE FUNDS AND DIRECT EXPENDITURES OF THESE PROGRAMS ARE RESTRICTED TO THE EXCLUSIVE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD. ALL SPONSORED PROJECTS ARE INCLUDED IN THE DIRECT COST BASE. INDIRECT COSTS ARE ALLOCATED PROPORTIONALLY AS PRESCRIBED IN OMB CIRCULAR A-21. ANY UNDER RECOVERY OF INDIRECT COSTS FROM ANY SPONSORED ACTIVITY IS NOT CHARGED TO ANY OTHER SPONSORED PROJECT EITHER DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY.
THE SCHOOL APPLIES THE MONIES GRANTED TO STUDENTS FOR TUITION DIRECTLY TO TUITION COSTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Phoenix Seminary, Inc. students must submit applications for specific scholarships available each semester. Once the scholarship applications are submitted, the scholarship committee reviews and scores the applications based on the answers provided by the students. The scholarship committee then awards the scholarships based on the students meeting the scholarship criteria. Scholarships are disbursed based on the amount of funds available and the number of students meeting the scholarship criteria that apply.

Saybrook University provides scholarships to new and continuing students. These scholarships are dependent upon factors such as recommendations, academic standing, and other criteria related to admission/participation in the program. Saybrook University maintains records of the scholarship award amounts, evidence of good academic standing and criteria for scholarship selection.

THE VP OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION STAFF OVERSEE THAT THE PROVISIONS OF THE GRANT ARE MET IN ACCORDANCE WITH GUIDELINES OR AGREEMENTS SET FORTH, WHETHER THAT'S USE OF DONOR, GOVERNMENT OR PRIVATE SOURCES.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S. MANAGEMENT DETERMINES THE ANNUAL GUIDELINE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA AND TRACKED WITH BOARD APPROVED BUDGET. MONTHLY GENERATED REPORTS ARE USED TO MONITOR AWARDS PROGRAM. INDEPENDENT AUDITORS REVIEW ACCURACY OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS AND RECIPIENTS' RECORDS. FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS Annually tuition discount expenditures are projected and budgeted for the upcomiNg budget cycle. Projections are prepared by the Director of Student Administrative Services, delivered to the Director of Budget and submitted for approval to the Executive Vice President of Finance and the Board of Trustees. Various constituencies across campus are "allocated" a certain amount of funding to award to students, within the budgeted amounts. These awards are submitted to the Executive Vice President of Finance for approval and then routed to the Director of Student Administrative Services who then, through the Director of Financial Aid, oversees the packaging of these awards and integration with other financial aid awards to insure that no students with federal financial aid are over-awarded. Since these awards are tuition-based, they are posted to students' accounts each quarter once schedules are locked and total tuition amounts can be verified by the Director of Student Accounts and staff. Quarterly, the Director of Student Administrative Services compares actual expenses to budgeted amounts and alerts the budget manager of any potential overages. The budget is reviewed in each case to make sure overages will not cause fiscal issues. If it appears that they will, adjustments are recommended by the Director of Budget to the Executive Vice President of Finance.

The College provides scholarships to students matriculating at the CollegE based on need and/or merit. The College monitors students' files to ensure that the student receives necessary financial assistance based on grades, course of study and financial need. All funds granted are required to be used to defray the costs of attendance; funds may not be spent on discretionary items.

THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES FOR DETERMINING ELIGBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, PRIZES AND OTHER GRANTS AND AWARDS. THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS SHOWING RECIPIENT ELIGIBILITY, HOW FUNDS MAY BE USED, AND ANY RELATED PARTY DISCLOSURES. GRANTS AWARDED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS. OTHER GRANTS ARE MONITORED IN VARIOUS WAYS, INCLUDING REIMBURSING ACTUAL SUBSTANTIATED EXPENSES, REQUIRING WRITTEN REPORTS AND /OR VISITING SITES OF ACTIVITIES FUNDED BY COLLEGE GRANTS. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND MONITORS GRANTING OF AWARDS TO STUDENTS AND FOLLOWS U.S. FEDERAL AID REGULATIONS AND ALL STATES' REGULATIONS FOR GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS.

All Federal financial aid administered by Barnard College is based on demonstrated financial need as determined by the Federal Methodology formula. However institutional aid is determined using a Barnard Need Analysis formula which takes into consideration all sources of income and all assets. Barnard does not provide merit scholarships. The College believes that the primary responsibility for financing educational cost rests with each student's family, and all college aid is supplementary to family resources. Once need has been established, Barnard makes every effort to meet the need of all eligible students with a combination of grants, loans and employment opportunities. A student who is admitted to Barnard with financial aid cannot be guaranteed college grants for future years. Awards are for one academic year only. A student can receive Barnard aid for a maximum of eight semesters. Each semester a student is enrolled is counted towards the eight semesters of eligibility whether or not aid was received. No financial aid is given for summer study. If a student has room in her academic year financial aid package and has not already borrowed the maximum loans, these funds may be borrowed during the academic year to be used for classes the following semester. For financial statement purposes, the Pell grant awards of $ 2,053,394 are excluded.

The financial services office at Anderson University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the University does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University to ensure students remain eligible for funds awarded.

The financial aid office at Charleston Southern University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University.

STUDENTS AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS MUST BE ENROLLED, AND FOR CONTINUED FUNDING, MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE THE SEMESTER PROJECT; SOME SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRES MANUSCRIPT SUBMISSION, REVIEW AND SELECTION BY FACULTY.

Santa Barbara & Ventura Colleges of Law provides scholarships to new and continuing students. These scholarships are dependent upon factors such as alumni recommendations, academic standing, and other criteria related to admission/participation in the program. Santa Barbara & Ventura Colleges of Law maintains records of the scholarship award amounts, evidence of good academic standing and criteria for scholarship selection.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IT IS A CONTINUAL PROCESS IN WHICH WE AWARD STUDENT AID WITHIN FEDERAL GUIDELINES AT THE INITIAL AWARDING TIME PERIOD. IF ANY CHANGES TO A STUDENT'S STATUS OCCUR, WE REVIEW THE STUDENT'S AID PACKAGE COMPONENTS TO ENSURE THAT ANY/ALL ADJUSTMENTS MADE MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV FUND RULES. WE ALSO PERFORM SPOT CHECKS THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER TO DOUBLE CHECK THAT AID ELIGIBILITY CALCULATIONS ARE MET.

DRAKE UNIVERSITY HAS EMPLOYEES DEDICATED TO POST-AWARD REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE GRANTS RECEIVED. IN ADDITION, DRAKE RECEIVES AN A-133 AUDIT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS FROM THE EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. OUR FY18 A-133 AUDIT EXPRESSED AN UNQUALIFIED OPINION WITH NO FINDINGS, NO SIGNIFICANT DEFICIENCIES IN INTERNAL CONTROL, AND NO INSTANCES OF MATERIAL NONCOMPLIANCE.

STUDENTS INTERESTED IN A SCHOLARSHIP MUST APPLY THROUGH A WRITTEN APPLICATION PROCESS. ALL APPLICATIONS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE THAT AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO WHETHER OR NOT THE APPLICANT MEETS THE CRITERIA FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP (FOR EXAMPLE, IF THE ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIP SPECIFIES THAT RECIPIENTS MUST BE FROM INNER-CITY DETROIT, ONLY THOSE WHO ARE SO ARE CONSIDERED) AND THEN BASED ON NEED VERSUS AVAILABLE FUNDS.
STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION, WHICH IS APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST A STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT IT IS USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: COLLEGE HORIZONS PROVIDES NEED-BASED AID FOR THE TUITION FEE AND ROUNDTRIP AIRFARE FOR THE COLLEGE HORIZONS, SCHOLARS AND GRADUATE HORIZONS PROGRAMS. GRANT PROCESS: AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION, STUDENTS REQUEST FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND MUST PROVIDE FINANCIAL INFORMATION (TAX RETURNS, IC/WELFARE VERIFICATION, UNEMPLOYMENT VERIFICATION, A STUDENT AID REPORT OR COLLEGE FINANCIAL AID AWARD LETTER) TO DEMONSTRATE THEIR LEVEL OF NEED. COLLEGE HORIZONS USES THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO DETERMINE FEDERAL GRANT PELL ELIGIBILITY AND CH NEED BASED AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. AU PARTNERS WITH OTHER UNIVERSITIES AS NECESSARY TO PERFORM THE SCOPE OF THE WORK OUTLINED IN THE GRANTS AGREEMENTS. PRIOR TO ENGAGING WITH THESE SUB-AWARDEES, AU PERFORMS A RISK ASSESSMENT INCLUDING A REVIEW OF THE MOST RECENT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS WELL AS ENSURING THEY ARE NOT LISTED AS A DEBARRED ENTITY WITH ANY FEDERAL AGENCY.AU WORKS TO MONITOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS EXPENDED USING ITS PROCESSES AND CONTROLS INHERENT IN AU'S SYSTEM. BEFORE SELECTING THE RECIPIENT AND PERIODICALLY AS REQUIRED DURING THE GRANT OR SCHOLARSHIP TERM, AU IMPOSES ITS INSTITUTIONAL CRITERIA AND THE DONOR'S (WHEN APPLICABLE) TO MAKE SURE THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSES. THIS MONITORING IS DONE THROUGH A COLLABORATION OF VARIOUS DEPARTMENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY. PERIODIC SPENDING REPORTS ARE PULLED TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL OVERSIGHT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AS NECESSARY TO REPORT BACK TO DONORS ON THE STATUS OF THEIR GIFTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART III, LINE 1 ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND SIMILAR STANDARDS. APPROXIMATELY 75% OF FULL TIME FRESHMEN APPLIED FOR NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE APPROPRIATE FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS. UPON APPROVAL, FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AS AN OFFSET AGAINST CHARGES SUCH AS TUITION AND FEES. GRANTS CANNOT EXCEED THE STUDENT'S COST OF ATTENDANCE (COA). IN THE EVENT THAT THE COA IS REDUCED DUE TO A DECREASE IN THE STUDENT'S COURSE LOAD OR OTHER CIRCUMSTANCES IMPACTING SCHOOL CHARGES, THE RELATED GRANT IS ACCORDINGLY REDUCED.

ALL FEDERAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DURING THE AWARD PROCESS. FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AND ARE RECONCILED TO THE AWARD BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE CONTROLLER. THE MONEY IS DISBURSED TO THOSE APPLICABLE STUDENTS BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE BURSAR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO is not a grantmaking organization per se in that its fundamental mission and purpose for tax-exempt status relates to education. However, in the course of its mission-related activities, the University does make payments that meet the definition of "grantmaking" as defined by the instructions to Schedule I of Form 990. These payments fall into two categories: (1) Student Financial Aid - the University OFFERS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED BY: THE UNIVERSITY; FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; SOCIAL, FRATERNAL, PROFESSIONAL, AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS; EMPLOYERS, BOTH PRESENT AND PROSPECTIVE; AND FRIENDS AND GRADUATES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO. The University's Financial Aid is awarded to students who demonstrate eligibility based on financial need, compete in intercollegiate athletics, demonstrate academic merit, or commit time and skills after graduation to the U.S. Armed Forces. Students and their parents complete extensive application materials, submit tax returns and other documents to support their claim for financial assistance. The Office of Financial Aid determines students' eligibility for need-based aid. Various academic departments determine eligibility for merit-based aid; (2) Charitable Contributions - charitable contributions are made in accordance with University policy and all applicable laws and regulations.

Grants and assistance in furtherance of the institutions exempt programs are made to domestic students in college programs in accordance with established college procedures or are subject to conditions established by the institutions governing board designed to ensure that individuals receiving grants are adequately investigated to ensure that they are qualifying recipients. Such awards are made only to the extent of the cost of education further, recipients are judged worthy by the institutions assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards. The scholarships and grants are credited directly to the students account and the students do not have direct access to the funds for any other use.
THE COLLEGE PROVIDES ONGOING OVERSIGHT AND MONITORING TO ASSURE THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THE INTENDED PURPOSES AND TIMELY EXPENDITURES OF GRANT FUNDS.

Grants and Scholarships Monitored by MidAmerica Nazarene University: Institutional- Awarded based on financial need, merit, and donor criteria. Amounts will vary depending on awards and funding limits. The Student Financial Aid Services Office monitors the student progress towards their educational goal to ensure compliance with institutional polices. Students failing to meet the institutional polices risk loss of institutional aid. Federal and State- Awarded based on Federal and State regulations, based on financial need, academic standards of the programs, and funding availability. The Student Financial Aid Services Office monitors the student progress towards their educational goal to ensure compliance with Federal and State polices. Students failing to meet the Federal and State polices risk loss of Federal and State aid. Employee Tuition Scholarship- Eligible employees and family members can apply for tuition scholarships (tuition remission). The amount is based on title, length of employment, and other institutional aid.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE US
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID FUNDS EACH YEAR BASED UPON A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED. ADDITIONALLY, THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES INSTITUTIONAL AID VIA UNIVERSITY GRANTS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER STANDARDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID VERIFIES THE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS AND THE PERSONAL INCOME DATA PROVIDED FOR ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) OF EACH STUDENT TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF AID AWARDED ON AN AS NEEDED BASIS. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS FUNDED THROUGH SPECIAL ENDOWMENTS AND DONATIONS, WHICH ARE AWARDED BASED ON SIMILAR STANDARDS AS WELL AS DONOR'S CRITERIA. THE OFFICES OF FINANCIAL AID AND FINANCE CONTINUOUSLY MONITOR STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: USE OF GRANT FUNDING MUST COMPLY WITH THE INSTITUTION'S PURCHASING POLICY AND FEDERAL GUIDELINES. PRIMARY INVESTIGATORS ARE ULTIMATELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE USE OF THOSE FUNDS UNDER THE REVIEW OF THE CONTRACT AND GRANTS ACCOUNTING MANAGER THAT MONITORS THEIR COMPLIANCE. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE IS SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL AUDIT (UNIFORM GUIDANCE) ENSURING AN OUTSIDE OPINION ON THE INSTITUTION'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED BASED ON MANUAL AND/OR ELECTRONIC VERIFICATION OF ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. THE SYSTEM DISBURSEMENT OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT OCCURS ONLY AFTER GLOBAL AND ITEM SPECIFIC DISBURSEMENT ELIGIBILITY RULES ARE MET. UPON DISBURSEMENT, PAYMENT ALLOCATION RULES IN THE SYSTEM ALLOCATE THE SCHOLARSHIPS TO APPROPRIATE PREDEFINED CHARGES. AFTERWARDS DISBURSEMENT AUDITS ARE COMPLETED AT VARIOUS TIME INTERVALS TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY.

The College maintains complete records for the grants and scholarships provided to all individuals. Those records indicate the criteria used to award the grants, documentation supporting the grantee's eligibility of the award, and substantiation of the amounts awarded. Documentation is also maintained as to when and how the funds are utilized. Where appropriate, periodic reports are prepared, summarizing the allocation of funds, and a reconciliation of the amounts spent for each grant and scholarship is completed. The College employs individuals whose primary responsibilities are to oversee the process of distributing financial grants and scholarships. The number of scholarship and grant recipients for the cost of attendance are tracked by the administrative system. The number of faculty and student recipients of research awards are estimated based on the type of grants awarded and the number of participants.
ALL STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR TUITION AND RELATED EXPENSES AT THE UNIVERSITY.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS: ALL GRANT FUNDS ARE DETERMINED AND AWARDED BY THE OFFICE OF ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT AND STUDENT FINANCIAL AID CONSISTENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICIES AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES. GRANTEES MUST MAINTAIN PREDETERMINED ACADEMIC LEVELS IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR SUBSEQUENT GRANTS. THE SCHOOL HAS AN ANNUAL CHARITY WEEK WHERE STUDENTS RAISE FUNDS AND VOTE ON ORGANIZATIONS TO GIVE DONATIONS. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT MONITOR ANY USE OF THE ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO THE CHOSEN ORGANIZATIONS. THE PURPOSE OF CHARITY WEEK IS TO TEACH THE STUDENTS THE VALUE OF GIVING TO CHARITIES THEY BELIEVE ARE WORTH GIVING ASSISTANCE.

THESE FUNDS REPRESENT FINANCIAL AID ISSUED TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, TUITION DISCOUNTS, AND INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FROM FRANCISCAN UNIVERSITY ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THEY MEET THE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE RESPECTIVE AWARD. ALL AID IS PROCESSED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND IS POSTED TO THE STUDENTS' RECEIVABLE ACCOUNTS.

THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BY CLEARY UNIVERSITY ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AND FEE CHARGES ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE UNIVERSITY IS ABLE TO MONITOR WHETHER RECIPIENTS REMAIN STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY THROUGH THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE, AND CLASS ATTENDANCE TAKEN BY PROFESSORS.

GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS STUDENT TUITION ACCOUNTS FOR ANY STUDENT WHO RECEIVED A SCHOLARSHIP OR TUITION CREDIT. THE BURSAR'S OFFICE AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ENSURE THAT STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS OR TUITION CREDITS MAINTAIN FULL-TIME OR PART-TIME STUDENT STATUS AND MEET ALL OTHER REQUIREMENTS, AS REQUIRED BY THE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIP, SO THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

STUDENT ENROLLMENT IS MONITORED ON A REGULAR BASIS. AFTER VERIFICATION OF ENROLLMENT EACH TERM, FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS' EDUCATIONAL COSTS PER FEDERAL REGULATIONS. STUDENT WITHDRAWALS ARE ALSO MONITORED AND GRANT FUNDS ARE ADJUSTED AND RETURNED AS NECESSARY. EXPENSES AND INCOME FOR OTHER GRANTS ARE TRACKED IN ACCOUNTS SET UP SPECIFICALLY FOR THE GRANT. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A PROJECT INVESTIGATOR THAT OVERSEES THE SPENDING OF THE FUNDS AND ENSURES THEY ARE USED AS INTENDED.

STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FAFSA. ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED BY THE APPLICABLE FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES, BY THEIR ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS, AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS ARE APPROPRIATELY AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE AWARDS ARE TRANSFERRED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT FUNDS ARE RECONCILED EACH SEMESTER AND REPORTED TO THE APPROPRIATE AUTHORITIES OR AGENCIES. FUNDS ARE ALSO AUDITED ANNUALLY.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS MERIT-BASED SCHOLARHSIPS TO INCOMING FRESHMAN AS WELL AS CONTINUING STUDENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO FRESHMAN ARE DETERMINED BY THE ADMISSIONS COMMITTEE. ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED THROUGH A COMBINATION OF THEIR UNDERGRADUATE CUMULATIVE SCIENCE GPA, RANKING OF THE COLLEGE ATTENDED, AND THE SCORE ACHIEVED ON THE MCAT, A STANDARDIZED MEDICAL SCHOOL ADMISSIONS TEST. FOR CONTINUING STUDENTS, THE TOP FIVE STUDENTS WITH A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 3.7 OR HIGHER FOR EACH GRADE, 2ND, 3RD, AND 4TH YEAR STUDENTS, RECEIVE THESE SCHOLARSHIPS. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT NEED TO MONITOR THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THOSE AMOUNTS ARE DIRECTLY SPENT TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION. THERE IS NO OPPORTUNITY FOR THE FUNDS TO BE DIRECTED FOR ANOTHER PURPOSE.

Grants or assistance provided is for scholarships and grants to Simpson College students which are applied directly to the student's tuition charges. The Office of Financial Assistance awards scholarships and grants to students based on a variety of different criteria for each scholarship.

ALL STUDENT AID, GRANTS, WORK STUDY AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN ON BEHALF OF STUDENTS ATTENDING SITTING BULL COLLEGE. THE FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE TUITION, BOOKS, AND FEES FOR THE CORRESPONDING STUDENT TO ENSURE THAT IT IS USED FOR THE APPROPRIATE PURPOSES.

An institutional agreement is signed between McMaster and the grantee stating that the grantee institution is responsible for following the policies, procedures and regulations of the granting agency. At a minimum, an annual statement of expenditures is provided to McMaster and is reviewed for ineligible/non-compliance issues. McMaster can require an audit at any time, if necessary.

CARROLL COLLEGE AND FEDERAL NEED-BASED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE FEDERAL FAFSA AND NEEDS ANALYSIS. NEW STUDENT MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA AND TEST SCORES OR TRANSFER GPA FOR TRANSFER STUDENTS. STATE GRANT REPORTING IS COMPLETED EACH YEAR AFTER THE ACADEMIC YEAR IS COMPLETED. FEDERAL FISAP REPORTING IS COMPLETED PRIOR TO OCTOBER OF EACH YEAR FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U. S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVERALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

The University consistently strives to place an outstanding higher education within the financial reach of all qualified applicants. The University awards millions of dollars in federal and state financial aid funds each year based upon a student's financial need. Additionally, the University provides financial aid via University grants-in-aid, scholarships and tuition remission. Grants-in-Aid are awarded on the basis of demonstrated financial need assessed by the use of a standard financial aid application, currently the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA), which analyzes the family income data provided on the FAFSA through the mandated Federal Methodology. All need-based financial aid must be awarded according to a student's calculated financial need. Scholarship awards are primarily provided on scholastic achievement. University scholarships are highly competitive and available to students through a combination of academic achievement and personal commitment, display of values, compassion, and pursuit of excellence which embody the spirit and mission of the University. The University has many scholarships funded through special endowments and donations. In most instances, academic merit and financial need are considered along with the particular requirements of the scholarship selection process. Also, various associations, corporations, foundations and unions provide scholarships for recipients whom they select.

SCHEDULE I PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE HAS DESIGNED AND IMPLEMENTED INTERNAL CONTROLS THAT INCLUDE FINANCIAL REPORTING AS WELL AS INTERNAL CONTROL OVER COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATIONS AND GRANT AGREEMENTS. INCLUDED IN THE INTERNAL CONTROL STRUCTURE IS A COMPREHENSIVE GRANTS AND CONTRACTS POLICY THAT PROVIDES THE ECKERD COLLEGE COMMUNITY GUIDELINES FOR GRANTS RECORDKEEPING, REPORTING AND MANAGEMENT. THE FINANCIAL AID AND BUSINESS OFFICES HAVE PRIMARY ROLES IN THE MONITORING OF GRANT FUNDS WHICH INCLUDES PROCEDURES FOR FINANCIAL REPORTING, FUNDS REQUESTS, INVOICING, REIMBURSEMENTS, PROGRAM ACTIVITY OVERSIGHT, PURCHASES, CLOSE OUT AND POST AWARD COMPLIANCE. THE BUSINESS OFFICE COMMUNICATES DIRECTLY AND FREQUENTLY WITH FACULTY AND STAFF MEMBERS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL COLLEGE POLICIES. THE COLLEGE IS ALSO SUBJECT TO EXTERNAL AUDITS WHICH ARE PERFORMED AT LEAST PERFORMED AT LEAST ANNUALLY.
D.R.E.A.M. PARTNERSHIP MAINTAINS ALL NECESSARY GRANT DOCUMENTATION. ALSO, GRANTS ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY GRANT POLICY IS CONTAINED IN ALL ADMISSIONS MATERIAL, IN THE UNIVERSITY CATALOG, AND CAN ALSO BE FOUND ON THE UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE. THE UNIVERSITY USES A MATRIX MODEL TO AWARD MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIP AID AT THE TIME A STUDENT IS ADMITTED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE AMOUNT AWARDED IS BASED ON THE STUDENT'S HIGHEST SAT OR ACT SCORES AND WEIGHTED CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE.
