ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE DETERMINED IN CONJUNCTION WITH A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC AND THE FAMILY'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION TO DETERMINE THE EXACT SIZE AND COMPOSITION OF THE FINAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGES. THE TYPICAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE CONSISTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN A WORK STUDY PROGRAM WHICH SUPPLEMENTS EACH FAMILY'S CONTRIBUTION TO THE TOTAL COST OF EDUCATION. THE AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) CONTAINING INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT AND PARENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE CLOSELY MONITORS ANY CHANGES IN THE STATUS OF FINANCIAL AWARD RECIPIENTS THAT WOULD RESULT IN A CORRESPONDING CHANGE IN THE AMOUNT OF AID AWARDED. ANY SUCH CHANGES ARE AUTOMATICALLY DETECTED AND REPORTED BY A SERIES OF SPECIAL REPORTS THAT ARE RUN ON A REGULAR BASIS. MOREOVER, THE OFFICE OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS ENSURES THAT THE CHARGES TO WHICH THE FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE APPLIED ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE INTENDED USE OF THE AWARDS.

WILKES UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM OF FINANCIAL AID TO ASSIST STUDENTS IN THE FINANCING OF THEIR EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS BOTH MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED GRANTS TO UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. UNDERGRADUATE MERIT AWARDS ARE BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL ACHIEVEMENT INCLUDING SAT SCORES AND HIGH SCHOOL CLASS RANK. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID TO HAVE THEIR ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED DETERMINED. GRADUATE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE DISTANT EDUCATION PROGRAM.

THE MAJORITY OF GRANT FUNDS AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE IN THE FORM OF FINANCIAL AID TO ITS STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS NEED AND MERIT BASE AID BASED ON THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE UNIVERSITY. THE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM AT SETON HILL UNIVERSITY ASSISTS STUDENTS WHO WOULD FIND IT DIFFICULT OR IMPOSSIBLE TO ATTEND COLLEGE WITHOUT SOME FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM OF FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, PART-TIME EMPLOYMENT, AND DEFERRED PAYMENT SCHEDULES, AND COORDINATES ITS PROGRAMS WITH THE FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. ANY OF THESE FORMS OF FINANCIAL AID MAY BE OFFERED INDEPENDENTLY OR IN VARIOUS COMBINATIONS TO A STUDENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ESTIMATES THE COST OF ATTENDING SETON HILL UNIVERSITY BY ADDING TUITION, ROOM, BOARD AND FEES PLUS AN ESTIMATE FOR BOOKS, SUPPLIES, TRANSPORTATION FROM HOME TO SCHOOL AND PERSONAL EXPENSES. THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID AN APPLICANT RECEIVES IS BASED ON THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TOTAL COSTS AND THE AMOUNT THE STUDENT AND FAMILY ARE ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE TOWARD COSTS AS DETERMINED BY THE NEEDS ANALYSIS FORM.
Students receiving scholarships are evaluated by the College's assessment of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards.

Each fiscal year the president's leadership team determines the amount of scholarships and discounts for the year. Awards are based on different criteria and are tracked within the approved budget. Student aid is handled by the student finance office and credited directly to the student's account. Each student applies for financial aid by filling out the free application for federal student aid (FAFSA). The award is based on information provided in this application. Students can also apply for grants and scholarship based on eligibility.

Arcadia University awards both need-based and merit-based financial aid to students in good academic standing. The University maintains records to quantify the dollar amount of the financial assistance awarded, the number of recipients per grant/scholarship, and the selection criteria. All grants and scholarships awarded to students are credited directly to the student's billing account.

COE COLLEGE RECEIVES VARIOUS FEDERAL GRANTS FROM NSF, DEPT OF EDUCATION AND OTHER AGENCIES OR BRANCHES OF THE US GOVERNMENT. SEPARATE ACCOUNTS ARE USED FOR EACH GRANT TO MONITOR RECEIPTS AND DISBURSEMENTS. THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS APPROPRIATE ACCOUNTING AND INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES. ALL REQUIRED FINANCIAL REPORTING TO THE GRANT PROVIDER ARE COMPLETED TIMELY AND AUDITS BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM ARE DONE WHEN REQUIRED. THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY COMPLETES FILINGS REQUIRED BY UNIFORM GUIDANCE. DISTRIBUTIONS TO STUDENTS ARE MADE ACCORDING TO GRANT REQUIREMENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE OFFICE OF ADVANCEMENT WORKS WITH DONORS TO ESTABLISH GUIDELINES FOR THE USE AND DISBURSEMENT OF ANY DONATED FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE DONOR'S WISHES AND WITHIN PRACTICAL AND LEGAL PROCESSES. THE DONOR'S RESTRICTIONS ("WISHES") ARE PUT IN WRITING WITH COPIES MAINTAINED IN THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE, THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, IF APPLICABLE. IF THE DONATION IS FOR GRANTS OR SCHOLARSHIPS TO BE DISTRIBUTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS A SPREADSHEET OF GRANT TITLES AND RESTRICTIONS WHICH ARE UPDATED AS NEEDED AS WELL AS A PERMANENT ELECTRONIC FILE. THE GRANTS OR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE "MATCHED" WITH AN ELIGIBLE RECIPIENT BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE WILL RECEIVE A LIST OF THESE RECIPIENTS IN THE FALL AND AN UPDATED LIST IN THE EARLY SPRING. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE REVIEWS THE LIST AND PREPARES LUNCHEON INVITATIONS FOR MOST OF THE RECIPIENTS AND DONORS. THE FINAL STEP IN THE PROCESS IS A RANDOM AUDIT CONDUCTED ONCE A YEAR BY AN OUTSIDE AUDIT FIRM.

NEED-BASED GRANTS WERE AWARDED TO WARREN WILSON COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED ON FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR STUDENT AID) RESULTS. FAFSA RESULTS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE CONSIDERED FOR MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, BUT MANY OF THESE DOLLARS WERE USED TO MEET THE FEDERAL DEFINITION OF 'NEED'.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE UTILIZES SYSTEMS DESIGNED FOR FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS AND MONITORS THE ACTIVITY AND USES OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GRANTS FUNDS WITH THE APPROPRIATE CRITERIA ON AN ONGOING BASIS.

EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY AWARDS TUITION GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS. THE GRANTS REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF TUITION AND FEES THAT THAT STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO PAY TO THE SEMINARY. THE SEMINARY MAINTAINS RECORDS OF THE GRANTS AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS.
MONITORING THE GRANTS BY REQUIRING THE GRANTEE TO SUBMIT REPORTS. IN CERTAIN SITUATIONS, SITE VISITS ARE MADE TO ASCERTAIN COMPLIANCE TO GRANT AGREEMENTS.

Federal and State Grants are awarded based on Federal Title IV and state higher educational compliance requirements. Institutional Scholarships are awarded based upon parameters established by each endowment fund and are monitored by a university scholarship committee. Scholarships are awarded without respect to race, creed & color.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

NORTHWEST NAZARENE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE USE OF ITS GRANT FUNDS AS REQUIRED BY THE INDIVIDUAL GRANT PROGRAMS AND DONOR CRITERIA ESTABLISHED AT THE TIME OF THE ORIGINAL DONATION. THESE ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE ANNUAL AUDITING PROCESS AS WELL AS THROUGH FEDERAL AND STATE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. ISIR/FAFSA AND HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS SHOWING ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANTS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE STUDENT'S FILE FOR A PERIOD OF 7 YEARS AFTER THE STUDENT WITHDRAWS OR FINISHES THEIR PROGRAMS. GRANT AMOUNTS APPEAR ON THE AWARD LETTER IN THE FILE AS WELL AS ON THE INDIVIDUAL'S FINANCIAL AID RECORD IN THE DATABASE.

BOSTON COLLEGE AWARDS NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING GRANTS AND LOANS TO STUDENTS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC PROGRESS. AID IS ADMINISTERED BY THE STUDENT SERVICES OFFICE. STUDENTS AND THEIR PARENTS COMPLETE EXTENSIVE APPLICATION MATERIALS, SUBMIT TAX RETURNS AND OTHER DOCUMENTS TO SUPPORT THEIR CLAIM FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE MAKES A LIMITED NUMBER OF SCHOLARSHIPS AVAILABLE BASED ON ACADEMIC OR ATHLETIC ACHIEVEMENT. ON OCCASION BOSTON COLLEGE MAY PROVIDE GRANTS TO 501(C)(3) AND GOVERNMENT ENTITIES. THESE GRANTS ARE PROVIDED AT THE COLLEGE'S DISCRETION. PART III, COLUMN (C) THE CASH GRANT IS REFLECTED ON STUDENTS ACCOUNTS. SOME OF THE GRANTS LISTED MAY HOWEVER, BE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT VIA ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AS A MONTHLY 'NON SERVICE STIPEND'. THE GRANTS ALSO INCLUDE BOOK VOUCHERS, LOAN FORGIVENESS AND CHILDREN'S CENTER AID.
SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THEIR ACCOUNT WITH THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET TUITION AND OTHER SIMILAR COSTS. NO CASH IS AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS.

EACH YEAR APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AN ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF VERIFY THE INFORMATION REPORTED ON THE APPLICATION AND AWARD EACH SCHOLARSHIP TO A QUALIFIED CANDIDATE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DOES NOT AWARD ANY AID TO A STUDENT WHO IS NOT ENROLLED. EACH SEMESTER A LIST OF ENROLLED STUDENTS IS COMPARED TO A LIST OF STUDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN AWARDED ANY TYPE OF FINANCIAL AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE KEPT IN STORAGE FOR SEVEN YEARS. PREVIOUSLY UNFUNDED APPLICANTS FOR GRANT MONIES FROM BEREA COLLEGE APPALACHIAN FUND (BCAF) FOLLOW CRITERIA AND A FORMAT WHICH ARE CLEARLY STATED ON THE PROGRAM WEBSITE: HTTP://WWW.BEREA.EDU/APPALACHIANFUND/APPLYINGFORGRANT.ASP. PREVIOUSLY FUNDED APPLICANTS MUST PROVIDE A DETAILED REPORT ON THE USE OF THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S GRANT FUNDING. THIS FORMAT AND CRITERIA ARE LOCATED ON THE SAME LOCATION OF THE BCAF WEBSITE. IN ADDITION, THE BCAF SPONSORS A GRANTEE CONFERENCE EACH SPRING WHEN ALL GRANTEES FOR THAT YEAR MEET AND CONDUCT PUBLIC PRESENTATIONS OF THEIR GRANT FUNDED WORK. THE BCAF IS IN REGULAR CONTACT WITH GRANTEES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, VISITING EACH NEW GRANTEE AND REPEAT GRANTEES WHERE POSSIBLE. The staff of Grow Appalachia, including the director and two assistant directors, all individually review funding proposals from the potential partner sites for quality of programming, outreach activities and budget line items. This staff then meet as a group and discuss each proposal and either approve them as submitted, reject them out of hand, accept them conditionally asking for clarification or request more information to allow a sound decision. When the information requests are met the staff meet again and either accept or reject the proposal. Grow Appalachia also has an advisory board consisting of college and non-college members who are kept informed of Grow Appalachia's activities and program direction and who then offer advice and counsel for the program. FEDERAL, STATE, INSTITUTIONAL AND OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL INFORMATION GAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) THAT IS COMPLETED EACH YEAR. A THIRD-PARTY SOFTWARE VENDOR PROVIDES THE FEDERAL REGULATIONS BY WHICH GRANTS ARE GIVEN. THE FAFSA INFORMATION COMES FROM ELECTRONIC FILES WHICH ARE PASSWORD PROTECTED.ALL STUDENT APPLICATIONS FOR GRANTS ARE STORED ELECTRONICALLY AND ARE PASSWORD PROTECTED. DISBURSEMENTS ARE REVIEWED DAILY TO INSURE ACCURACY.
Scholarships are determined by FAFSA requirements, and need base.
ORGANIZATION RECEIVES OFFICIAL RECEIPTS FOR THE GRANTS GIVEN

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID & SCHOLARSHIPS. FULL FINANCIAL SUPPORT IS OFFERED TO ALL STUDENTS. ALL PHD STUDENTS AT TTIC MAY EXPECT TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL SUPPORT THAT COVERS TUITION AND A STIPEND TO ASSIST WITH LIVING EXPENSES.

PART I, LINE 2 THE UNiVERSITY OFFERS A WIDE VARIETY OF MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. MERIT AWARDS ARE GIVEN IN RECOGNITION OF VARIOUS ACHIEVEMENTS AS SPECIFIED IN DONORS' CORRESPONDENCE AND DOCUMENTS. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE PROVIDED BASED ON THE INCOME LEVEL AVAILABILITY OF AWARDS OFFERED ELSEWHERE AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY ONLY MAKES SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS THAT HELP OFFSET THE TUITION OF THE STUDENTS. THE GRANTS ARE DIRECTLY CREDITED AGAINST THE APPLICABLE STUDENT ACCOUNT WHICH ASSURES PROPER USE OF THE GRANT. THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANT IS ADJUSTED, AS NECESSARY, BASED ON ANY SUBSEQUENT CHANGES AFFECTING THE STUDENT'S ORIGINAL ELIGIBILITY.
The Purtian Reformed Theological Seminary Foundation exists to support the Seminary. The Foundation manages the long term investments to provide operational and scholarship funds for the Seminary.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY REGISTRAR AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE FINANCE OFFICE FOR GPA REQUIREMENTS, ENROLLMENT REQUIREMENTS AND OTHER ISSUES. REVIEWS ARE DONE REGULARLY.

RECORDS OF GRANTS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, AND ARE PERIODICALLY RECONCILED WITH BUSINESS OFFICE RECORDS, INCLUDING THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND INSTITUTIONAL BUDGET.

Scholarships issued to University students are applied to the student's account. A list of scholarship, fellowship and grant assistance awarded is on file at the University. Although there may be recipients who are related to persons having interest in the University, such persons are selected on an equal and objective basis as with other recipients. All students receiving assistance are selected on the University's criteria for academic and financial need, and other similar criteria. The University does not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, ethnic or racial origin, physical or mental disability, marital or veteran status in administration of scholarships or loans. Also, note that the University provides remitted tuition to qualified faculty, staff and certain dependents as a benefit of employment. The University monitors the student accounts and eligibility.
THE TRUST DOCUMENT SPECIFIES THAT CERTAIN FUNDS ARE TO BE DISTRIBUTED TO THE OTHER TRUSTS AND TO THE COLLEGE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The University enters into their computer system (POISE), as budgeted amounts, the amounts that the Department of Education has allocated to be awarded to eligible students. The Financial Aid Department prints out a fund report from POISE that shows the budget amount, how much has been awarded, and how much is available to be awarded. Then the Financial Aid Department awards to each student who has applied for financial aid and meets the University's qualifications, State, and federal guidelines for financial aid the amount that the student is eligible to receive. The amounts that the student receives are credited to their account at the University, then the University automatically deducts tuition, books, and University fees. If there is a balance remaining, it is then refunded to the student. The Financial Aid Department is audited each year by independent certified public accountants.

THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS SEVERAL TYPES OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS UPON ADMISSION AND CREDITED AGAINST THEIR TUITION EACH QUARTER AS LONG AS GPA REQUIREMENTS ARE MET AND MAINTAINED. GPA IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE AND VERIFIED THROUGH THE STUDENT RECORDS PROGRAM. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE UPON ADMISSION BASED ON APPLICATION AND ESSAY SUBMISSION. THE SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE ONE TIME OR RECUR EACH QUARTER, DEPENDING ON THE TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP. THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT MONITORS APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS, AND THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE REGISTRAR, MONITORS QUARTERLY ELIGIBILITY OF RECURRING SCHOLARSHIPS. OTHER LIMITED ONE-TIME SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE AWARDED AT THE DISCRETION OF THE UNIVERSITY PRESIDENT. THE CURRENT YEAR DISBURSEMENTS WERE FUNDED BY THE SCHOOL AS LENDER PROGRAM.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A GRANTS ADMINISTRATOR WHO MONITORS ALL EXPENDITURES TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH GRANTOR POLICIES AND REGULATIONS. IN ADDITION, AN ACCOUNTANT IS ASSIGNED TO RECORD AND REPORT ALL GRANT REVENUES AND EXPENDITURES TO THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR AND GRANTOR ON A REGULAR BASIS.

ADLER GRADUATE SCHOOL PROVIDES 10% TUITION DISCOUNTS TO ELIGIBLE ALUMNI, PERSONS OFFICIALLY REGISTERED AS A MEMBER OF A NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBAL GROUP, PERSONS WHO ARE ACTIVE IN OR AN HONORABLY DISCHARGED VETERAN OF A BRANCH OF THE MILITARY AND THEIR SPOUSES, AND PERSONS CURRENTLY EMPLOYED WITH ONE OF EIGHT COMMUNITY PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. ALUMNI, MEMBERS OF NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBAL GROUPS, AND ACTIVE OR HONORABLY DISCHARGED MEMBERS OF THE MILITARY AND THEIR SPOUSES APPLY FOR THE DISCOUNT WHEN THEY APPLY FOR ENROLLMENT. EMPLOYEES OF COMMUNITY PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS MUST REAPPLY FOR THE DISCOUNT EACH TERM TO VERIFY CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK WITHIN FOURTEEN DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

Birmingham-Southern College has written criteria for scholarships and grants which require formal application or nomination. This paper trail is used for internal reports, audits and donor reports. Funds are tracked in our database software and individual files are maintained of grant/scholarship recipients. All material is subject to audit. Grant/Scholarship criteria is reviewed prior to disbursement.

The Chicago School of Professional Psychology gives need-based and merit-based scholarships. Need-based scholarships are monitored through the Department of Education FAFSA form. Students with $0 estimated family contribution (EFC), based on the Department of Education guidelines, will be automatically awarded a need-based scholarship. Merit-based scholarships are granted to students who submit all required documentation by certain deadlines and apply with a 4.0 undergraduate GPA or GRE score of 1300 (test taken prior to August 1, 2011) or a combined GRE score of 314 (test taken on or after August 1, 2011). The Chicago School and its partners award fellowships to students who contribute to the academic community in and outside the classroom. Fellowship recipients dedicate 10 to 15 hours a week of work to the specific department through which the fellowship is offered. Applicants are judged on their ability to demonstrate a commitment to learning, developing, and participating in the programmatic, research, and administrative activities within the department office.
SCHEDULE I, PART 1, LINE 2: ANNA MARIA COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN TITLE IV FUNDING. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FAFSA FORM TO APPLY FOR AID.

ALL GRANTS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS DIRECTLY, ACCORDING TO GOVERNMENT REGULATIONS. ALL OUTSIDE GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS AS PER THE INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE GRANTOR. LAKELAND UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS USING POWERFAIDS SOFTWARE WHICH IS VERIFIED WITH COD BEFORE DISBUSEMENTS ARE PROCESSED. FOR OUTSIDE AND OTHER INSTITUTIONAL AID, THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT FOLLOWS THE SAME PROCEDURES.

THE COLLEGE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNTS OF TUITION ASSISTANCE INCLUDING ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. THIS OFFICE ENSURES THAT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND MONITORS STUDENTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

FIELDING GRADUATE UNIVERSITY AWARDS TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE IMMEDIATELY APPLIED AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION CHARGES. FIELDING GRADUATE UNIVERSITY AWARDS RESEARCH GRANTS TO FACULTY MEMBERS AND STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY AND REQUIRES WRITTEN REPORTS FROM GRANT RECIPIENTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS THROUGH FINANCIAL AID, BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND FEDERAL OR STATE MANDATED REGULATIONS. DONOR RESTRICTED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ALSO MONITORED AND DISTRIBUTED THROUGH FINANCIAL AID PROCESSES TO COVER EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES ESTIMATED OR CHARGED BY THE UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grants and Other Assistance to Individuals in the United States: Scholarships and fellowships that are awarded to students are paid through the students' accounts, the Payroll Office, and/or Accounts Payable Office and are administered based upon merit and/or need. Baylor's Financial Aid Office reviews the students' cumulative grade point averages every year and awards/reviews academic scholarships and fellowships if the required grade point average level is satisfied. Scholarships for financial need are awarded annually based upon whether the need criterion/level is established or maintained per the completed Application for Federal Student Aid. The scholarship awards that are included in the cost of attendance are reviewed so as not to exceed the cost of a student to attend the University. Scholarships and/or fellowships are also awarded to cover student emergency situations. Students must complete an application describing the emergency situation. The University reviews each application to determine if such scholarships/fellowships will be awarded. Travel Grants - Travel grants are awarded to students to offset travel expenses used for educational purposes such as attending a conference, presenting a paper, etc. The awarding of travel grants is based upon an application process and meeting a set of criteria that establish the benefits to the students' educational endeavors. Research Grants - The Office of the Vice Provost for Research (OVPR) publishes guidelines for each of the internal grant programs that provide the general conditions of the award, as well as guidance on the expenses that may be charged to the award. Each grant is set up as a separate project in the University's financial system based on the award amount and budget categories approved by the OVPR and administered through the Office of Sponsored Programs. The financial system provides real time access to a Budget Summary Report for the project that provides a comparison of budgeted expenditures to cumulative actual expenditures by expenditure category. This report can be accessed by the Project Manager and others with administrative and financial oversight responsibilities. Expenditure transactions under internal grant programs are subject to internal controls for approval and processing similar to other University expenditure transactions. The system does not allow expenditures to be processed in excess of or outside of the approved budget categories. Student Awards - These awards are provided to students for winning educational competitions. The purpose of the competitions is to further the education of students. Grants and Other Assistance to Governments and Organizations in the United States: The University enters into a contract with the grant recipient that describes the recipient's responsibilities for the use of the grant funds. Under the terms of the contract, recipients are required to submit quarterly and final written progress reports to the principal investigator ("PI") or project director for the grant, and funds are paid to the recipient on a cost reimbursable basis. When the grant recipient submits an invoice for reimbursement, the PI reviews the invoice to ensure the expenditures are consistent with the established budget and with the work completed to date, prior to approving the amount for payment. Grant recipients subject to the U.S. Office of Management and Budget Circular A-133 Audits of States, Local Governments, and Non-Profit Organizations are also required to provide certification of their compliance with the financial audit requirements of those guidelines prior to receiving funds. Thereafter, the University requires an annual certification of continuing compliance and a copy of their most recent audit report. If any of the above processes indicate an area of concern, site visits may be conducted by the University to review the programmatic and/or financial records. Charitable organizations that receive contributions from the University are carefully selected and must be approved through the Chief of Staff to the President & Vice President for Board Relations. Student organizations that are provided University grants must complete an application describing the need for the grant. University contributions must support the University's interest and be consistent with the University's core values.

GGU DISBURSES FUNDS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES WITHIN THE MEANING OF IRC SECTION 170(C)(2). DISBURSEMENTS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE AWARDS OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATIONAL PURSUITS. SEE GGU'S SCHOLARSHIP POLICY: HTTP://WWW.GGU.EDU/ENROLLMENT/FINANCIAL-AID/SCHOLARSHIPS-AND-GRANTS

THE COLLEGE HAS A LIMITED AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT IS AVAILABLE TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS THROUGH ITS SCHOLARSHIP FUND. AWARDS ARE MADE ANNUALLY AND ARE DIVIDED OVER THE FALL AND SPRING TERM ENROLLMENTS. GENERAL QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS OF SOME OF THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BY THE COLLEGE ARE AS FOLLOWS: CHRISTIAN WORKERS GRANT - FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHOSE PARENTS ARE IN FULL-TIME CHRISTIAN MINISTRY ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS GRANT. TRINITY COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP - NEW FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHO HAVE A MINIMUM ACT COMPOSITE SCORE OF 19 OR A MINIMUM COMBINED SAT SCORE OF 950 ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS SCHOLARSHIP. TRINITY COLLEGE GRANT - THIS GRANT IS AWARDED TO NEW OR CONTINUING FULL-TIME STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED. PAST OR EXPECTED STUDENT LEADERSHIP IS CONSIDERED. THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS DOCUMENTING THE SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA, THE RECIPIENT SELECTION PROCESS, THE AMOUNT REWARDED, AND THE QUALIFIED EXPENSES FOR WHICH THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP GRANTED.

A STUDENT MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION FOR THE GIVEN ACADEMIC YEAR. THE STuDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN A DEGREE SEEKING PROGRAM; NON MATRICULATED STUDENTS ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. STUDENTS MUST ENROLL FOR AT LEAST 6 CREDITS TO RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDS, EXCEPT STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY FOR THE PELL GRANT PROGRAM. UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 2.0 AND GRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 3.0 EACH SEMESTER.

ALL STUDENT AWARDS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE SYSTEM. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL AND OTHER DATA PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT AND VERIFIED, AS APPROPRIATE, BY THE UNIVERSITY. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL AUDIT BASED ON STANDARDS FOUND IN THE UNIFORM GUIDANCE AND PERFORMED BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. SELECTION CRITERIA FOR DONOR-FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MOSTLY DETERMINED BY THE DONOR AND IS AVAILABLE IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. SELECTION CRITERIA FOR FEDERAL AND STATE AID IS ALSO FOUND IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE INTERNET.
Scholarship assistance is approved and monitored for individuals through campus scholarship committees and an institutional financial aid director.
NICHOLS COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN TITLE IV FUNDING. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FAFSA FORM TO APPLY FOR AID.
STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS MONITORED BY INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND A COMMITTEE OF EMPLOYEES WITH RESPONSIBILITY TO ENSURE THE INSTRUCTION GUIDELINES ARE PROPERLY FOLLOWED.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND COMPLIES WITH THE FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS FOR AWARDING STUDENT AID.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Grants inside the US consist of student assistance paid to US students. The office of the registrar administers and monitors all awards. See www.queensu.ca/studentawards/financialassistance for more details.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: A list of scholarship recipients is on file at the institution and is available upon request. Although there may be recipients who are related to persons having an interest in the institution, such recipients are selected on an equal, objectively determinable basis with other recipients. Saint Mary's College is committed to making it possible for qualified students to enroll at the college regardless of financial circumstances. As part of this commitment, Saint Mary's College offers various levels of academic scholarships, need-based scholarships and institutional grants. Academic scholarship recipients are selected at the time of admission, on the basis of their academic achievements in high school. Need-based scholarships are named for a specific donor or group, and are awarded as part of need-based institutional grant assistance, in accordance with the specific requirements of the scholarship donor. Institutional grants are awarded primarily on financial need as the College is committed to making a Saint Mary's education a possibility for students who demonstrate financial need; each student who applies for financial aid receives consideration for grant assistance. All students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need or other similar standards. Criteria for all scholarships is published and made available to all students and their families. Grant funds/scholarships are credited directly to a student's account to ensure they are used appropriately and for their intended purpose.

The financial aid planning office at Toccoa Falls College requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the College does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a College sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the College catalog and the College website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the College to ensure students remain eligible for funds awarded. Scholarships are applied directly to the student accounts.

THE GRANTEE, AUBURN UNIVERSITY, IS A SECTION 115 ENTITY. AS A LAND-GRANT INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION, ITS MAJOR SOURCE OF FUNDS ARE FEDERAL AND STATE APPROPRIATIONS AND THEREFORE, ITS DISBURSEMENTS ARE GOVERNED BY FEDERAL AND ALABAMA STATE LAWS. ITS TRANSACTIONS ARE SUBJECT TO PUBLIC DISCLOSURE. THE AUBURN UNIVERSITY REAL ESTATE FOUNDATION, INC. HAS ACCESS TO THE FINANCIAL RECORDS. GRANTS DESIGNATED FOR A SPECIFIC PURPOSE ARE CREDITED TO A FUND ESTABLISHED FOR THAT PURPOSE. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCUREMENT AND PAYMENT SERVICES OFFICE ENSURES COMPLIANCE WITH THE FUND'S RESTRICTIONS SUBJECT TO ANY APPLICABLE LAWS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS BASED ON SUPERIOR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING AWARDS FROM JOHN CARROLL UNIVERSITY ARE CHOSEN BASED UPON OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY CRITERIA WHICH ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE OVERALL TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE, ALL FUNDS ISSUED TO STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO STUDENT MAY USE THE FUNDS FOR OTHER THAN EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. SINCE THE STUDENTS HAVE NO DISCRETION IN THE USE OF THE FUNDS, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT NEED TO MONITOR THE GRANTS ONCE ISSUED.

DISBURSEMENTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THE INSTITUTION'S EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROCEDURES OR SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE INSTITUTION'S GOVERNING BOARD DESIGNED TO INSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS FROM THIS ORGANIZATION IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE ADEQUATELY INVESTIGATED TO INSURE THAT THEY ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS AS TO ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

Grants are made to students currently attending the seminary to enable them to live and study near the Puritan Reformed Theological Seminary. The Seminary is aware of the needs of the students and is able to monitor the use of the funds provided.

Gustavus offers both merit-based and need-based scholarship assistance. Merit-based scholarships do not require a student to demonstrate financial eligibility and must be awarded during the Admission process. They also may be awarded as part of a need-based financial aid package. To be renewed, the student needs to maintain the established minimum standards. Need-based scholarships are offered to students who demonstrate financial eligibility by filing the FAFSA. The offered amounts can vary from year to year as determined by the family's Estimated Family Contribution (EFC) on the FAFSA and availability of funds. The Registrar's office monitors any changes to a student's enrollment status. Any changes are communicated to the Student Accounts office and the Financial Assistance office to ensure funds are being properly disbursed. Also see Schedule F, Part V with respect to monitoring of students taking J-Term or semester studies outside of the United States.

THE UNIVERSITY DISTRIBUTES SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USING THE INFORMATION FROM THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID). MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE USING THE INFORMATION FROM THE STUDENT'S OFFICIAL HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS AND THE RESULTS OF THE STANDARDIZED TEST (ACT, SAT, ETC.). FOR STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS WITH RENEWAL CONDITIONS, FULFILLMENT OF THOSE CONDITIONS ARE VERIFIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTRATOR PRIOR TO THE AWARD BEING RENEWED (GPA, YEAR OF ATTENDANCE, ETC.)

Robert Morris University Illinois provides a number of grants/scholarship awards to eligible students based on various criteria such as financial need, merit, academic ability, academic major, and location of attendance. This gift assistance is supported by two important sources: the University reserves a portion of its budget for grants/scholarships, and financial support is contributed by faculty, staff, alumni and friends of the University.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: MARYVILLE UNIVERSITY USES FINANCIAL AID COMPUTER SOFTWARE THAT PROVIDES ALL DETAILS OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS TO RECIPIENTS TO INCLUDE ANNUAL AND CUMULATIVE AMOUNTS AND ELIGIBILITY. ALL GRANTS IN AID ARE POSTED AS A CREDIT TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

FOR FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID GRANTS, INDIVIDUAL FAFSA AND PERSONAL TAX RETURNS ARE VERIFIED FOR RECIPIENT ELIGIBILITY. SEVERAL LAYERS OF SUPERVISORY APPROVALS ARE BUILT INTO THE INTERNAL FINANCIAL AID PROCESS. FOR OTHER FEDERALLY FUNDED GRANTS (NIH, ETC.), ACTIVITY IS ADMINISTERED BY A DEDICATED EMPLOYEE, SUBJECT TO SEVERAL LAYERS OF SUPERVISORY REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PAYROLL COSTS AND OTHER ALLOCATED EXPENDITURES ARE DOCUMENTED AND REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE DEPT. AS WELL AT EXTERNAL AUDITORS.

ENDOWED AND ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON CERTAIN CRITERIA SET BY THE INSTITUTION (DUNWOODY) AND DONORS. STUDENTS APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS STARTING SPRING SEMESTER OF THE PREVIOUS SCHOOL YEAR. APPLICATIONS ARE COMPILED AND REVIEWED BY A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE CHOOSES THE STUDENT OR STUDENTS WHO ARE MOST DESERVING OF THE AWARD BASED ON THE CRITERIA AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS ARE NOTIFIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF THE ACCEPTANCE TO THE AWARDS WHICH THEN BECOME PART OF THEIR FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT AS A CREDIT ON A SEMIANNUAL BASIS WHICH REDUCES THEIR TUITION. STUDENTS WRITE THANK YOU NOTES TO DONORS OF SCHOLARSHIPS SHOWING THEIR APPRECIATION. IF A THANK YOU NOTE ISN'T WRITTEN, THE STUDENT DOESN'T RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS FROM SCHOOL, THE SCHOLARSHIP IS REVOKED.

GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED UPON APPLICATIONS FILED WITH THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE (FOR RETURNING STUDENTS), AND WITH THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT FOR FIRST SEMESTER ENTERING STUDENTS. THE DETERMINATION AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS IS ON A MERIT OR NEED BASIS. THE DETERMINATION IS ALSO BASED UPON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS AND CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY A DONOR OR THE COLLEGE. THE SOURCES OF FUNDS COME FROM TUITION, ENDOWMENTS (EITHER RESTRICTED BY A DONOR OR RESTRICTED INTERNALLY BY THE COLLEGE), PRIVATE NON-ENDOWMENT GRANTS, OR GRANTS FROM THE STATE OF TEXAS. ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE REVIEWED MONTHLY AGAINST THE BUDGET AND DIFFERENCES ARE ANALYZED AND RECONCILED. AT THE END OF EACH FISCAL YEAR, THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FEDERAL GRANTS AWARDED ARE AUDITED BY AN EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. IN ADDITION, THE STATE GRANTS ARE SUBJECT TO A REVIEW OF PROCEDURES BY THE SAME FIRM.
ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DETERIMINED BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE DONOR OR INSTITUTION.

FINANCIAL AID: HSC OFFERS A VARIETY OF ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. HSC ALSO OFFERS NEED-BASED GRANTS TO THOSE STUDENTS WITH DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED BASED ON FAMILY INCOME INFORMATION PROVIDED IN THE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE FINANCIAL AID PROFILE. SCHOLARSIHPS: THE OFFICE OF ADMISSION HAS PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR PROCESSING ALL SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS. THE OFFICE OF ADMISSION USES THE DATA SUBMITTED ON THE APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION IN ORDER TO AWARD SCHOLARSHIPS. THE ADMISSIONS COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE APPLICATIONS, INCLUDING LETTERS OF RECOMMENDATION, STUDENT ESSAY, AND EXTRA-CURRICULAR INVOLVEMENT. THE COMMITTEE RECOMMENDS THE LEVEL OF SCHOLARSHIP A STUDENT IS AWARDED. THIS INFORMATION IS THEN ADDED TO THE ADMISSION FILE AND THE SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNT IS FORWARDED TO THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. THE SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNT IS INCLUDED AS PART OF THE TOTAL FINANCIAL AID AWARD. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID NOTIFIES ALL STUDENTS IN WRITING CONCERNING THEIR FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: STUDENYS MUST MEET THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SPECIFIED IN THE APPLICABLE SCHOLARSHIP IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR AWARD. THESE REQUIREMENTS INCLUDE SUCH THINGS AS GRADE POINT AVERAGES, ECONOMIC NEED, ENROLLMENT IN A PARTICULAR PROGRAM, ETC. AS APPLICABLE, THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES FOR AWARDS.

The College grants to Benedict-Allen Community Development Corporation whose Chairman of the board is the College's President. Through this relationship, the College has oversight of the use of the grant funds. The College's procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds required verification of 1) enrollment status, 2) number of hours enrolled, 3) number of earned credit hours, 4) GPA, and 5) housing status. In addition, a review of student academic performance and grades of incomplete, if applicable, is conducted each semester to determine overall standing in relation to College's established Satisfactory Academic Policy (SAP). No cash changes hands and funds are directly tied to student accounts.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO ENROLLED STUDENTS. STUDENTS FILE A FAFSA FORM TO BE CONSIDERED FOR A GRANT AWARD. THE MAJORITY OF THE GRANT AWARDS ARE NEED-BASED AS DEFINED BY FEDERAL FORMULA. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ACCORDING TO DONOR SPECIFICATIONS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WHO ARE ACTIVE IN SCHOOL FUNCTIONS AND THE SOCIAL BETTERMENT OF HEALTH PROFESSIONS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS REFLECT AN APPRECIATION OF THE SERVICE COMMITMENT AS WELL AS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. GRANTS, LOANS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC STATUS, ABILITY TO BENEFIT AND OTHER CRITERIA. DOCUMENTATION OF STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MAINTAINED ON FILE IN THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND IS SUBJECT TO ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDIT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: BAPTIST MISSIONARY ASSOCIATION THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY UTILIZES A SPECIALIZED SOFTWARE PROGRAM TO TRACK THE USE OF FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. A PROSPECTIVE RECIPIENT APPLIES ONLINE THROUGH A GOVERNMENT WEB SITE WHO THEN SENDS THE INFORMATION TO THE SEMINARY. INFORMATION ON THE APPLICATION IS VERIFIED INTERNALLY AND, BASED ON GUIDELINES IN THE FEDERAL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID HANDBOOK, IT IS DETERMINED THE AMOUNT OF AID THE RECIPIENT QUALIFIES FOR. UPON RECEIPT OF THE FUNDS, PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS ACCOUNT.
COLLEGE ADVISING CORPS CONDUCTS MONITORING VISITS WITH THE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS.

GSSIMR PROVIDED FELLOWSHIP STIPENDS AND NON-CASH ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF HOUSING AND TRAVEL TO SUMMER SCHOLARS DURING THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE STOWERS SUMMER SCHOLARS PROGRAM. SEE PROGRAM DESCRIPTION ON SCHEDULE O RESPONSE TO FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4B.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY ENSURES THAT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR THEIR PROPER PURPOSE BY APPLYING THE AWARDED AMOUNT DIRECTLY AGAINST THE APPLICABLE STUDENT'S TUITION CHARGES.

GRANT MONITORING PROCESS Financial aid awards are disbursed to students based on the general criteria for institutional financial aid. GPA and enrollment are monitored to ensure these criteria are met.

THE INSTITUTE'S GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE WITHIN THE UNITED STATES CONSISTS PRIMARILY OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS ARE SELECTED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND SIMILAR STANDARDS. VARIOUS INSTITUTE OFFICES MONITOR ELIGIBILITY AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS BY GRANTEES. THE INSTITUTE MAKES AN ANNUAL $75,000 GRANT TO THE CALTECH Y. IN ADDITION, THE INSTITUTE ALLOWS THE CALTECH Y THE USE OF FACILITIES ON CAMPUS FREE OF CHARGE. THE CALTECH Y IS A RELATED ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO SUPPORT THE STUDENTS OF CALTECH THROUGH VARIOUS ACTIVITIES. THE INSTITUTE MAKES AN ANNUAL DONATION (DESIGNATED ASSISTANCE) TO THE UNITED WAY OF GREATER LOS ANGELES. INSTITUTE OFFICES MONITOR THE GRANTEES' PERFORMANCE ACCORDING TO THEIR RESPECTIVE PROGRAM SERVICES GOALS AND/OR PURSUANT TO OTHER AGREEMENTS.
COLUMN (C) CASH GRANTS REPRESENT CREDIT ON ACCOUNTS.

FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE FUNDED THROUGH A VARIETY OF SOURCES. IT IS INTENDED THAT THE VARIOUS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS BE USED TO RECOGNIZE ACADEMIC, ATHLETIC, SERVANT LEADERSHIP, AND SPECIAL ACHIEVEMENT AND TO MEET FINANCIAL NEEDS OR PROVIDE SELF-HELP OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH STUDENT WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND PARENT/STUDENT LOANS. WHILE IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO GUARANTEE THAT FUNDING WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR EVERY NEEDY APPLICANT, THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE DESIGNED TO HELP COVER THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE DIRECT COST OF ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY AND THE STUDENTS OWN RESOURCES. EACH APPLICATION IS REVIEWED BASED UPON AN INDIVIDUAL ASSESSMENT IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE TYPE OF RESOURCES THAT WILL BEST SERVE THE STUDENT.

ALL ORGANIZATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT PROOF OF TAX EXEMPT STATUS THAT IS VERIFIED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE DATABASE BEFORE THEY CAN PROCEED WITH THEIR REQUEST. THEY MAY USE OUR ONLINE CHARITABLE REQUEST APPLICATION TO SUBMIT A REQUEST. IF THEY ARE NOT A 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION, THEY ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A COPY OF THEIR DETERMINATION LETTER FROM THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE VALIDATING THEIR EXEMPT STATUS BEFORE WE CAN PROVIDE ANY IN-KIND GIVEAWAYS OR SERVICES. WE ALSO MONITOR THE FUNDS TO ENSURE THEY ARE USED FOR THE PURPOSE GRANTED. WE MAKE EVERY EFFORT TO DIRECT OUR FUNDING TO A PROGRAM FOR A SPECIFIC PURPOSE. ORGANIZATIONS ARE ASKED TO SHOW RESULTS AND DOCUMENTATION ANNUALLY BEFORE THEIR REQUEST CAN BE CONSIDERED FOR FUTURE FUNDING. THE REQUESTS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY VARIOUS INDIVIDUALS DEPENDING UPON THE TYPE AND AMOUNT OF THE REQUEST. SMALL AMOUNTS MAY BE APPROVED BY THE SYSTEM DIRECTOR OF COMMUNICATIONS. ANYTHING OVER $10,000 MAY BE APPROVED BY THE BAPTIST MEMORIAL HEALTH CARE FOUNDATION SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT, AND ANYTHING OVER $50,000 NEEDS APPROVAL BY THE BAPTIST MEMORIAL HEALTH CARE CORPORATION PRESIDENT/CEO. FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT BAPTIST MEMORIAL HEALTH CARE CORPORATION'S CHARITABLE GIVING GUIDELINES, PLEASE VISIT: HTTPS://WWW.BMHGIVING.ORG/.
SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THEIR ACCOUNT WITH THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET TUITION AND OTHER SIMILAR COSTS. NO CASH IS AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS.
PART I QUESTION 2 GRANTS TO RECIPIENTS IN THE U.S. INCLUDED TUITION ASSISTANCE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.
Grantees provide detailed invoices and accounting for reimburseable time and expenses.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED AND ABILITY. BOTH ARE BASED ON SET CRITERIA. THE CRITERIA FOR NEED BASED GRANTS IS BASED ON FEDERAL NEED LEVELS SUCH AS PELL ELIGIBILITY. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE STRENGTH OF THE STUDENT'S PORTFOLIO.

OUR FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON SUBMITTED FAFSA DATA AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING COMPLIANCE WITH ALL RELEVANT STATE AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS RELATIVE TO GRANT-BASED AID.

Scholarships are awarded to students based upon criteria such as need, area of study, grade point average, among others, as established by scholarship documents and donor restrictions. Scholarships are applied to the students' accounts to help cover the costs of tuition, room, and board.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS & FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID AND/OR ASSISTANCE FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES IS DISTRIBUTED & MONITORED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERALLY APPROVED NEED ANALYSIS CRITERIA OR OTHER AGENCY PROVIDED CRITERIA. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE MONITORED THROUGH UNIQUE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS FOR EACH GRANT. EXPENDITURES FOR EACH GRANT ARE REVIEWED AND ANALYZED USING AD-HOC REPORTS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE. GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE ADJUDICATED BY A PANEL OF NATIONAL EXPERTS USING THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA TO EVALUATE GRANT APPLICATIONS: EXCELLENCE, ABILITY TO IMPLEMENT PROJECT, AND PROJECT IMPACT. THESE CRITERIA INSURE THAT THE FUNDING ALIGNS WITH THE GRANT-MAKING GOAL OF SUPPORTING THE PHILADELPHIA REGION'S MOST TALENTED ARTISTS AND HIGH-PERFORMING CULTURAL ORGANIZATIONS. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE MONITORED THROUGH UNIQUE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS FOR EACH GRANT. EXPENDITURES FOR EACH GRANT ACCOUNT ARE REVIEWED AND ANALYZED USING AD-HOC REPORTS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE.

AWARDING OF INSTITUTIONAL AID IS DRIVEN BY THE AWARD THE STUDENT RECEIVES UPON ENTRANCE TO DAVIS COLLEGE. COMING IN AS A NEW STUDENT, THE ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE FIRST DETERMINES IF THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT BASED AWARDS. THESE AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC AND CO-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. EACH STUDENT IS THEN COMPARED TO A FINANCIAL AID AWARDING MATRIX WHICH IS COMPRISED OF VARYING NEED LEVELS FOR GRANT FUNDING, CAMPUS BASED AID AND CAMPUS EMPLOYMENT. STUDENTS ARE PLACED ON THIS GRID BY USING THE ADMISSIONS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA TO DETERMINE THEIR RATING AND THEN THEIR FINANCIAL NEED FACTOR AS DETERMINED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) FOR THAT ACADEMIC YEAR.
THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIES WITH ALL CONTRACTUAL AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS WHEN DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO ENROLLED STUDENTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS TO COVER TUITION AND FEES. GRADE REPORTS ARE GENERATED FOR EACH TERM, AND EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS REVIEWED TO ENSURE THEY ARE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TO MAINTAIN THEIR GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING. ALSO, FINANCIAL AID RUNS ENROLLMENT REPORTS EACH TERM TO CHECK THE NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS FOR EACH STUDENT.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS A SPECIFIC DEPARTMENT RELATED TO STUDENT FINANCIAL AID THAT TRACKS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANT FUNDS DISBURSED TO STUDENTS.

USE OF GRANT FUNDS: THE COLLEGE HAS IN PLACE ASSURANCES/SAFEGUARDS THAT INCLUDE GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING STANDARDS, AND ADDITIONAL FISCAL PROCEDURES FOR THE SUBMISSION AND APPROVAL OF INVOICES FOR THE PROPER USE OF GRANT FUNDS. FOR EXPENDITURES THAT PROVIDE SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS (IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO PAY FOR TUITION, SUPPLIES AND FEES), THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE KEEPS COMPLETE AND ACCURATE INFORMATION ON EACH INDIVIDUAL RECIPIENT THAT INCLUDES DATA ON ELIGIBILITY, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND AMOUNT OF FUNDS AWARDED/DISBURSED. FOR EXPENDITURES IN SUPPORT OF PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES PROGRAM MANAGERS MUST REVIEW EXPENDITURE REQUESTS TO ENSURE THAT EACH IS AN APPROPRIATE EXPENDITURE FOR APPROVED ACTIVITIES IN THE APPROVED BUDGET FOR THE GRANT.

Pillar College awards Title IV funds to students for the purpose of assisting with tuition and related college expenses. Student must meet eligibility requirements before funds are awarded. Awards are applied directly to student accounts.
THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. PERSONNEL REVIEW STUDENT NEED ON A YEARLY BASIS AND AWARD GRANTS BASED ON NEED AND ELIGIBILITY.
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS AND STUDENT TRANSCRIPTS ARE REVIEWED AND KEPT ON FILE TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE MET FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: GRANTS ARE PUT INTO A SEPARATE AND UNIQUE FUND AND THE EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AGAINST THE PROPOSAL AND AWARD. WESTERN UNIVERSITY MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE TWO MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE STUDENT FIRST APPLIES FOR ASSISTANCE, AND THEN BASED ON THE GRANT CRITERIA (FINANCIAL AND ENROLLMENT), THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE AMOUNTS GIVEN BY THE GRANT. GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP AWARD COMMITTEES AWARD THE RECIPIENTS.

NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WITH DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. RECIPIENTS OF NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION, BE US CITIZENS OR ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS, BE ENROLLED IN A DEGREE OR CERTIFICATE PROGRAM, AND BE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.

ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AS EITHER NEED-BASED OR MERIT-BASED AWARDS. TO AWARD OR ADMINISTER NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID FOLLOWS FEDERAL GUIDELINES STARTING WITH THE EVALUATION OF EACH STUDENT FOR NEED-BASED ON FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) & NEED-ACCESS REPORTS. MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY COMMITTEES ESTABLISHED BY THE DEAN OF THE SCHOOL. ONCE AWARDEES ARE CHOSEN, THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID. ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH ACADEMIC YEAR (SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND CURRENT ENROLLMENT) IS VERIFIED BY THE DIRECTOR PRIOR TO INITIAL DISBURSEMENT OF ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED AGAIN FOR THE JANUARY TERM BEFORE SECOND TERM DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE. FOR OTHER GRANT MAKING ACTIVITIES, THE SCHOOL REVIEWS ALL INVOICES AND OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION FOR ACCURACY, APPROPRIATENESS OF THE EXPENDITURES IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE AWARD DOCUMENTS, ANY APPLICABLE RESTRICTIONS, AND TIMELINESS OF SUBMISSION.

THE UNIVERSITY ASSIGNS RESPONSIBILITY FOR MONITORING THE USE OF RESEARCH FUNDS TO THE OFFICE OF POST AWARD FINANCIAL OPERATIONS. THIS OFFICE MONITORS ALL DOMESTIC SUBRECIPIENT GRANT MAKING ACTIVITY, INCLUDING COMPLIANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE REGULATIONS. WHEN APPROVING INVOICE PAYMENTS CHARGED TO RESEARCH GRANTS, THE VALIDITY OF EXPENSES AND THE ACHIEVEMENT OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL PROGRESS ARE VERIFIED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE. Schedule I, Part III BOSTON UNIVERSITY SCHOOLS, COLLEGES, AND THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MAKE EVERY EFFORT TO ASSIST STUDENTS WITH CALCULATED FINANCIAL ELIGIBILITY AND HIGH ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, MEASURED AGAINST THE CREDENTIALS OF OTHER ACCEPTED STUDENTS. A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD IS AN IMPORTANT FACTOR IN DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY FOR BOSTON UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED GRANTS. KEY INDICATORS SUCH AS HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA), RANK IN CLASS, AND STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES ARE CONSIDERED, AS WELL AS THE STRENGTH OF THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC PROGRAM AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES.
GRANTS ARE LIMITED TO RESTRICTED SCHOLARSHIPS THAT CAN ONLY BE APPLIED TO USCO TUITION COSTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND MERIT.

COSTS CHARGED TO SPONSORED AGREEMENTS ARE FULLY INTEGRATED WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM ACCUMULATES COSTS ACCORDING TO INDEX, FUND AND ACCOUNT CODE CATEGORIES. ASSOCIATED AND IDENTIFIED WITH EACH FUND ARE VARIOUS ATTRIBUTES SUCH AS PROJECT TITLE, SPONSOR, AND PRINCIPAL.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS ARE PRIMARILY TO STUDENTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT RECEIVABLE BALANCE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS PRIMARILY RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF THE AID. THIS IS DONE THROUGH SOFTWARE DESIGNED TO ASSIST IN THE PROCESS.

Grants and scholarships are awarded to students based on specific criteria detailed in the various grant/scholarship agreements. Members of the financial aid office and various scholarship/award committees review records for all potential recipients to ensure that the scholarship/award is being awarded properly.

Grant disbursements for the institution's exempt programs are made in accordance with the exempt purpose for which the institution was organized, and with procedures and conditions established by the institution's governing board. Student scholarships and grants are awarded based on the institution's assessment of recipient's academic achievement, financial need, and other standards similar to those held by other universities. The student's records are then monitored in order to ensure that the grant requirements are continuing to be met.

ENDOWED AND ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON CERTAIN CRITERIA SET BY THE INSTITUTION (DUNWOODY) AND DONORS. STUDENTS APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AUTOMATICALLY BY COMPLETING THEIR FAFSA STARTING THE SPRING SEMESTER OF THE PREVIOUS SCHOOL YEAR. ALL SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA IS PROVIDED TO FINANCIAL AID AND AWARDS ARE MADE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND DATE SUBMITTED. STUDENTS ARE NOTIFIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF THEIR AWARDS WHICH THEN BECOME PART OF THEIR FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT AS A CREDIT ON A SEMIANNUAL BASIS WHICH REDUCES THEIR TUITION. SOMETIMES STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO WRITE THANK YOU NOTES TO DONORS OF SCHOLARSHIPS OR ATTEND DONOR EVENTS SHOWING THEIR APPRECIATION. IF A THANK YOU NOTE IS REQUIRED AND NOT WRITTEN, THE STUDENT DOES NOT RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

STUDENTS FILL OUT A FAFSA TO SEE WHAT GOVERNMENT AID THEY QUALIFY FOR. THE DIRECTOR FOR FINANCIAL AID AWARDS THE GOVERNMENT AID BASED ON TITLE IV RULES AND REGULATIONS AND AID FROM THE COLLEGE BASED ON COLLEGE POLICY. RECORDS ON FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MAINTAINED IN STUDENT FILES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS AUDITED ANNUALLY.
FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON NUMEROUS CRITERIA, SUCH AS ATHLETIC ABILITY, MUSICAL TALENT, SAT OR ACT SCORES, AND FINANCIAL NEED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY ESTIMATES THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FROM RECORDS MAINTAINED IN OUR FINANCIAL AID (SCHOLARSHIPS) AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE SYSTEM (GRADUATE RESEARCH ASSISTANCE STIPENDS AND FELLOWSHIPS) WHICH HAVE BEEN CLASSIFIED BY THE TYPE OF ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND OTHER STUDENT RELATED FINANCIAL AID MUST BE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM AUTHORIZED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND DONOR RESIDENCE WHILE GRANTS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND STANDARDS AS DESIGNATED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO KNOWN NON-PROFITS. THE ORGANIZATION SUPPPORTS ITS RELATED ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL CHARITIES AND DOES NOT MONITOR THE FUNDS AFTER THEY ARE DISBURSED.
MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: ALL GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER VERIFYING ENROLLMENT STATUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III Student Scholarships and Financial Assistance
ExplntnTxt: Zenith Education Group, Inc. provides scholarship and financial assistance to students for tuition, books, fees and housing. Scholarship and grant programs include Zenith American Dream Scholarships, Zenith Student Grants, Zenith Graduation Financial Assistance and Military Scholarships. Awards are based on eligibility and are credited to each student's account.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: A variety of student financing options are available to help students finance their education costs. Information about programs and eligibility requirements is available through the Student Finance Office. Enrollment and eligibility in Zenith Education Group, Inc. scholarships and grants are monitored internally. Other awards are monitored by the respective granting agencies.

ALL GRANTS REPRESENT INTERNAL TRANSFER OF FUNDS FROM ENDOWMENTS OR OTHER ACCOUNTS TO A REVENUE ACCOUNT FOR TUITION PAYMENTS. NO FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO INDIVIDUALS. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND SMU GRANT LEVELS ARE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S ENTERING GPA AND NEED. FOR INCOMING FRESHMAN, TEST SCORES ARE ALSO A FACTOR. PROVIDED THAT EACH STUDENT MAINTAINS THE REQUIRED GPA, DOES NOT EXCEED THE MAXIMUM TIMEFRAME FOR INSTITUTIONAL AID AND SUBMITS EITHER A FAFSA OR FAFSA WAIVER BY THE MARCH 1ST DEADLINE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ELIGIBLE FOR HIS/ HER MERIT SCHOLARSHIP OR SMU GRANT.

The financial aid office awards grants to students based on the students financial aid application. Once classes begin, grants are disbursed to the student's account where they offset tuition charges.

INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. ARE DEFINED AS THOSE LIVING IN THE U.S. AT THE TIME THE AID WAS AWARDED. THE ABOVE IS A BEST ESTIMATE BASED ON CERTAIN ASSUMPTIONS REGARDING WHERE PERSONS WERE LIVING WHEN THE AID WAS AWARDED AND DOES NOT REPRESENT THE DEGREE TO WHICH AID IS AWARDED TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS.

Subrecipient grants - Lehigh University maintains a policy defining its procedures for monitoring the use of sponsored funds by subrecipients who are performing a portion of a sponsored project externally awarded to Lehigh. The policy provides guidance to ensure that subrecipients conduct their portions of sponsored projects in compliance with laws, regulations, terms and conditions of awards and subawards, and that reimbursed costs incurred by subrecipients are allowed. Other Assistance - Assistance offered from instititional funds by Lehigh to our students is awarded on the basis of merit and/or financial need. The selection criteria is based on the calculated expected family contribution, which is derived by using complex formulas involving families' income, assets, and household sizes. The student financial aid office administers and monitors these grants using system-generated reviews, along with cross checks on an ad hoc basis. Results from these reviews are regularly evaluated. Subsequently, follow-up corrective actions are taken when appropriate, and potentially include award revisions or cancellations. These provisions are designed to help ensure that student assistance funds are awarded to eligible recipients, in accordance with applicable federal, state, institutional, and other program legislation, as well as relevant internal university policies and operational guidelines.

THE COLLEGE DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS ANY EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS OVER THEIR CHARGES, THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE COLLEGE HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS, OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE COLLEGE'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE COLLEGE'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grant funds are monitored through an institutional administrative database in accordance with federal, state, local and institutional regulations and policies.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE ORGANIZATION AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON NEED TO NEW AND CONTINUING STUDENTS WHO HAVE COMPLETED A FAFSA AND ARE CONSIDERED TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID. THE DOCERE AND TOLEE TOTUM GRANT AWARDS ARE FUNDED BY INSTITUTIONAL FUNDRAISING EFFORTS. BOTH AWARDS EMBODY THE SPIRIT OF NATUROPATHIC MEDICINE, WHERE DOCERE IS A "DOCTOR AS TEACHER- AND TOLEE TOTUM IS "TREAT THE WHOLE PERSON". THE ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT EXECUTIVE SERVES AS THE SCHOLARSHIP REVIEW COMMITTEE IN REVIEWING AND DETERMINING THE AWARDS. THE DOCERE AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT AND NEED. THE TOLEE TOTUM AWARDS ARE ALSO BASED ON NEED AND AN ESSAY WHERE APPLICANTS IDENTIFY WHAT THE PRACTICE OF NATUROPATHIC MEDICINE MEANS TO THEM AND HOW A GRANT AWARDS WOULD AID THEM IN REACHING THEIR EDUCATIONAL GOALS. WHEN ESTABLISHING THESE GRANT AWARDS, THE ORGANIZATION SEEKS TO REWARD STUDENTS WHO HAVE ACHIEVED HIGH ACADEMIC SUCCESS AS WELL AS THOSE WHO WILL BENEFIT THE MOST FROM THE GRANT AWARD. AS STATED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S COURSE CATALOG, THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, DISABILITY, SEX, RELIGION, AGE, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, OR MARITAL STATUS IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF EDUCATIONAL AND ADMISSION POLICIES, FINANCIAL AID, EMPLOYMENT OR ANY OTHER PROGRAM OR ACTIVITY. THIS STATEMENT APPLIES TO THE AWARDING OF SCNM SCHOLARSHIPS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: ALL STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, OR OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE MONITORED THROUGHOUT THE AWARD, ACCEPTANCE, AND APPLICATION PROCESSES. APPROPRIATE RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED AND DOCUMENTED.
THE ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS WHICH ARE AWARDED ANNUALLY BASED ON THE STUDENTS MEETING CERTAIN GPA STANDARDS AND EXTENT OF NEED.

GRANTS PAID BY THE COLLEGE INCLUDE SUBAWARDS OF FEDERAL RESEARCH FUNDS AND SUPPORT OF CERTAIN CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE WORCESTER AREA. THESE GRANTS ARE CLOSELY TIED TO PROMOTING THE COLLEGE'S CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL MISSION AND CONTRIBUTE TO THE ENRICHMENT OF THE GREATER WORCESTER AREA.

THE COLLEGE SUPPORTS A NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID POLICY THAT IS REPRESENTATIVE OF ITS ACADEMIC AND SPIRITUAL GOALS AS AN UNDERGRADUATE, JESUIT, LIBERAL ARTS COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE ACCEPTS STUDENTS REGARDLESS OF THEIR ABILITY TO PAY (NEEDS-BLIND ADMISSION) AND MEETS THEIR FULL DEMONSTRATED NEED, AS CALCULATED ACCORDING TO NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED FINANCIAL AID CRITERIA. ALL STUDENTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY REGARDLESS OF THEIR SOCIO-ECONOMIC BACKGROUND. OVER 50% OF ALL STUDENTS ADMITTED RECEIVE SOME FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TO RECEIVE AID.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES GRANTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND STUDENT LOANS USING GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO ENSURE THEY ARE MADE BASED ON NEED AND OR MERIT. SCU MAKES FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO STUDENT ACCOUNT TO OFFSET AMOUNTS THAT STUDENTS OWE THE UNIVERSITY FOR TUITION AND FEES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The Foundation only makes grants to its closely-affiliated organizations. The close connection between all three organizations ensures appropriate and intended use of grant funds.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.
THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS AND MAINTAINS RECORDS REGARDING ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS.

ALL APPLICATIONS ARE PRESCREENED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOR ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS BEFORE BEING PASSED TO RESPECTIVE ACADEMIC PROGRAM CHAIRS/HEADS FOR REVIEW AND RECOMMENDATION. RECOMMENDED APPLICATIONS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE OR RESPECTIVE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEES BEFORE BEING FORWARDED TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE FOR APPROVAL. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE NOTIFIES EACH AWARDEE AND DISBURSES SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS INTO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT AFTER VERIFYING EACH AWARDEE'S ENROLLMENT STATUS AND ACADEMIC STANDING AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH SEMESTER.

GRANTS ISSUED BY IMMACULATA UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANTS AWARDED AS PART OF FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED BY THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET BILLED AMOUNTS (I.E. TUITION) ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, THEREBY REDUCING THE NET BALANCE DUE TO THE UNIVERSITY. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ASSESSED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEEDS, AND SIMILAR STANDARDS.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ITS STUDENTS WITH VARIOUS SCHOLARSHIPS THAT ARE AWARDED BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. EACH STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED PRIOR TO AWARDING. THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS THE GRANTS DIRECTLY TO OUTSTANDING BALANCES TO ENSURE THE PROPER USE OF AWARDED FUNDS.

Master's University and Seminary awards financial aid grants to students in accordance with the University's institutional financial aid policies. All scholarships are awarded to current students of the institution, thus enabling the institution to track their academic performance and use of all scholarship funds. Scholarships funds are directly applied to the student accounts, with no cash changing hands.
Financial Aid Assistance are awarded based on US, State, and private guidelines as required by the type or source of assistance.

THE INSTITUTION MONITORS, PROCESSES, RECONCILES, AND ADMINISTERS ITS AID PROGRAMS THROUGH A SHARED APPROACH. PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION IS THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITY OF THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE; THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER'S OFFICE HANDLES THE FISCAL DUTIES, WHICH INCLUDE REQUESTING CASH DRAWS FROM G-5, TRACKING FEDERAL AUTHORIZATION, DETERMINING MATCHING REQUIREMENTS, AND PROGRAM RECONCILIATIONS. THE STUDENT BILLING OFFICE APPLIES PAYMENTS TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. THIS SHARED APPROACH ALLOWS FOR SEGREGATION OF DUTIES BETWEEN THE DETERMINATION OF AWARDS AND PROCESSING PAYMENTS.

THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS AWARDS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GRADES AND ACT/SAT SCORES. A FRESHMAN WITH A 3.0 CORE GPA AND A 25 ACT, OR ABOUT 1700 ACT, WILL QUALIFY FOR AN ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP. TRANSFER STUDENTS WITH LESS THAN 30 COLLEGE CREDIT HOURS WILL HAVE BOTH HIGH SCHOOL GRADES AND COLLEGE GRADES CONSIDERED FOR ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP. A TRANSFER STUDENT WITH MORE THAN 30 COLLEGE HOURS WILL NOT NEED TO SUBMIT HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS AND ONLY COLLEGE TRANSCRIPTS WILL BE EVALUUATED. TRANSFER STUDENTS MUST HAVE A 3.0 CORE GPA TO QUALIFY. THE RANGE IS FOR 2,000 UP TO HALF-TUITION PER YEAR: THE HIGHER THE SCORES, THE HIGHER THE SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNT. THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS COORDINATES THE AWARDING OF DEPARTMENTAL SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE TO NEW STUDENTS WHO SUBMIT REQUIRED PROJECTS TO DEPARTMENT CHAIRS FOR JUDGING. DEPARTMENT SCHOLARSHIPS RANGE FROM 1,000-5,000 PER YEAR. FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENTS ARE NOTIFIED BY PHONE AND BY MAIL WITH AN OFFICIAL LETTER. THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE SENDS AN AWARD LETTER TO NOTIFY THE STUDENT OF ALL AID OFFERED TO THEM. MOST SCHOLARSHIPS (THE MERIT SCHOLARSHIP FOR CURRENT STUDENTS IS AN EXCEPTION) ARE RENEWABLE FOR FOUR YEARS AS ALONG AS SPECIFIC ACADEMIC MINIMUMS ARE MAINTAINED. O'MORE WORK STUDY AND THE O'MORE GRANT ARE THE ONLY INSTITUTIONAL NEED-BASED FUNDS OFFERED BY THE COLLEGE. O'MORE WORK STUDY IS CREDITED TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS LIKE A GRANT. THE SCHOOL DETERMINES RECEIPIENTS BY A FORMULA THAT IDENTIFIES NET NEED AFTER CALCUALTING GROSS NEED (DIRECT COST-EFC) AND THEN CREDITING FEDERAL/STATE GRANTS, INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS, AND STUDENT LOANS. THIS INFORMATION IS MAILED TO THE STUDENT IN A LETTER AND A COPY IS KEPT IN THEIR FINANCIAL AID FOLDER.
THE SCHOLARSHIPS/FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS IS APPLIED AGAINST THEIR TUITION ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP APPROVAL AND DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
HAWAII TOKAI INTERNATIONAL COLLEGE GIVES TUITION WAIVERS TO STUDENTS THAT QUALIFY AND ACCOUNT FOR SUCH THROUGH LETTERS TO THE STUDENTS THAT RECEIVE THESE WAIVERS.
All educational and boarding expenses are paid directly to Universities & landlords. Deminimis personal expenses are not tracked.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WISCONSIN SCHOOL OF PROFESSIONAL PSYCHOLOGY OFFERS A MINORITY SCHOLARSHIP AND VARIOUS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFIED INCOMING STUDENTS. ELIGIBILITY FOR THE MINORITY SCHOLARSHIP IS BASED UPON MINORITY STATUS, PROVEN ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL NEED. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVMENTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: STUDENTS ARE THE RECIPIENTS OF THE GRANT ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS. GRANT ASSISTANCE IS THEN MONITORED QUARTERLY TO ENSURE CRITERIA FOR SELECTION IS MAINTAINED.
Grants are administered through the Office of Financial Aid for all Federal, State and Institutional aid program.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.
THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS A POLICY AND PROCEDURES MANUAL WHICH OUTLINES THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICY ON AWARDING FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED AS A CREDIT TO THE STUDENT TO COVER CHARGES OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND OTHER FEES RELATED TO THE COST OF ATTENDANCE.
MENLO COLLEGE REQUIRES FINANCIAL AID APPLICANTS SUBMIT EVIDENCE OF ELIGIBILITY AND MAINTAINS ONGOING RECORDS OF ATTENDANCE AND SCHOLASTIC ACHIEVEMENTS BY ALL RECIPIENTS.

To ensure our grants and scholarships are used for proper purpose the Financial Aid Office performs regular maintenance and reconciliation with our Bursar's Office monitoring that all funds awarded to a particular student are being properly credited to their student account. Any changes or adjustments to original award that affect grant and scholarship funding are documented, saved and then copied to our Bursar's Office. These processes are completed utilizing an automated software system which allows us to generate reports at anytime for monitoring and reconciliation purposes. Additionally, we have a yearly audit performed by an outside accounting firm guaranteeing we are staying in compliance with all federal, state, and institutional policies and procedures as well as assuring funding is being used as intended.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WHEN STUDENTS ARE AWARDED A TUITION SCHOLARSHIP, THE COUNCIL SENDS THE MONEY DIRECTLY TO THE SCHOOL THE STUDENT IS ATTENDING WITH INSTRUCTIONS THAT IT IS TO BE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION. IF THE STUDENT DROPS THE CLASS OR OTHERWISE DOES NOT ATTEND, THE REFUND IS RETURNED TO THE COUNCIL. THIS PROCESS ENSURES THE SCHOLARSHIP IS USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE.

ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED UPON ENROLLMENT AND ELIGIBILITY IS FOR THE EIGHT SEMESTERS. AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER, THE FINANCIAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT VERIFIES SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS HAS BEEN MAINTAINED IN ORDER TO DETERMINE CONTINUATION OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS.
ONCE TROCAIRE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS, DISCOUNTS, AND/OR STUDENT AID, AND THE STUDENT ACCEPTS THOSE FUNDS, THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY CREDITS THE STUDENTS TUITION BILL.

THE COLLEGE ONLY GIVES SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING ITS CLASSES. SCHEDULE I, PART III, (B) - THIS NUMBER REPRESENTS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED. SOME STUDENTS MAY HAVE RECEIVED MULTIPLE SCHOLARSHIPS.

STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID THROUGH CAREFUL STUDY OF THE INFORMATION ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA), THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD, TEST SCORES, AND RECOMMENDATIONS. DETAILED RECORDS AND STATISTICS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND THE OFFICE OF ASSESSMENT AND INSTITUTIONAL RESEARCH IN REGARDS TO ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE, INCLUDING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE UNIVERSITY ATTEMPTS TO MAKE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WITHIN THE LIMITS OF EACH STUDENT BUDGET AND THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, PROFESSIONAL PROMISE, LEADERSHIP POTENTIAL, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR SPECIFIC GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY DONORS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED ON THE BASIS OF INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ADDITIONALLY, THE UNIVERSITY MAKES AVAILABLE FEDERAL WORK STUDY FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN WHICH ELIGIBLE AWARD AMOUNTS ARE ALSO BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED INFORMATION PROVIDED WITHIN THE FAFSA. WORK STUDY EXPENDED AND AVAILABLE FUNDS ARE TRACKED AND REVIEWED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO ASSISTED BY PROVIDING FUNDS FOR GENERAL OPERATIONAL SUPPORT TO THE HEALTH EDUCATION AND RESIDENCY TRAINING NETWORK, A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED TO PROMOTE AND SUPPORT COLLABORATION OF MEMBER MEDICAL AND EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS IN EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR MEDICAL STUDENTS,INTERNS AND RESIDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Org.'s Proc. for Mon. the Use of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Although IU Health Arnett does not monitor the use of grant funds once distributed, through due diligence the organization has reasonably confirmed that the entities to which the contributions are made are highly reputable in the community and use the funds for the purposes intended.

GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS: THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT USUALLY MAKE GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS. IT MADE A GRANT OF REAL PROPERTY AND CASH THIS YEAR TO A NEWLY CREATED SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION FOR THE PURPOSE OF RENOVATION AND CONSTRUCTION PROJECT TO BENEFIT THE UNIVERSITY. THE CLOSE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE ORGANIZATIONS SERVES TO MONITOR THE USE OF THE PROPERTY FOR ITS INTENDED PURPOSES. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS: THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS REQUIRES THE VERIFICATION OF 1) ENROLLMENT STATUS, 2) NUMBER OF HOURS ENROLLED, 3) NUMBER OF EARNED CREDIT HOURS, 4) GPA, AND 5) HOUSING STATUS. IN ADDITION, A REVIEW OF STUDENT ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IS CONDUCTED EACH SEMESTER TO DETERMINE OVERALL STANDING IN RELATION TO THE COLLEGE'S ESTABLISHED SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC POLICY (SAP).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The Chief Advancement Officer communicates eligible expenses to Accounting, the Business Office, and others. The expenses are received and reviewed by the Business Office (COO) as well as reviewed by the Controller and Executive Vice President of Finance and Facilities to ensure compliance with grant requirements, coding, and if costs are allowed. A reconciliation of grant expenditures to accounting records is done monthly and a federal financial report of cash draw downs is completed quarterly. Monitoring of budgeted amounts compared to actual costs is done monthly so that allowable funds are identified and fully utilized within the funding period.
