DEPARTMENTAL EXPENSES FUNDED BY COLLEGE COURSEWARE ROYALTIES ARE REQUESTED BY THE DEPARTMENT HEADS FOR SPECIFIC USE AND APPROVED BY THE VP FINANCE AND VP INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT.

ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AS EITHER NEED-BASED OR MERIT-BASED AWARDS. TO AWARD OR ADMINISTER NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID FOLLOWS FEDERAL GUIDELINES STARTING WITH THE EVALUATION OF EACH STUDENT FOR NEED BASED ON FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) & NEED-ACCESS REPORTS. MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY COMMITTEES ESTABLISHED BY THE DEAN OF THE SCHOOL. ONCE AWARDEES ARE CHOSEN, THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID. ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH ACADEMIC YEAR (SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND CURRENT ENROLLMENT) IS VERIFIED BY THE DIRECTOR PRIOR TO INITIAL DISBURSEMENT OF ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED AGAIN FOR THE JANUARY TERM BEFORE SECOND TERM DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE. FOR OTHER GRANT MAKING ACTVITIES, THE SCHOOL REVIEWS ALL INVOICES AND OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION FOR ACCURACY, APPROPRIATENESS OF THE EXPENDITURES IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE AWARD DOCUMENTS, ANY APPLICABLE RESTRICTIONS, AND TIMELINESS OF SUBMISSION.

PELL GRANT ORIGINATION, CERTIFICATION, AND RECONCILIATION IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE DIRECTOR & ASSOCIATE DIRECTORS. INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS & SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS THAT MEET THE SPECIFIC AWARD'S CRITERIA. THE INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS & SCHOLARSHIPS ARE POSTED IN CAMS AND TRANSFERRED OVER TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS ONCE PAYMENT HAS BEEN MADE.

NSU Office of Sponsored Programs maintains a written, formal policy that outlines the procedures and guidelines for monitoring the use of sponsored funds by subrecipients. Prior to entering into a subaward agreement, NSU will assess subrecipient risk based on factors such as financial stability, experience with federal awards, quality of management systems and internal controls, and prior audit results. NSU will determine what type of monitoring activities are warranted based on risk, and develop a subrecipient monitoring plan. NSU will subsequently enter into a subaward agreement with each subrecipient which properly identifies prime award information, compliance requirements, and subrecipient monitoring documents required, as applicable. Throughout the period of performance, the Principal Investigator for the project monitors the programmatic activities of the subrecipient; determining that appropriate progress has been made; receiving, reviewing and retaining copies of required programmatic reports; and reviewing/approving subrecipient invoices prior to submitting to the NSU Office of Sponsored Programs for approval and processing. As part of the initial risk assessment and throughout the period of performance of the subaward, NSU will collaboratively review any deficiencies pertaining to the sponsored award that are identified through audits or other means, and issue a management decision. Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Institutional grants awarded to students are recorded to individual student accounts and to each college departmental account using specific contra revenue account codes. The number of recipients and amount of awards varies by center and program. Funds set aside for scholarships are budgeted annually and included in the University's budget plan approved by the Board of Trustees.
The Grantee of each approved grant is required to provide a report annually, at a minimum, on the distribution of usage of grant funds.

DOANE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS ACCORDING TO POLICY CRITERIA WHICH RECOGNIZE FACTORS SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SPECIAL ABILITIES, AND FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. RESTRICTED GRANT FUNDS WITH SPECIFIC AWARD CRITERIA ARE ADMINISTERED BY FINANCIAL AID TO SELECT STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF THE GRANT.

The Office of Financial Aid maintain records to substantiate the amount of the grants or assistance disbursed to students, the students' eligibility for the grants or assistance, and the selection criteria used to award the grants or assistance.

THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID'S OFFICE MAINTAINS ALL DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THAT THE AWARDED STUDENTS HAVE SATISFIED THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE VARIOUS GRANTS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY FOR STUDENTS. CRITERIA FOR AWARDING ANY GRANTS IS ALSO MAINTAINED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID'S OFFICE AND IS APPROVED BY THE VP OF ENROLLMENT.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF SCHOLASTIC ABILITY, PERSONAL PRESENTATION SKILLS AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A MINIMUM GPA OF 2.5 TO QUALIFY FOR CONSIDERATION FOR ANY ADDITIONAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING.

SAINT PETER'S UNIVERSITY ("UNIVERSITY") PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE UNIVERSITY FOR VARIOUS REASONS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, STUDENT INSTITUTIONAL AID AND ATHLETICS. THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS REQUIRED.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS - ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED OR ACADEMIC MERIT. INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISTRIBUTIONS FROM THE UNIVERSITY ARE CHOSEN BASED UPON OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY CRITERIA WHICH ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE OVERALL TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE EITHER APPLIED TO STUDENTS' INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS AT DENISON, OR SENT DIRECTLY TO THE OFF-CAMPUS PROGRAM WITHIN THE UNITED STATES AT WHICH THE STUDENT IS STUDYING.

THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR HAVING RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE GRANT MONITORS SUBCONTRACTOR PERFORMANCE BASED ON THE PROGRAM'S TASKS AND GOALS. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE BEFORE AUTHORIZING THE SUBCONTRACTOR'S INVOICE FOR PAYMENT.

CORNELL MONITORS ALL GRANT RESOURCES THROUGH FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL AUDITS AS WELL AS FEDERAL, STATE, AND INTERNAL POLICY AND PROCEDURES AS WELL AS PERIODIC AUDITING BY AND REPORTING TO THE FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM COMPLETES AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ALL GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE CORNELL'S MANAGEMENT TAKES THE NECESSARY STEPS TO INSURE CORNELL IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE MANY FEDERAL REGULATIONS RECIPIENTS OF GRANT AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP, GRANT, LOAN, AND WORK STUDY OPPORTUNITIES TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE OFFERED TO STUDENTS ON AN OBJECTIVE AND NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS. EACH PROGRAM HAS DIFFERENT CRITERIA AND EACH CASE IS CONSIDERED SEPARATELY. THERE IS A WRITTEN POLICY AND GUIDELINES TO ASSIST STUDENTS AS THEY SEEK THE APPROPRIATE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR THE GRANTED AWARDED.

SCHEDULE I, PART III A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE COLLEGE. THE RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGE COMMITTEES THAT JUDGE THE APPLICANTS. THE COLLEGE HAS PROCEDURES THAT ARE DESIGNED TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS FROM THE COLLEGE QUALIFY TO RECEIVE PAYMENTS. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ENSURES THAT GRANTS AND AWARDS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH PROCEDURES ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGE.

THE PROCESS FOR MONITORING THE USE OF TUITION DISCOUNT OR GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AT MARS HILL UNIVERSITY INCLUDES THE USE OF A MATRIX THAT LIMITS AND DETERMINES THE AMOUNT OF ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP AWARDED WITH A MAXIMUM OF $18,000. THE DEAN OF ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID MEET MONTHLY TO REVIEW THE CURRENT AMOUNT OF TUITION DISCOUNT OR GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS BEING AWARDED TO ENSURE THAT THE UNIVERSITY STAYS WITHIN BUDGET. TUITION DISCOUNT, GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE PRESIDENT ON A REGULAR BASIS. THE BUDGET FOR THESE GRANTS IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE DEAN OF ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID MONITOR ALL TUITION DISCOUNT FINANCIAL AID AWARDS PRIOR TO THE AWARD LETTER BEING MAILED. ATHLETIC GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY COACHES AND THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR WITH STRICT GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY THE NCAA. THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR REPORTS REGULARLY TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY THE AMOUNT OF TUITION DISCOUNT ATHLETIC GRANTS AWARDED BY EACH TEAM PER YEAR.

The Director of Financial aid reviews each endowment scholarship award criteria and awards scholarships based on donor intent. Merit scholarships are awarded by the Director of Financial aid based on a review of the ACT scores and incoming GPA.

THE ONLY GRANT FUNDS AWARDED BY THE ORGANIZATION ARE SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS THAT ATTEND CLASSES AT THE ORGANIZATION. THE PROCESS FOR MONITORING THE USE OF THE FUNDS IS AS FOLLOWS: WHEN A SCHOLARSHIP FUND IS SET-UP, THE DONOR COMPLETES A FORM SPECIFYING THE CRITERIA, IF ANY, FOR SELECTING STUDENTS WHO WILL RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE A WRITTEN APPLICATION TO APPLY FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP. OTHER STATISTICS ARE ASSEMBLED REGARDING THE APPLICANTS, SUCH AS THEIR RESPECTIVE GPA AND ACCOUNT BALANCE. A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE APPLICATIONS AND OTHER INFORMATION AND RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON THE SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA. SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS AND THE AMOUNT OF THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARDED IS DOCUMENTED AND FILED IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

VIRTUALLY ALL UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TIED TO THE STUDENTS' GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) OR BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ANNUALLY, THE GPA AND NEED ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE COMPLIANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY STANDARD. IF A STUDENT'S GPA FALLS BELOW THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT, THE SCHOLARSHIP IS EITHER REMOVED OR REDUCED BY HALF. STUDENTS CAN APPEAL TO HAVE THE SCHOLARSHIP RESTORED IF THEIR GPA RETURNS TO THE REQUIRED LEVEL. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CARRIED FORWARD EACH YEAR ONCE THE STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO CERTAIN LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURAL SUPPORT TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE ASSISTANCE IS CONSIDERED A DONATION AND THE UNIVERSITY DOES NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE USE OF THE FUNDS.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STUDENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS.

HODGES UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN VARIOUS LOCAL SPONSORSHIPS TO ORGANIZATIONS ANNUALLY BASED ON OUR ABILITY AND CURRENT ECONOMIC SITUATION. BECAUSE THE SPONSORSHIPS ARE FOR GENERAL OPERATING SUPPORT, NO MONITORING IS REQUIRED. HODGES UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN BOTH STATE AND FEDERAL STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS. VIRTUALLY ALL FUNDS RECEIVED ARE IMMEDIATELY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS FOR PAYMENT OF TUITION, FEES AND BOOKS. EXCESS FUNDS ARE DELIVERED TO STUDENTS ACCORDING TO PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, LINE 2 AND PART III
ExplntnTxt: Student Financial Aid STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BY THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES. AWARDS ARE BASED ON A NUMBER OF FACTORS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SCHOLARLY ACHIEVEMENT, DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED, AND ACADEMIC INTERESTS. FUNDS ARE PROVIDED BY SOURCES SUCH AS FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; PRIVATE DONORS SUCH AS CORPORATIONS, INDIVIDUALS AND FOUNDATIONS; THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED FINANCIAL AID FUNDS; AND THE COLLEGE'S OPERATING BUDGET. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MADE UP TO A LIMIT OF THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS ARE MONITORED EXTENSIVELY IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT STUDENTS ARE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND THAT THEY DO NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THEIR DEMONSTRATED NEED. ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE WHEN APPROPRIATE.
Morehouse College Grant EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENT FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS & FINANCE. ACTIVITIES ARE RELATED TO NSF GRANT ENTITLED "TARGETED INFUSION PROJECT: DSX".

THE AID AND ASSISTANCE PAYS FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, AND BOOKSTORE CHARGES.

THE SCHOOL IS ALSO ABLE TO MONITOR WHETHER STUDENTS REMAIN AT THE COLLEGE THROUGH THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE, THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PRESIDENT AND DEAN OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS, CLASS ATTENDANCE TAKEN BY FACULTY, AND HOUSING RECORDS MAINTAINED BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT AFFAIRS.
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS WITHIN ITS FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE TO ACCOUNT FOR ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT.

EACH TRANSACTION INVOLVING GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, OR FINANCIAL AID IS MONITORED THROUGH THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. IN ADDITION, THE UNIVERSITY UNDERGOES ANNUAL AUDITS OF ITS FINANCIAL AID PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES. THE AUDITORS TEST THE UNIVERSITY'S COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE RULES AND REGULATIONS.
The organization utilizes financial aid software and a monitoring system to ensure that aid is awarded properly according to university, state, and federal guidelines.
Students receiving Scholarship and Fellowships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Universitys financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The University also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.
THE ORGANIZATION ONLY GAVE NONCASH TUITION REDUCTION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET CRITERIA FOR SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.

PRESBYTERIAN COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, AND LOANS TO ITS STUDENTS. THE PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF THE FUNDS ARE PART OF THE FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES AND THEY ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE QUALIFICATIONS OF THE RECIPIENT. THE GUIDELINES ARE PUBLISHED IN THE PRESBYTERIAN COLLEGE ACADEMIC CATALOG AND COMPLY WITH THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS PUBLISHED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE SC DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE ALSO COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ARE AWARDED PURSUANT TO INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES WHICH CONSIDER A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC ABILITY, ARTISTIC ABILITY AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN ACADEMIC STANDARDS AND MAKE SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TO CONTINUE RECEIVING INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS FUNDED BY DONORS MUST MEET THE SPECIFIED SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS, IF ANY, AS WELL AS MAINTAIN ACADEMIC STANDARDS AND MAKE SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS GRADUATION.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS, GENERALLY IN A "PACKAGE" THAT INCLUDES LOANS, COMPENSATION UNDER WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS, AND/OR GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS. THE LOANS ARE PROVIDED PRIMARILY THROUGH PROGRAMS OF THE UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT (INCLUDING DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOAN PROGRAMS) UNDER WHICH THE UNIVERSITY IS RESPONSIBLE ONLY FOR CERTAIN ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES. THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS INCLUDE AWARDS PROVIDED THROUGH GIFTS AND GRANTS FROM PRIVATE DONORS OR FROM INCOME EARNED ON ENDOWMENT FUNDS RESTRICTED FOR STUDENT AID, AS WELL AS GENERAL FUNDS SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS. ROUGHLY 85 PERCENT OF STEVENSON UNIVERSITY STUDENTS RECEIVE SOME SORT OF FINANCIAL AID. ALL INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS FROM STEVENSON UNIVERSITY QUALIFY TO RECEIVE SUCH PAYMENTS BASED ON SCHOLASTIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES NEED-BASED GRANTS, WHICH ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE STUDENTS'S FAFSA SCORE. THE STUDENT MUST MAINTAIN A GPA OF 2.0 OR GREATER AND BE A FULL-TIME STUDENT. DISBURSEMENTS TAKE THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANTS. GRANTS ARE DISBURSED BASED ON THE GUIDELINES SET FORTH BY THE PARTY FUNDING THE GRANT.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED UPON MERIT OR FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS APPLY FOR INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND ARE AWARDED BASED UPON THE CRITERIAL FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIP THEY ARE AWARDED BY A COMMITTEE. ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED DURING THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS AND ARE AWARDED BASED UPON MERIT. FRESHMAN ENROLLMENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED TO INCOMING FRESHMEN BASED UPON THEIR INDIVIDUAL HIGH SCHOOL PERFORMANCE, SAT SCORES, AND FINANCIAL NEEDS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENT MATRICULATION AT THE COLLEGE, THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS REQUIRED.

MIDLAND UNIVERSITY OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

THE COLLEGE'S GRANTS ARE PRIMARILY MONITORED IN THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF WRITTEN AND ELECTRONIC DOCUMENTATION. STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DEEMED WORTHY BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED.

UNIVERSITY OF PIKEVILLE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY ENTERING EACH STUDENT AND THEIR INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP ON THE UNIVERSITY'S ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE, DATATEL. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH BY THE UNIVERSITY ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

FOR ADMINISTERING GOVERNMENT GRANT FUNDS, DEAN OF STUDENT AFFAIRS REVIEWS THE DO-NOT-USE VENDOR LIST PUBLISHED BY THE GOVERNMENT TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH G5 (SAM) REQUIREMENTS. FINANCIAL AIDS DISBURSEMENTS ARE POSTED TO STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BASED ON THE APPROVED COST OF ATTENDANCE FOR EACH STUDENT. THE POSTED FINANCIAL AID IS THEN USED TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION AND OTHER EDUCATION RELATED EXPENSES.

Scholarships and Grants are distributed to students by posting the funds directly to their student accounts to offset charges for tuition, fees, and room and board. Any remaining credit is refunded to the student via check or direct deposit for use in purchasing books, housing, food, etc. Contributions to exempt organizations that further the University's exempt purpose require approval of a Vice President.

FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED CONSISTENT WITH FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. FEDERAL PROGRAMS ARE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDIT. THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICES MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. VARIOUS CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE FUNDING SOURCE.

THE COLLEGE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION POLICY REGARDING TITLE IV FUNDS. THE COLLEGE HAS DEDICATED INDIVIDUALS PERFORM THE WORK OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF THE GRANT WHO WORK TO ENSURE PROPER STEWARDSHIP OF FUNDS. THESE INDIVIDUALS FOLLOW THE STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE GRANT. FUNDS ARE DRAWN AFTER EXPENSES ARE INCURRED. PROGRESS REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grant funds and scholarships are credited directly to the students' accounts to ensure the appropriate use of funds.
A SUBAWARD IS AN AWARD OF FINANCIAL SUPPORT FROM THE UNIVERSITY TO A QUALIFIED THIRD PARTY PRIMARILY TO PERFORM RESEARCH AND OTHER RELATED PROGRAMMATIC EFFORTS UNDER A SPONSORED RESEARCH PROJECT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III COLUMN B - NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE AMOUNTS REPORTED IN PART III REPRESENT AN ESTIMATE OF TOTAL AWARDS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE AND PROFESSIONAL SCHOOLS. SOME STUDENTS RECEIVED MORE THAN ONE AWARD DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part II, Line 1 COLUMN H - PURPOSE OF GRANT OR ASSISTANCE
ExplntnTxt: SUBAWARDS - SPONSORED RESEARCH

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: WITH RESPECT TO SPONSORED PROJECT ACTIVITY SUBCONTRACTED TO OTHER ENTITIES, THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICY AND PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING SUB RECIPIENT AWARDS ("SUBWARDS") ARE INTENDED TO ESTABLISH APPROPRIATE AND EFFECTIVE MECHANISMS TO PROMOTE COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND NON-FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS AND CONTRACTUAL ARRANGEMENTS, INCLUDING THE PROPER MONITORING AND STEWARDSHIP OF AWARDED FUNDS. PROPER MONITORING OF A SUBAWARD ENSURES THAT AWARDED FUNDS ARE USED FOR AUTHORIZED PURPOSES, PERFORMANCE GOALS ARE MET AND THE SUB RECIPIENT IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE SUB RECIPIENT AGREEMENT. SUB RECIPIENT MONITORING PROCEDURES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: A FORMAL PRE-QUALIFICATION PROCESS FOR SUB RECIPIENTS, PRE-AWARD AND POST-AWARD MONITORING OF SUB RECIPIENTS TO REVIEW THE FINANCIAL STATUS AND MANAGEMENT CONTROLS, COMPLIANCE CERTIFICATIONS, REVIEW OF COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATIONS RELATIVE TO THE USE OF HUMAN SUBJECTS AND ANIMALS, IDENTIFICATION AND MANAGEMENT OF ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH A SUB RECIPIENT ENTITY, AND A REVIEW OF PERTINENT OTHER ORGANIZATION INFORMATION. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THESE PROCEDURES, THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS THE SUB RECIPIENT'S ADMINISTRATION, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, BILLINGS, SCIENTIFIC PROGRESS, TECHNICAL REPORTS, AND DELIVERABLES OF AN ACTIVE SUBAWARD REGULARLY AND CONDUCTS ON-GOING RISK ASSESSMENTS AS WELL AS QUARTERLY QUALITY ASSURANCE REVIEWS ON RANDOMLY SELECTED SUBAWARDS. IN ADDITION TO A MONTHLY DEPARTMENTAL REVIEW, THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS A SUB RECIPIENT'S COMPLIANCE WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE SUBAWARD ANNUALLY AND UPON CLOSEOUT OF THE SUB RECIPIENT AGREEMENT. IF ANY OF THESE MONITORING PROCEDURES RESULT IN FINDINGS, THE UNIVERSITY WILL TAKE CORRECTIVE ACTION AS NECESSARY. THE PROCEDURES SERVE TO ENSURE THAT THE SUBAWARD FUNDS ARE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES AND NOT DIVERTED FROM THEIR INTENDED USE.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE RESULTS FROM FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ALSO MEET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS IDENTIFIED BY THE DONORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATIONS PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 ANY STYDENT THAT SUBMITS A COMPLETED APPLICATION FOR FULL-TIME UNDERGRADUATE ADMISSION TO SAINT JOSEPHS UNIVERSITY IS AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED FOR MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A SELECT GROUP OF SCHOLARSHIPS THAT REQUIRE A SEPARATE SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION. ADDITIONALLY, ANY PROSPECTIVE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT THAT SUBMITS A FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID) AND MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS TO RECEIVE FEDERAL AID, IS AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED FOR ALL AVAILABLE FORMS OF FEDERAL AND STATE AID, AS WELL AS UNIVERSITY NEED-BASED GRANT AID. MATRICULATING GRADUATE STUDENTS THAT SUBMIT THE FAFSA AND MEET THE REQUIREMENTS TO RECEIVE FEDERAL AID ARE ALSO CONSIDERED FOR AVAILABLE FEDERAL LOANS FOR WHICH THEY QUALIFY.
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS AN OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, WHICH IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MONITORING OF GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO THE COLLEGE AND STUDENTS.

TRINITY PARTICIPATES IN THE FEDERAL TITLE IV FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS, AND FOLLOWS THE PROCEDURES PRESCRIBED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION RELATED TO THE DISBURSEMENT OF TITLE IV FUNDS, INSTITUTIONAL AWARDS, AND SCHOLARSHIPS AND ASSISTANCE FROM OTHER SOURCES. THESE PROCEDURES INCLUDE ENSURING THAT STUDENTS COMPLETE A FAFSA EACH ACADEMIC YEAR, COMPLETING THE VERIFICATION REQUIREMENTS, CALCULATING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, AND ENSURING THAT STUDENTS WHO WITHDRAW OR STOP ATTENDING ARE REVIEWED AND HANDLED AS PRESCRIBED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

Student financial need is substantiated based on information provided in the Free Application for Federal Student Aid -- FAFSA. Additionally some aid is given based on High School GPA or standardized test (SAT or ACT) scores. Title IV funds are handled in accordance with applicable provisions. The Financial Aid program is audited in compliance with the Federal OMB A-133 guidelines and no deficiencies were found during the time period covered by this filing.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The college reports are regularly reviewed to be certain funds are used for proper purposes. Federal grant reporting and reconciliation occurs monthly and during the yearly single audit. Awarding practices are reviewedforcompliance with federal regulations. Students are reviewed yearly for continued and new fund eligibility to be sure academic standards and other grant-specific criteria have been met.
STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES GRANTS IN THE FORM OF CREDITS AGAINST TUITION INVOICES. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT ACTUALLY DISBURSED FROM THE SCHOOL.
We follow the requirements of the research agreements.

TO ENSURE OUR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR THE PROPER PURPOSES THE EDGEWOOD COLLEGE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE PERFORMS REGULAR MAINTENANCE AND RECONCILIATIONS WITH OUR BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORING THAT ALL FUNDS AWARDED TO A PARTICULAR STUDENT ARE BEING PROPERLY CREDITED TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT. ANY CHANGES OR ADJUSTMENTS TO ORIGINAL AWARDS THAT AFFECT GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING ARE MADE WITHIN POWERFAIDS, THE FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE PROGRAM. THESE CHANGES TO AWARDS ARE ELECTRONICALLY TRANSMITTED AT LEAST WEEKLY TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THE RESULTING CHANGES ARE THEN DISPLAYED ON THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS THE ABILITY TO GENERATE REPORTS AS NEEDED FOR MONITORING AND RECONCILIATION PURPOSES. THESE REPORTS ARE COMPARED TO REPORTS GENERATED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO ENSURE THAT ALL PROGRAM AMOUNTS ARE ACCURATELY REFLECTED. ADDITIONALLY, WE HAVE A YEARLY AUDIT PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM GUARANTEEING WE ARE STAYING IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS WELL AS ASSURING FUNDING IS BEING USED AS INTENDED.

CABRINI UNIVERSITY DOES NOT PROVIDE GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, HOWEVER ON OCCASION DONATIONS ARE MADE TO OTHER CHARITABLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. SINCE THESE ARE DONATIONS, THEY ARE NOT MONITORED FOR A SPECIFIC USE. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S CABRINI UNIVERSITY ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION AND FEES. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY CABRINI UNIVERSITY. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF STUDENT CONTINUES TO DEMONSTRATE NEED, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE, AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE CABRINI UNIVERSITY POLICY. RENEWAL OF AID IS ALSO DEPENDENT ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS.

THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE COLLECTS GRANT AWARD LETTERS AND INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE GRANTING AGENCIES OF THE BRIAR CLIFF UNIVERSITY (BCU) GRANT MANAGERS. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE KEEPS A FISCAL FILE FOR EACH GRANT, INCLUDING AWARD LETTERS, INSTRUCTIONS, ANNUAL ACCOUNTING RECORDS, AND FINANCIAL REPORTS SUBMITTED TO THE GRANTORS. EITHER THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE OR THE GRANT MANAGER SUBMITS REPORTS TO AGENCIES, DEPENDING ON THE GRANT. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE CREATES A BUDGET FOR EACH GRANT IN THE GRANTS FUND, BASED ON AWARD LETTERS AND INPUT FROM THE BCU GRANT MANAGERS. IF THE GRANT ALLOWS, GRANT MANAGERS MAY REQUEST BUDGET TRANSFERS WITHIN THEIR GRANT, WHICH THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE OR THE ASSISTANT VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE ENTER IN DATATEL. THE GRANT MANAGER SIGNS OFF ON EXPENDITURES FOR THE GRANT. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE REVIEWS ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES MONTHLY, WITH MORE IN-DEPTH REVIEW AS NEEDED FOR REPORTING TO GRANTORS. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE RECONCILES GRANT EXPENDITURES ANNUALLY FISCAL YEAR AND THE GRANT FISCAL YEAR, IF DIFFERENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE APPROVED AND REPORTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT. CHECKS FOR GRANT REVENUES ARE RECEIVED IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE: SOME AGENCIES MAIL THEM TO THE GRANT MANAGERS, WHO THEN TURN THEM IN TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE FOR DEPOSIT. SOME AGENCIES PAY BCU THROUGH DIRECT DEPOSIT INTO BCU CHECKING ACCOUNTS. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE DRAWS DOWN FEDERAL GRANT FUNDS ELECTRONICALLY THROUGH THE ONLINE G5 SYSTEM: DRAWDOWNS ARE USUALLY DONE MONTHLY.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: SCHOLARSHIPS AND PRIZES ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MONITORED ANNUALLY BASED ON STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PROFILES AND GUIDELINES AS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS. THESE GUIDELINES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS ON THE SKIDMORE COLLEGE WEBSITE.

Procedure for Monitoring Grants: Grants to organizations and individuals awarded for the purpose of conducting research are monitored as follows: Subcontracts are issued with a defined scope of work and a budget and include other terms and conditions such as frequency of required reporting. The faculty member at the University of Miami responsible for the grant monitors the scientific progress via site visits, correspondence, reports, etc. Invoices submitted for payments by the outside organization or by an individual are approved by the University of Miami Faculty member responsible for the grant.

Assistance to the University students in the form of scholarships are awarded for the purpose of aiding with the cost of attending the University (i.e., for tuition, housing and meals). Scholarships are based on need and academic achievement. Total scholarships, grants and loans cannot exceed the total cost of attendance. The University publishes criteria for the eligibility requirements needed to award a scholarship. The amount of aid awarded is based on a need analysis formula developed by the federal government and includes verification of the information submitted by the student.

NEUMANN UNIVERSITY'S PROCESS FOR MONITORING FINANCIAL AID AND MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IS A COMBINATION OF PROCEDURES INVOLVING THE FOLLOWING OFFICES; FINANCIAL AID, INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT, REGISTRAR, AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARD SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ACCORDING TO THE SPECIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS OF THE SPECIFIC AWARD. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, REGISTRAR, AND BUSINESS OFFICE COORDINATE THE AWARDING AND DOCUMENTATION OF FINANCIAL AID TO INCLUDE ELIGIBILITY OF FINANCIAL AID, NOTIFICATION OF STUDENTS, CHANGE OF STATUS, AND RECONCILEMENT OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS: THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAVEN IS COMMITTED TO ASSISTING STUDENTS IN FINANCING THEIR EDUCATION. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM, WITH THE STUDENTS RECEIVING ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS, AND PART-TIME EMPLOYMENT WHICH ARE AVAILABLE FROM FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDS, PRIVATE SPONSORS, AND FROM UNIVERSITY RESOURCES. MORE THAN 90% OF THE UNIVERSITY'S FULL-TIME UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS RECEIVE SOME FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. MOST FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE BASED ON AN INDIVIDUAL'S DEMONSTRATION OF NEED AFTER CAREFUL CONSIDERATION OF THE APPLICATION FOR ASSISTANCE. IN CALCULATING NEED, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ATTEMPTS TO CONSIDER ALL ASPECTS OF A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE ONLY AVAILABLE TO U.S. CITIZENS OR ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS. SOME FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE ON A MERIT BASIS FOR STUDENTS WHO HAVE EXCEPTIONAL ACADEMIC RECORDS OR ATHLETIC ABILITY. STUDENTS MUST BE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING IN ORDER TO BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID. GRADUATE STUDENTS MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE ALL CREDITS FOR WHICH FINANCIAL AID HAS BEEN AWARDED, AS INDICATED ON THE STUDENT'S INDIVIDUAL FINANCIAL AID AWARD LETTER. FEDERAL, STATE, PRIVATE GRANT FUNDS AND INSTITUTIONAL AID FUNDS ARE NORMALLY APPLIED AS CREDITS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

THE AWARDING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS UNDER THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS MONITORED BY NEC'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, WHICH ENSURES THAT NEC MEETS THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF OMB CIRCULAR A-133. NEC'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING EFFECTIVE INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF LAWS, REGULATIONS, CONTRACTS, AND GRANTS APPLICABLE TO FEDERAL PROGRAMS. ONLY CURRENT NEC STUDENTS IN GOOD STANDING ARE PROVIDED SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS OR OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO NEC COLLEGE STUDENTS ARE IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. ALL COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH NEC'S FINANCIAL AID SYSTEM. INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S INTERNAL TUITION ACCOUNT AND REPRESENT AN OFFSET TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES ASSESSED BY NEC. PREPARATORY PROGRAM, CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAM AND SUMMER SESSION SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TRACKED SEPARATELY AND ADMINISTERED THROUGH NEC'S STUDENT BILLING SYSTEM. PREPARATORY PROGRAM, CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAM AND SUMMER SESSION SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S INTERNAL TUITION ACCOUNT AND REPRESENT AN OFFSET TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES ASSESSED BY NEC. GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO NEC STAFF AND THEIR ELIGIBLE SPOUSES AND DEPENDENTS ARE IN THE FORM OF STAFF TUITION WAIVERS, PURSUANT TO A WRITTEN BENEFITS PLAN. STAFF TUITION WAIVERS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE CONSERVATORY'S BENEFITS SYSTEM AND, LIKE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS, ARE CREDITED TO THE INDIVIDUAL'S INTERNAL ACCOUNT TO OFFSET TUITION CHANGES. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

FOR GRANTS RECEIVED BY THE COLLEGE, GRANTS ARE CONTROLLED BY A DESIGNATED RESPONSIBLE PERSON ON CAMPUS, WHO IS TYPICALLY THE PERSON WHO APPLIES FOR THE GRANT. ALL PROPOSED EXPENDITURES FROM THE GRANT MUST BE APPROVED BY THAT PERSON. THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE INVOICE FOR APPROPRIATENESS WITH THE NATURE OF THE GRANT, REVIEWS THE ACTUAL TRANSACTION TO MAKE SURE THAT IT IS ADEQUATELY SUPPORTED, AND REVIEWS THE TRANSACTION TO BE SURE THAT IT IS AN ALLOWABLE EXPENSE UNDER FEDERAL LAW. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED ITS OWN SET OF GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS TO SEGREGATE THE EXPENSES AND GRANT INCOME FROM OTHER EXPENDITURES AND REVENUES OF THE COLLEGE. IF THE GRANT IS A REIMBURSEMENT GRANT, THE COLLEGE PERIODICALLY DRAWS FUNDS DOWN FROM THE GRANTOR BASED ON THE ACTUAL EXPENSES INCURRED. WHEN REPORTS ARE DUE TO THE GOVERNMENT OR OTHER GRANTOR, THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON PREPARES THE REPORT WITH ASSISTANCE OF THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT. TYPICALLY, THESE REPORTS ARE SIGNED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON AND THE CFO OR PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE CERTIFYING THE ACCURACY OF THE REPORT. GRANTS SHOWN ON PART III ARE SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED IN TWO FORMS. FIRST, SOME SCHOLARSHIPS ARE FUNDED BY DONOR GIFTS OR INVESTMENT INCOME FROM DONOR GIFTS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS MUST BE GRANTED AS THE DONOR HAS SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT. THE STUDENT MUST MEET THE DESIGNATED REQUIREMENTS OF THE DONOR. SECOND, THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS FROM GENERAL COLLEGE REVENUES. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEEDS WHICH IS CONSISTENT WITH INDUSTRY STANDARDS.
GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENTS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, CHARLES R. DREW UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS.

URSINUS COLLEGE PROVIDED GRANTS TOTALING $119,268 TO 150 URSINUS COLLEGE STUDENTS IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING FOR CAMPUS HOUSING, PRIMARILY FOR SUMMER RESEARCH. THE GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AT URSINUS COLLEGE. URSINUS COLLEGE PROVIDED GRANTS TOTALING $45,750,691 TO 1,584 URSINUS COLLEGE STUDENTS IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING FOR TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD FOR THE ACADEMIC YEAR 2017-18. THE GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AT URSINUS COLLEGE. URSINUS COLLEGE PROVIDED GRANTS TOTALING $213,750 TO 86 URSINUS COLLEGE STUDENTS IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING FOR STIPENDS WHILE ENGAGED IN SUMMER RESEARCH PROJECTS ON CAMPUS. THE STIPENDS ARE DISBURSED VIA PAYROLL TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE OF MONITORING USE OF GRANTS TO GOVERMENTAL AGENCIES & GOVERMENTS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 The University maintains its grant funds in individual grant accounts and is required to be audited annually (Uniform Guidance Single Audit). In addition, the University has established research policies and procedures as guidelines to principal investigators in managing their grant at Brandeis University.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE OF MONITORING USE OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS
ExplntnTxt: PART III The University provides grants and scholarships to students and applies the financial aid directly crediting each student's account.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID FUNDS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES ARE THEN MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND ACADEMIA ARE MONITORED BY THE REGISTRAR.

THE STUDENT GRANTS AND AWARDS ARE FINANCIAL AID FUNDS WHICH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS DETERMINED EACH STUDENT WAS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE. THE BUSINESS OFFICE REVIEWS THEIR LIST, PRIOR TO ENTERING THE AWARDS DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENT'S TUITION ACCOUNT, AS PAYMENT. FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS PROVIDED MONTHLY REPORTS AS THESE AWARDS ARE EXPENSED OUT OF THE FINANCIAL AID BUDGET. STUDENTS ARE AWARE OF THESE AWARDS THROUGH VARIOUS PUBLICATIONS. STUDENTS HAVE DIRECT ACCESS TO ALL DETAILS OF THEIR TUITION ACCOUNT.

Moravian College follows state and federal regulations in administering scholarships and grants as well as institutional policy when administering college funds. The College follows federal methodology to determine financial need for awarding federal funds and need-based institutional funds. All students applying for financial aid follow an annual application process by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). Files are reviewed for conflicting information and to complete required verification of application data. Moravian credits all financial aid awards, except for work study, directly to students' receivable account offsetting charges for tuition, fees and campus room and board. Changes in student enrollment status are reviewed to ensure that students remain eligible for financial aid and awards are adjusted as necessary. Any refunds from student accounts are done in compliance with state and federal regulations.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS STUDENTS ADHERENCE TO ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS GPA AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.

ALAYA PRESCHOOL HAS CHILDREN WHO RECEIVE SOME SCHOLARSHIP SUPPORT IN THE FORM OF TUITION REDUCTION IN ADDITION TO OTHER CHILDREN THAT RECEIVE SUPPORT VIA CCCAP (COLORADO CHILD CARE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM). THIS IS A STATE FUNDED PROGRAM FOR LOW INCOME FAMILIES. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT GET FULLY REIMBURSED FOR THE REGULAR COST OF CARE SO SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED TO FUND THE DIFFERENCE FOR THESE FAMILIES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP/DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT MAINTAINED WITH OLLU. THE ORGANIZATION REVIEWS ALL PROPOSALS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT GUIDELINES AND APPROVES PRIOR TO THE EXPENSE BEING INCURRED. THE PROJECT DIRECTOR TRACKS SPENDING ON GRANTS MONTHLY TO ENSURE NO BUDGET OVERAGES. WHEN RECORDING THE BILLINGS MONTHLY, THE GRANTS ACCOUNTANT ALSO MONITORS THE SPENDING TO MAKE SURE EXPENSES ARE REASONABLE AND WITHIN THE BUDGET OF THE GRANT.

GRANTS ARE SCHOLARSHIPS GIVEN TO UNIVERSITY AND COLLEGES FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS HELD AT THE AMERICAN UNIVERSITY OF ROME IN ROME, ITALY. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY SCHOLAR MERIT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 1 AND 2 THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE AND THE SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ISSUED ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION BALANCE; THEREFORE, THE STUDENT CAN EXERCISE NO DISCRETION IN THE USE OF THE FUNDS. SINCE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION, NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS IS REQUIRED. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 PROGRAM MANAGERS WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE GRANTEES RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS AND MONITOR THE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE GRANT AGREEMENT. MONITORING INCLUDES CONDUCTING REGULAR CONTACT/WORKING SESSIONS WITH THE GRANTEE OR DIRECT ASSISTANCE WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GRANT ACTIVITIES.

STUDENTS INTERESTED IN APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MUST SUBMIT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND CONCORDIA'S APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID. CHURCH-WORK STUDENTS MUST ALSO COMPLETE A DECLARATION OF INTENT FROM THEIR HOME CHURCH. WHEN ALL REQUIRED FORMS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED IN THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES (SFS), SFS COMPUTES THE STUDENT'S ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC) AND COMPILES AN AWARD PACKAGE OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS AND WORK STUDY PROGRAMS. ELIGIBILITY FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE REQUIRES THAT A STUDENT BE ACCEPTED FOR ADMISSION OR ENROLLED AND MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS ACCORDING TO ESTABLISHED STANDARDS.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

All University spending must be approved by a manager or higher level, depending on the amount of the expenditure. Any expenditure of $1,000 or above would have to be approved by a Dean or other budget center manager. An expenditure in excess of $10,000 must be approved by a Vice President (or that person's designee) or the President. Grants or assistance to outside organizations are segregated in the University's financial accounting system through the use of a separate account code, which allows for review by University's central finance department. Scholarships are provided to students who are required to matriculate in the University, thereby ensuring that the funds are expended for the intended purposes.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part II,Line 2, (h) Purpose of grant assistance:
ExplntnTxt: South Orange Performing Arts Center, Inc. (SOPAC) - Construction of South Orange Performing Arts Center.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID, DEVELOPMENT, AND BUSINESS OFFICES TOGETHER ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. THREE DIFFERENT OFFICES ARE INVOLVED IN THE PROCESS FOR ADEQUATE CHECKS AND BALANCES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE VERIFIES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANTS AND AWARDS THE GRANT FUNDS. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE CLOSELY MONITORS THE RESTRICTIONS PLACED ON THE GRANT FUNDS FROM THIRD PARTIES. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE ENSURES THAT THE GRANTEES SELECTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FULFILL THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER THE RESTRICTIONS ON THESE GRANTS. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE USES INTERNAL REPORTS PROVIDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO ASSIST WITH THIS PROCESS. THESE INTERNAL REPORTS PROVIDE BASIC DATA ON STUDENT ELIGIBILITY, SUCH AS MAJOR, GPA, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE REPORTS BACK TO THE APPROPRIATE GRANTORS CONCERNING THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE POSTS THE DISBURSEMENT OF GRANT FUNDS TO THE GENERAL LEDGER UPON RECEIVING CONFIRMATION FROM THE FINANCIAL AID AND DEVELOPMENT OFFICES. ALL GRANT INFORMATION IS KEPT ON A SECURE DATABASE. THIS DATABASE INCLUDES THE NAMES OF THE STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS, THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANTS, THE CRITERIA USED TO AWARD GRANTS, AND THE APPLICABLE SEMESTER AND ACADEMIC YEAR.

AS FEDERALLY MANDATED, THE SCHOOL PREPARES ANNUALLY A STUDENT COST OF ATTENDANCE BUDGET, WHICH INCLUDES TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND AN ESTIMATE FOR THE COST OF BOOKS, SUPPLIES, TRANSPORTATION, AND PERSONAL EXPENSES. THE SCHOOL THEN AWARDS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED UPON THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AND THE FAMILY'S EXPECTED CONTRIBUTION, AS DETERMINED BY THE FEDERAL NEEDS ANALYSIS FORMULA. STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE FUNDING IN EXCESS OF THE COST OF ATTENDANCE, AND IN CASES WHERE OUTSIDE GRANTS ARE RECEIVED, STUDENT SELF-HELP AID (I.E. LOANS AND WORK-STUDY) IS REDUCED FIRST TO ENSURE THAT AID IS NOT OVER-AWARDED. STUDENTS MUST DOCUMENT ADDITIONAL EDUCATIONALLY-RELATED EXPENSES IN ORDER TO RECEIVE FUNDING ABOVE THEIR UNMET NEEDS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING BROOKLYN LAW SCHOOL AND ARE A DIRECT OFFSET OF TUITION. FELLOWSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS UNDER STRICT SELECTION CRITERIA. LOAN FORGIVENESS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE LENDER OR REQUIRES PROOF OF DEBT REDUCTION FROM THE STUDENT.

The College has established programs for each type of scholarship and awards funds according to the parameters of each program and as funding is available. The scholarships and grants are awarded to students to be used for educational expenses at the College including tuition, fees, and books. The awards are allocated directly to each student's account.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 IN RECOGNITION OF THE CLOSE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE COLLEGE AND THE CITY OF BEVERLY, AN ANNUAL GIFT IS PRESENTED TO THE MAYOR OF THE CITY TO ASSIST IN THE FURTHERANCE OF THE CITY OF BEVERLYS INITIATIVES. THE COLLEGE PROVIDED BEVERLY MAIN STREETS WITH GENERAL SUPPORT TO PROMOTE AND ENHANCE DOWNTOWN BEVERLYS ECONOMIC VITALITY, CULTURAL AND HISTORIC RESOURCES AND QUALITY OF LIFE. ENDICOTT COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS THROUGH ITS OWN RESOURCES, AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS. TO QUALIFY FOR SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANT AID, A STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN AN APPROVED PROGRAM AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING. MOST OF THE AID PROGRAMS REQUIRE THAT STUDENTS DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. ENDICOTT AWARDS ARE MADE ON A FUNDS-AVAILABLE BASIS TO DESERVING STUDENTS. THE COLLEGE MAKES EVERY EFFORT TO ENSURE THAT A QUALITY EDUCATION IS AVAILABLE TO ALL STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF INCOME LEVEL, RACE, RELIGION, DISABILITY, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, AGE, OR GENDER.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FROM BETHANY COLLEGE ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THAT THEY MEET THE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE RESPECTIVE DESIGNATION OF THE AWARD.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THESE CRITERIA INCLUDE FINANCIAL NEED, GRADE POINT AVERAGE, AND OTHERS AS ESTABLISHED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP DOCUMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS TO PAY TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD EXPENSES.THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS SHOWN FOR SCHEDULE I PART III IS BASED ON THE NUMBER OF GRANTS AWARDED. THIS AMOUNT IS USED AS A REASONABLE ESTIMATE OF THE TOTAL NUMBER OF STUDENTS AWARDED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

This is internally funded assistance that is financed by the earnings of our restricted endowment fund. Students must meet certain criteria to fulfill restrictions of any particular scholarship. This also includes various outside scholarship gifts that are awarded by the college
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY MONITORING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF COURSES AND PROGRAMS TOWARDS EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

DREW UNIVERSITY GRANTED FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS, AS WELL AS OTHER FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID IS GRANTED TO STUDENTS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY GUIDELINES AS DEFINED BY THE FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AS WELL AS THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY. IF A STUDENT IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FEDERAL OR STATE BASED FINANCIAL AID, THE AID WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. IN ADDITION, DREW UNIVERSITY GRANTS FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED ON MERIT AND NEED CRITERIA.

PRIVATE GRANTS - THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS THE TERMS OF THE PROVIDER IN THE POSTING AND RELEASING OF GRANT FUNDS. FEDERAL GRANTS - THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION REGULATIONS TO ENSURE THAT GRANTS ARE UTILIZED APPROPRIATELY. THE NSLDS SYSTEM HELPS THE UNIVERSITY IDENTIFY ANY STUDENT THAT HAS BEEN POTENTIALLY AWARDED MORE THAN THEY ARE ELIGIBLE FOR.

QUALIFICATIONS TO RECEIVE PAYMENTS: GOVERNMENT GRANTS ARE AWARDED IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPROPRIATE FEDERAL REGULATIONS, SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACT TEST SCORES, ACADEMIC STANDING, AS SHOWN BY HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS, AS WELL AS COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT. GRANTS ARE AWARDED IN RECOGNITION OF THE QUALITY PAST ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AT THE UNIVERSITY OF HOLY CROSS, FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID, AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY FOR STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE UNIVERSITY AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND ATHLETIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

Grant funds are managed in accordance with both the sponsor and University rules and regulations. Expenditures are reviewed on a pre and post audit basis to ensure that the costs incurred and charged to a particular grant is in compliance with both the sponsor and University policies. Schedule I, Part III The cash grants are reflected on students' accounts.
THE CLEMSON UNIVERSITY REAL ESTATE FOUNDATION ONLY MAKES GRANTS TO ITS SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS. THE CLOSE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE ORGANIZATIONS SERVES TO MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The organization has rules in place to ensure that scholarship aid provided to students is used for authorized purposes. Additional detail is available upon request.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE APPROPRIATENESS OF THE AWARDS AND THESE AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

VALPARAISO UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING RESOURCES NECESSARY TO HELP STUDENTS COMPLETE THEIR EDUCATION. IN SELECTING THE STUDENTS TO RECEIVE THIS ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY PLACES PRIMARY EMPHASIS ON THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED. AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY THE UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. UPON ENROLLMENT VERIFICATION, THE AWARDS ARE USED TO OFFSET THE COST OF ATTENDANCE.

Stipends and research fellowships are funds paid to offset living expenses for trainees while they further their education at Rockefeller. These amounts are not considered salary or wages given in consideration for specific job duties nor are they grants given in anticipation of specific scientific achievements on the individuals parts. There is no restriction on the use of the funds once they are received by the trainees.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

ROCKY MOUNTAIN COLLEGE AWARDS FINANCIAL AID WHICH COMES FROM FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDS, ENDOWMENT FUNDS, DONATIONS, ETC. THE STUDENTS ARE SELECTED BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL FUND REQUIREMENTS AND IS POSTED TO THEIR ACCOUNT AS A REDUCTION. IF FUNDS EXCEED TUITION AND FEES, THE STUDENT IS GIVEN THE EXTRA FUNDS FOR LIVING EXPENSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The College awards scholarships using established policies on the basis of both need and scholarship merit. Awards to students with need are based on the students' financial information contained in the financial aid profile filed with the college scholarship services and the free application for financial aid filed with the federal processor. All aid is objectively determined and awarded on an equal basis to recipients with similar attributes.

ALL GRANTS REPORTED IN PART III OF SCHEDULE I ARE TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WITH THEIR COSTS OF ATTENDANCE. GRANTS ARE ELECTRONICALLY TRANSMITTED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID INTO THE ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE SYSTEM OF THE BUSINESS OFFICE BASED UPON SYSTEM IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS FOR INDIVIDUALS. EACH STUDENT IS ABLE TO COMPARE THE AID POSTED AGAINST HIS BILLING STATEMENT FOR TUITION AND FEES TO THE AWARD LETTER HE RECEIVED FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. ADDITIONALLY, DURING THE COLLEGE'S ANNUAL AUDIT, THIS PROCESS IS TESTED FOR ACCURACY NOT ONLY OF AMOUNTS AND ASSIGNMENT TO CORRECT INDIVIDUALS, BUT ALSO FOR ANY RESTRICTIONS OF GRANT FUNDING REGARDING AWARDEE ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED TO QUALIFY FOR ANY PARTICULAR AWARD. LINE THREE IN PART III REPORTS THE FEDERALLY FUNDED SUPPLEMENTAL GRANTS; THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY CONTRACTS FOR AN AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE UNIFORM GUIDANCE.
The Office of Financial Aid determines eligibility for institutional financial aid based on financial need and/or academic performance.

THE COLLEGE GRANTS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE COLLEGE'S DEGREE-GRANTING PROGRAM. THE COLLEGE DETERMINES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE STUDENT'S NEED. SOME SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED UPON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. THE COLLEGE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ACCUMULATES ALL REQUIRED INFORMATION FROM THE STUDENTS TO DETERMINE SCHOLARSHIP ELIGIBILITY. THE OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED UPON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGE.

The University monitors their respective grants by establishing a separate accounting for each individual grant. All transactions are reviewed and approved by appropriate personnel prior to submission for processing to ensure they meet the requirements of the grant.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY FOR STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE UNIVERSITY AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND ATHLETIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

OTTAWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS. ALL FUNDS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SERVICE TO COMMUNITY, LEADERSHIP AND INVOLVEMENT IN SCHOOL ACTIVITIES. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE OFFERED FOR FOUR YEARS OF STUDY FOR FRESHMEN AND UNTIL THE COMPLETION OF DEGREE REQUIREMENTS FOR TRANSFER STUDENTS. ALL STUDENTS MUST MEET THE STATED CRITERIA TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY. GRANTS EARNED BY THE STUDENT FROM EXTERNAL FUNDING SOURCES ARE FULLY CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITHOUT REDUCING ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS OFFERED BY OTTAWA UNIVERSITY. ACTIVITY AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES BASED ON A COMPETITIVE REVIEW BY THE GRANTING DEPARTMENT. ACTIVITY AWARDS ARE AVAILABLE IN MUSIC, ART, THEATRE, FORENSICS, AND DEBATE. ATHLETIC AWARDS ARE OFFERED ON THE BASIS OF AN EVALUATION BY THE COACH OF EACH SPORT. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS NEED BASED GRANTS TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE AN EXCEPTIONAL LEVEL OF NEED AND THE POTENTIAL TO SUCCEED. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO BEING A RESIDENTIAL CAMPUS. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO ENCOURAGE STUDENTS TO LIVE ON-CAMPUS. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY IS ABLE TO HELP STUDENTS MEET A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF THE DIRECT COST OF EDUCATION THROUGH A COMBINATION OF RESOURCES. STUDENTS ARE HIGHLY ENCOURAGED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR ADDITIONAL GRANTS, WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND LOW-INTEREST LOANS. THE ADMINISTRATIVE SOFTWARE MONITORS FINANCIAL AID ON AN ONGOING BASIS FOR GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER AID THAT MAY BE PENDING, AWARDED, ETC. THIS INFORMATION IS THEN POSTED TO THE GENERAL LEDGER AS WELL FOR BALANCING/REPORTING PURPOSES.
SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS MUST MEET REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED BY A COMMITTEE OF THE COLLEGE.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE UNIVERSITY; THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS ARE REQUIRED.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, BRANDMAN UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.BRANDMAN.EDU.

LAFAYETTE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A POLICY DEFINING ITS PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SPONSORED FUNDS BY SUB-RECIPIENTS WHO ARE PERFORMING A PORTION OF A SPONSORED PROJECT EXTERNALLY AWARDED TO LAFAYETTE. THIS POLICY PROVIDES GUIDANCE TO ENSURE THAT SUB-RECIPIENTS CONDUCT THEIR PORTION OF SPONSORED PROJECTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE LAWS, REGULATIONS, TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF AWARDS AND SUB AWARDS, AND THAT REIMBURSEMENT COSTS INCURRED BY SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE ALLOWED.

THE COLLEGE CONSIDERS THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL AID (PRIMARILY GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, LOANS, AND WORK-STUDY) TO ITS STUDENTS, INCLUDING NON-RESIDENT ALIEN STUDENTS, TO BE A U.S. BASED ACTIVITY AS STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE ARE DEEMED TO BE LIVING IN THE UNITED STATES THROUGHOUT THEIR COMPLETION OF THE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CURRICULUM AND SUPPORTING PROGRAMS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ON THE BASIS OF MERIT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. THE SELECTION CRITERIA ARE BASED ON THE CALCULATED EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION, WHICH IS DERIVED BY USING COMPLEX FORMULAS INVOLVING FAMILIES' INCOME, ASSETS, AND HOUSEHOLD SIZES INCLUDING, AMONG OTHER FACTORS, DEPENDENTS IN COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ADMINISTERS AND MONITORS THESE AWARDS TO HELP ENSURE THAT THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS, AS WELL AS RELEVANT INTERNAL COLLEGE POLICIES AND OPERATIONAL GUIDELINES. ACADEMIC PRIZES, AWARDS, FELLOWSHIP, AND INTERNSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A REVIEW BY THE APPLICABLE ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT. ALL AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AT THE COLLEGE AND ARE APPLIED TO BILLED CHARGES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT AWARD GRANTS BUT PROVIDES OTHER ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF CONTRIBUTIONS AND NON-CASH CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE UNIVERSITY AND ITS EDUCATION FOUNDATION AS SUPPORT FOR THE UNIVERSTIY AS OUR 509(A)(3) STATUS REQUIRES.

The College provides individual scholarship assistance to enrolled students in order to defray the cost of tuition and fees. This assistance is provided through direct credit to the student's account with the college, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. Depending on the source of funds, there may be donor stipulations which students may need to adhere to in order to maintain eligibility of funds. In the event of such, ongoing monitoring is performed by the College's Financial Aid department.

THE STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR THE GRANTS AND MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE VARIOUS GRANTS. THE PROCESS BY WHICH EACH GRANT IS AWARDED AND MONITORED IS FORMALIZED IN A POLICY WHICH IS UPDATED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THESE CRITERIA INCLUDE FINANCIAL NEED, GRADE POINT AVERAGE, AND OTHERS ESTABLISHED BY SCHOLARSHIP DOCUMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO PAY TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD EXPENSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE COLLEGE AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED PERSONS HAVING AN INTEREST IN THE COLLEGE, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELEY DETERMINED BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER STANDARDS. APPROXIMATELY 1,359 STUDENTS RECEIVED 28,434,105 IN INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND 507,598 IN OTHER FINANCIAL AID.

THE UNIVERSITY REPORTS ALL GRANT RECIPIENTS, INCLUDING SUB-GRANTEES, OF WHICH IT IS AWARE. THIS INCLUDES SUB-RECIPIENT AWARDS, PRIMARILY FOR RESEARCH, TO GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT UNDER 501(C)(3) AND FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES FOR WHICH NO AUTHORITY FOR EXEMPTION IS PROVIDED.
Regent University awards financial aid to students based on certain eligibility requirements. The University's financial aid package is on file at the University and is available upon request.

Vassar College raises funds for, and makes contributions to, a wide variety of 501(C)(3) organizations in the greater Poughkeepsie area. These organizations are selected annually by a committee of employees and students after review of their activities and mission. Employees and students also volunteer time at each organization. Funds are collected annually from the gifts of employees, students, trustees, and friends of Vassar as part of the "Community Works" campaign. Vassar also makes small contributions to other local non-profit and governmental entities who are not part of the campaign.

Students who are awarded scholarships have funds credited to their account and the use is restricted to purposes related to enrollment in a program of study. Recipients of fellowships are required to submit periodic written reports of their activities to the College.

ONCE THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP HAVE BEEN REVIEWED AND MET, GFU DISBURSES FINANCIAL AID FUNDS TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNT DIRECTLY, ENSURING THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED AS INTENDED FOR TUITION AND EDUCATIONAL COSTS.

MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO ENROLLED STUDENTS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNT TO COVER TUITION AND FEES. GRADE REPORTS ARE GENERATED FOR EACH TERM AND EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS REVIEWED TO INSURE THEY ARE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TO MAINTAIN THEIR GRANT OR SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING. NOTIFICATIONS ARE SENT BY THE DEAN OF THE COLLEGE TO ALERT DEPARTMENTS OF WITHDRAWALS. ALSO, FINANCIAL AID RUNS ENROLLMENT REPORTS EACH TERM TO CHECK THE NUMBER OF CREDIT HRS FOR EACH STUDENT. THIRD PARTY SOFTWARE IS ALSO CODED TO PREVENT THE CREDIT OF FUNDS TO A STUDENT WITHOUT ENROLLED HOURS.

GRANT FUNDING IS AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS THROUGH THE ADMISSION PROCESS AS WELL AS THROUGH THE COMPLETION OF THE ANNUAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). UPON ACCEPTANCE TO THE UNIVERSITY, IF DETERMINED ELIGIBLE BY ADMISSIONS, TRADITIONAL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS ARE AWARDED WITH INSTITUTIONAL MERIT OR PARTNERSHIP AID. WHEN THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL PLANNING (SFP) PACKAGES STUDENT AID, THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO THE ELIGIBLE STUDENT. ONCE THE STUDENT HAS FILED THE FAFSA FORM, ADDITIONAL AID INCLUDING FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT/LOAN FUNDS ARE AWARDED AS WELL. IF FINANCIAL AID FILES ARE COMPLETED WITH MISSING DOCUMENTATION, STUDENT AID AWARDS ARE REVIEWED AND REVISED AS NECESSARY. THE SFP OFFICE WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE STUDENT ACCOUNT OFFICE (SAO) TO RECONCILE INSTITUTIONAL, FEDERAL, AND GRANT FUNDING ON AN ONGOING BASIS THROUGHOUT THE ACADEMIC YEAR. REPORTS ARE RUN FROM THE SFP OFFICE AND SENT TO SAO TO REVIEW AND IDENTIFY ANY AID DISCREPANCIES. IF ANY ARE IDENTIFIED, THE AID IS ADJUSTED AS NECESSARY. THE SFP OFFICE REQUESTS A YEAR-TO-DATE FEDERAL PELL GRANT FILE FROM COD EVERY COUPLE OF MONTHS TO RECONCILE THE AWARDING, DISBURSEMENT, AND CANCELLATION OF A STUDENT'S GRANT AWARDS. AS THE AWARD YEAR COMES TO AN END, REPORTS MAY BE RUN ON A WEEKLY BASIS FROM THE SFP, SAO, AND COD SYSTEMS TO BE SURE ALL THE FUNDING AWARDED IS RECONCILED ACCURATELY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS A WRITTEN POLICY THAT GOVERNS THE MONITORING OF THE USE OF SPONSORED PROJECT GRANT FUNDING BY SUBRECIPIENTS. THE POLICY MANDATES MONITORING IN TWO AREAS: (A) SUBRECIPIENT INSTITUTION COMPLIANCE WITH THE AUDITING REQUIREMENTS OF OMB CIRCULAR A-133, AND (B) SUBRECIPIENT INSTITUTION'S APPROPRIATE MANAGEMENT OF SUBAWARD. THE UNIVERSITY'S SPONSORED PROJECTS FINANCE GROUP COLLECTS A-133 REPORTS FROM SUBRECIPIENT INSTITUTIONS, AND THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS CARRY OUT THE SECOND TYPE OF MONITORING, PRINCIPALLY BY: - ROUTINELY GATHERING AND REVIEWING TECHNICAL PERFORMANCE REPORTS; - ROUTINELY REVIEWING INVOICES AND EXPENSES RELATIVE TO BUDGET; - CONDUCTING PERIODIC ON-SITE VISITS, WHEN NECESSARY; AND - INITIATING AUDITS, WHEN NECESSARY.

THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS (GRANTS) ARE NON-CASH TUITION DISCOUNTS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND CANNOT BE DIVERTED FROM INTENDED USES. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED ABOVE WAS COMPILED FROM SCHOLARSHIP DISBURSEMENT RECORDS FOR THE REPORTED FISCAL YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC STANDING AND FINANCIAL NEED.
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID GRANTS THAT MAY BE USED FOR TUITION AND FEES ONLY.

EMU awards student financial assistance grants & scholarships to eligible students. Use of funds is monitored by the EMU Financial Aid Department and tracked by applying aid to the student account to offset charges to tuition and fees.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Wake Forest University carefully selects qualified exempt organizations for its contributions and provides support for worthy projects and events in which the University has an interest.Grants provided to students are monitored either through use -for University tuition and fees- or by requiring substantiation from the students for research projects or scholastic travel grants.Research subcontracts are awarded to qualifying research institutes able to complete research projects and monitored during such projects as well as by reviewing and collating the end results of the work.
THE INSTITUTE MAINTAINS DETAILED RECORDS IN THE STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM DATABASE OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE FOR USE TO REDUCE TUITION AND FEES AT WINEBRENNER AND CANNOT BE RECEIVED AS CASH OR USED ELSEWHERE.

The UnIversity awards need-based and merit-based grants and scholarships as well as various federal, state, and private scholarship, loan, and student work programs as part of its overall financial aid program. The University Financial Aid office is responsible for management of all financial aid programs.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 EMERSON COLLEGE AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PRIMARILY ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. COLLEGE MONITORING OF THE FUNDS INCLUDES DIRECTLY CREDITING AWARDS TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS WHICH ASSURES THAT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE EDUCATION PURPOSE INTENDED. ALL AID RECIPIENTS MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AS OUTLINED IN THE EMERSON COLLEGE STUDENT HANDBOOK. STUDENTS RECEIVING FEDERAL AID MUST HAVE A MINIMUM OF A "C" (2.0) GRADE POINT AVERAGE BY THE END OF THEIR SECOND ACADEMIC YEAR. FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS MAY NOT BE IN DEFAULT ON ANY EDUCATION LOANS, OWE A REFUND ON ANY GRANT, OR DEMONSTRATE ANY UNWILLINGNESS TO REPAY AN EDUCATIONAL LOAN.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid is awarded to students by the office of Student Financial Aid in the Enrollment Services Division of the Student Affairs. The awards are based on factors including academic interest, demonstrated financial need and scholarly achievement that is made up to the student's financial need . Funds are provided by private donors (corporations, individuals and foundations) contributions or endowment funds, the Federal and State governments and also from the University's operating budget. Awards are monitored on an individual basis to ensure that awardees continue to maintain the criteria for qualification such as the minimum GPA, satisfactory academic progress and demonstrated need with adjustments to the aid made as appropriate.

GRANT FUNDING IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BY STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES WITHIN ESTABLISHED BUDGET LEVELS BASED ON UNIVERSITY POLICIES. GRANT FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS ELECTRONICALLY. STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES WORKS WITH ADVANCEMENT STAFF TO ENSURE THAT RESTRICTED FUNDS ARE AWARDED WITHIN ESTABLISHED CRITERIA, AND WITH FINANCE STAFF TO DETERMINE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES MAINTAINS INTERNAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR THE CORRECT AWARDING AND ADJUSTING OF INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS. ANNUAL AUDITS ARE CONDUCTED TO ASSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. NORTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY (NU) HAS A FULL TIME EMPLOYEE TO MONITOR SUBAWARDS. - NU FOLLOWS FEDERAL REGULATIONS AS PART OF THE SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING UNDER UNIFORM GUIDANCE 2 CFR 200. - NU REVIEWS THE FEDERAL AUDIT CLEARINGHOUSE AND INSTITUTION'S SINGLE AUDIT UNDER UNIFORM GUIDANCE. - DESK REVIEWS ARE PERFORMED, AND PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS APPROVE ALL INVOICES.

RIPON COLLEGE TRACKS ALL GRANTS ISSUED BY GRANT, DOLLAR AMOUNT, STUDENT, AND TERM. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON THE GRANTEES ELIGIBILITY FOR ANY GRANT. ELIGIBILITY MAY BE BASED ON NEED, GRADES, MAJORS, ETC. IF NEED BASED, THE FAFSA WILL BE UTILIZED. EACH GRANT MAY HAVE UNIQUE SELECTION CRITERIA WHICH IS DOCUMENTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The University provides grants in the form of University scholarship for certain individuals attending the University. These scholarships are posted directly to the recipient's University billing account and, thus, reduces tuition, room and/or board fees billed to the to the recipient. The majority of these scholarships are need-based financial aid.
THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES INSTITUITIONAL AID TO STUDENTS MAINTAINING ENROLLMENT.

THE UNIVERSITY WILL PERFORM A RISK ASSESSMENT AT THE PROPOSAL STAGE BEFORE FUNDING IS APPROVED. UNIVERSITY DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATORS AND THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR WILL REVIEW INVOICES AND CERTIFY AS TO ALLOWABILITY AND APPROPRIATENESS OF CHARGES. CENTRAL SPONSORED AWARD ACCOUNTING WILL ALSO PERFORM A REVIEW THAT THE EXPENDITURES FALL WITHIN THE CONTRACT AMOUNT AND PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE.

The College of Idaho uses a combination of federal methodology and instructional policy to provide a uniform method to assess a family's financial strength and the students academic performance to estimate the expected family contribution toward the student's cost of education. The cost of education includes tuition, fees, books, supplies, room, board, personal expenses and transportation allowance.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - ALL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO ARE UNITED STATES CITIZENS ARE RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL AID MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE, POWERFAIDS, BY AMOUNT PER SEMESTER. STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES STAFF DETERMINE STUDENT ELIGIBILITY BASED ON A CONSISTENTLY APPLIED NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA WHICH CALCULATES THE EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC). THE EFC IS SUBTRACTED FROM THE TOTAL COST OF ATTENDANCE TO EQUAL THE FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY. THE FINANCIAL AID GRANT AMOUNT IS DETERMINED BASED ON CONSISTENTLY APPLIED PACKAGING FORMULAS TO MEET THE FULL CALCULATED NEED OF EACH STUDENT. IN ADDITION TO THE NEED BASED AID THAT THE COLLEGE AWARDS, THERE ARE SOME GRANTS THAT ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT OR OTHER FACTORS. FINANCIAL AID GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE, POWERFAIDS. STAFF WHO WILL BE AWARDING FINANCIAL AID GRANT FUNDS ARE TRAINED TO ADHERE TO THESE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. THE FINANCIAL AID GRANT INFORMATION IS TRANSFERRED FROM POWERFAIDS TO THE STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM, ELLUCIAN COLLEAGUE, VIA A REGULARLY SCHEDULED INTERFACE. WHEN ALL INSTITUTIONAL GRANT DISBURSEMENT REQUIREMENTS ARE MET, THE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT IN COLLEAGUE. THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED AGAINST ANY BILLED CHARGES THAT HAVE BEEN PREVIOUSLY POSTED. IF THIS TRANSACTION RESULTS IN A CREDIT BALANCE, THE CREDIT MAY BE REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT IN THE FORM OF A CHECK. THE STUDENT INITIATES THIS REFUND PROCESS BY SUBMITTING A COMPLETED DISBURSEMENT FORM OR CREDIT BALANCE REQUEST FORM. STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD OF ENROLLMENT AND ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE, AS NECESSARY, FOR CHANGES IN ENROLLMENT STATUS ACCORDING TO THE COLLEGE'S PUBLISHED REFUND POLICIES. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR, THE COLLEGE CONDUCTED GRANT-FUNDED RESEARCH. FOUR OF THE RESEARCH GRANTS INCLUDED COLLABORATION WITH INSTITUTIONS WHOSE FACULTY ARE ACCOMPLISHED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE FIELDS OF STUDY. INFREQUENTLY AT THE DISCRETION OF THE PRESIDENT OR VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION, THE COLLEGE MAKES DONATIONS TO SUPPORT THE TOWN OR NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. IN THESE INSTANCES, THE COLLEGE GENERALLY DOES NOT MONITOR THE ULTIMATE USE OF THE FUNDS AS THESE AMOUNTS ARE UNRESTRICTED GRANTS TO MUNICIPALITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE RECOGNIZED AS BEING DESCRIBED IN INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). IN CERTAIN INSTANCES WHEN THE COLLEGE GRANTS FUNDS FOR SPECIFIED USE BY THE TOWN, THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A WRITTEN AGREEMENT THAT SUCH GRANT WILL BE USED FOR THE DESIGNATED PURPOSE.

THE STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY THE COLLEGE ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER OBJECTIVE STANDARDS. ALL AWARDED FUNDS ARE TREATED AS REDUCTIONS TO TUITION. NO FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO INDIVIDUALS.

THE UNIVERSITY MAKES CONTRIBUTIONS TO NORTHWESTERN FOUNDATION, A RELATED ORGANIZATION UNDER COMMON MANAGEMENT. FOR THE GRANTS TO UNRELATED ORGANIZATIONS, SENIOR MANAGEMENT GENERALLY MONITORS RECIPIENT SPENDING VIA COMMUNICATION WITH THE ORGANIZATIONS TO SEE HOW OPERATIONS ARE RUNNING. A SITE VISIT BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT MAY ALSO BE CONDUCTED TO CHECK THE STATUS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND/OR MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF THE INTENDED PROJECT. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S UNIVERSITY ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY THE UNIVERSITY. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICY.
ALL ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS USED FOR TUITION AND FEES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. THE UNIVERSITY MAY MAKE DONATIONS TO SUPPORT ITS TOWN OR NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. IN THESE INSTANCES, THE UNIVERSITY GENERALLY DOES NOT MONITOR THE ULTIMATE USE OF THE FUNDS AS THESE AMOUNTS ARE UNRESTRICTED GRANTS TO MUNICIPALITIES OR ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE RECOGNIZED AS BEING DESCRIBED IN INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: FINANCIAL AID IS DETERMINED BASED ON A NEEDS ANALYSIS AND APPLIED TO STUDENT CHARGES THAT SUPPORT COST OF ATTENDANCE. STUDENT CHARGES ARE USED IN SUPPORT OF THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION.

ADLER UNIVERSITY OFFERS A VARIETY OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO HELP SUPPORT THE EDUCATIONAL GOALS OF ITS STUDENTS. UNLIKE STUDENT LOANS, SCHOLARSHIPS DO NOT NEED TO BE REPAID AND ARE AWARDED BASED ON A VARIETY OF CRITERIA INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, MISSION RELEVANCE, AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND SERVICE. IN ADDITION, THE UNIVERSITY GRANTS SCHOLARSHIPS TO EMPLOYEES PURSUING DEGREES AT ADLER UNIVERSITY IN THE FORM OF TUITION REMISSION. TO QUALIFY, EMPLOYEES MUST OBTAIN PRIOR MANAGEMENT APPROVAL AND THEY CAN RECEIVE UP TO 6 CREDIT HOURS OF SCHOLARSHIP EACH SEMESTER.

GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. USAGE IS MONITORED BY VIRTUE OF DIRECT ACCOUNT POSTING. ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF THE GRANTS IF DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
THE COLLEGE HAS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES IN PLACE THAT ARE FOLLOWED IN ORDER TO AWARD STUDENTS INSTITUTIONAL AID.

Gordon College awards three types of grants/scholarships: merit scholarships, need-based grants and endowment funded restricted scholarships. Merit scholarships are awarded based on the incoming student's academic criteria determined by the Admissions Office. These scholarships are renewed annually by verification of the Registrar's Office that cumulative GPA requirements are met. Need-based grants are awarded based on the student's determined financial need. We determine financial need using information provided by the FAFSA. We practice level-funding of the need-based grants to future years unless there is a significant change in determined financial need. Endowment funded restricted scholarships are awarded based on criteria established by donors. The criteria information on specific eligible students is provided by the Registrar, Admissions and Financial Aid Offices. Students are evaluated annually to verify they continue to meet the donor criteria for an endowment award.
THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCING IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MONITORING OF ALL STUDENT AID. ALL GRANT AID IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
