Entitlement grants are given for students with a family connection to the College, denominational affiliation, and travel grants for students traveling a long distance from campus. International students may be awarded grants and scholarships to come to study. Grants are awarded by the financial aid office following federal, state and institutional guidelines, which are also monitored and applied in the business office. Funds are audited annually by independent auditors.

Financial Aid monitors all the scholarships that are awarded to the students to make sure they fall within the required guidelines. Grants to domestic organizations are limited and generally de Minimis. Grants of more than $5000 are documented with the recipient domestic organization and their proper use confirmed.

ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID IS DETERMINED BY FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION REGULATIONS AND UNIVERSITY POLICIES GOVERNING FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. USING THE INFORMATION PROVIDED ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA), THE CSS PROFILE AND OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION, THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID WILL CALCULATE THE AMOUNT OF FAMILY RESOURCES A FAMILY IS EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS A STUDENT'S EDUCATIONAL COSTS. THESE RESOURCES, KNOWN AS THE EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC), ARE SUBTRACTED FROM A STANDARD BUDGET OF EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES, OR COST OF ATTENDANCE. THE COST OF ATTENDANCE INCLUDES DIRECT COSTS, FOR WHICH THE STUDENT RECEIVES A BILLING STATEMENT (TUITION, FEES AND ON-CAMPUS ROOM AND BOARD) AS WELL AS ESTIMATED INDIRECT COSTS NOT BILLED BY THE UNIVERSITY (BOOKS, SUPPLIES, PERSONAL EXPENSES, TRANSPORTATION AND OFF-CAMPUS ROOM AND BOARD). THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC) AND THE COST OF ATTENDANCE (COA) IS THE FAMILY'S MAXIMUM ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED ASSISTANCE. TO REMAIN ELIGIBLE FOR FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID, A STUDENT MUST MEET THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AS PUBLISHED IN THE UNDERGRADUATE CATALOG.
The grants and/or financial assistance provided to the students are applied directly to the student's account, ensuring that the funds are used as intended.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING STERLING COLLEGE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE NON-CASH AWARDS, REQUIRING THE AWARDS TO BE USED AS A DIRECT REDUCTION IN TUITION COST.

STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT THEIR FAFSA FEDERAL FORM TO DOCUMENT THEIR NEED FOR FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID. ONCE THE FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED, THE GRANTS ARE TRANSMITTED TO THE STUDENTS' INSTITUTIONAL ACCOUNTS TO PAY FOR TUITION CHARGES, THERE IS ALSO A FOLLOW UP PROCESS DURING THE SEMESTER AND SCHOOL YEAR TO ENSURE ACADEMIC CREDITS COMPLETION AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS BEFORE ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED.

A REPORT IS RUN AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER TO REVIEW EACH STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AND PROGRESS TOWARD THEIR DEGREE. STUDENTS RECEIVING MERIT AWARDS WHO FAIL TO ACHIEVE GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING ARE REVIEWED FOR ALTERNATIVE INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING. EVERY EFFORT IS MADE TO FIND ALTERNATIVE FUNDING FOR STUDENTS NOT MEETING GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING.

WHEN DETERMINING THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID A STUDENT WILL RECEIVE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FIRST CALCULATES HOW MUCH THE STUDENT'S FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD. THIS CALCULATION RELIES ON TWO PRIMARY SOURCES OF INFORMATION: 1) A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA); AND 2) A FINANCIAL AID PROFILE; BOTH OF WHICH ARE COMPLETED BY THE FAMILY. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE THAT FILLS THE GAP BETWEEN THE CALCULATED AMOUNT THE STUDENT'S FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD AND THE COST OF ATTENDING MACALESTER COLLEGE. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE COLLEGE AWARDS SMALL GRANTS TO NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZATIONS WORKING TO MAKE OUR NEIGHBORHOOD A VIBRANT PLACE TO LIVE, AND TO LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD COUNCILS COMMITTED TO AREA LIVABILITY ISSUES. GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A REPORT DESCRIBING USE OF GRANT FUNDS AT LEAST ANNUALLY OR AT THE CLOSE OF A SPECIFIC PROJECT. THE COLLEGE ALSO MAKES SUBAWARDS FROM GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS THAT AID IN THE RESEARCH BEING CONDUCTED. SUBRECIPIENTS MUST SUBMIT DETAILED REPORTS OF EXPENDITURES BEFORE MACALESTER WILL REIMBURSE THEM.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES: ALL Financial AID IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLE BALANCE. NO CASH IS PHYSICALLY TRANSMITTED. CREDIT BALANCES THAT RESULT FROM FEDERAL STUDENT AND PARENT LOAN PROCEEDS ARE DISTRIBUTED TO THE BORROWER WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME FRAME REQUIRED BY THE REGULATIONS GOVERNING THESE PROGRAMS. ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED GRANTS, LOANS, AND WORK-STUDY FORMS OF FEDERAL STUDENT AID IS DETERMINED USING THE RESULTS OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA. STUDENT AID AWARDED FROM BOTH FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL SOURCES ARE MONITORED CONTINUOUSLY THROUGHOUT THE FISCAL YEAR USING VARIOUS BUDGET STATUS REPORTS, STUDENT ACCOUNT STATUS REPORTS, AND DEFERRAL AND INSTITUTIONAL PROGRAM RECONCILIATION REPORTS.

Purpose of Grant: THE UNIVERSITY CONTRIBUTED TO THE BALTIMORE FESTIVAL OF THE ARTS LIGHT CITY EVENT IN BALTIMORE CITY. THIS INTERNATIONAL LIGHT FESTIVAL SHOWCASES CONCEPTUAL EXHIBITS OF ART, MUSIC, TECHNOLOGY, AND PIONEERING IDEAS.

HESSTON COLLEGE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT FOR FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID USING THE INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA FORM AS WELL AS OTHER APPLICATION MATERIALS COMPLETED FOR THEIR INSTITUTIONAL AID OFFERINGS. STUDENTS MUST MEET ALL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES TO RECEIVE FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING LOANS. SUCH GUIDELINES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, ATTENDANCE, NUMBER OF HOURS, AND A CLEAN FINANCIAL AID HISTORY. STUDENTS MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT-BASED AID AND SOME MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. IN ADDITION TO BOTH NEED- AND MERIT-BASED QUALIFICATIONS, STUDENTS MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN AID ELEMENTS. ALL DETERMINATIONS ARE MADE BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENTS, ADMISSIONS STAFF, AND DEVELOPMENT/ADVANCEMENT STAFF.

ALL FUNDS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND POSTED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS BY THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS OFFICE. STUDENTS MAY BE AWARDED GRANT FUNDS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. IN EACH CASE THE STUDENT CAN RETAIN ELIGIBILITY FOR FUNDING FOR AS MANY AS EIGHT SEMESTERS AS A FULL-TIME STUDENT, PROVIDED THE STUDENT MEETS THE RENEWAL CRITERIA SUCH AS GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND GRADE PROCESSION AS OUTLINED IN THE STUDENT HANDBOOK. AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT MAY NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THE COST OF TUITION FROM THE INSTITUTIONAL GRANT FUNDS. A RECONCILIATION IS DONE REGULARLY BETWEEN THE TWO DEPARTMENTS/SYSTEMS TO ENSURE ACCURACY AND PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS. IN ADDITION, AN ANNUAL AUDIT IS PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM TO REVIEW COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and tuition assistance are applied directly to students' tuition accounts. No cash is given to students.

ACADEMIC AWARDS ARE MONITORED AT THE TIME OF ADMISSION. ALL STUDENTS ARE REVIEWED FOR ACADEMIC AWARD ELIGIBILITY. THE SAME CRITERIA IS USED FOR ALL STUDENTS, INTERNATIONAL OR NOT. IF STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE THEY ARE NOTIFIED ALONG WITH THEIR OFFER OF ADMISSION. RENEWAL IS BASED, AMONG OTHER THINGS, ON CUMULATIVE GPA, RESIDENTIAL STATUS, ETC. FRANCISCAN INSTITUTE (FI) AWARDS ARE REVIEWED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND AMOUNTS ARE DETERMINED BY FI. ATHLETIC AWARDS ARE IN ADDITION TO ACADEMIC AWARDS AND ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE SPORT, NCAA STANDARDS, INTERNAL FUNDS AVAILABILITY, AND NEGOTIATIONS BETWEEN THE COACH AND ATHLETE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY WAS GIFTED $15,000,025 IN STOCK TO BE LIQUIDATED IMMEDIATELY. THE PROCEEDS WERE DIRECTED TO SUPPORT A COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN 3 UNIVERSITIES TO REALIZE THE VISION OF A MULTI-PURPOSE, CO-CURRICULAR, HEALTH SCIENCES RESEARCH CAMPUS IN EVANSVILLE, INDIANA. OF THIS GIFT,$8,000,000 WAS DIRECTED TO FLOW THRU THE UNIVERSITY TO INDIANA UNIVERSITY AND THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN INDIANA, IN EQUAL AMOUNTS.

THE AMOUNT OF FUNDS DISTRIBUTED IS COMPARED WITH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS TO INSURE A BALANCE OF FUNDS. STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED IS EVALUATED TO INSURE STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE AN OVER AWARD ACCORDING TO THE GUIDELINES OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED FOR ACADEMIC PROGRESS CONCERNING GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND COMPLETED NUMBER OF COURSES ONCE A YEAR.

Budgeted amounts are awarded to eligible students who apply for financial aid (selected by committee or using packaging rules). Awarded students are checked to ensure that they are still eligible to receive these funds during the course of the academic year. The scholarships are applied directly to each student's account.
FELLOWSHIP PAYMENTS ARE MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF ENROLLMENT DOCUMENTATION AND DETAILED ATTENDANCE RECORDS PROVIDED BY PROGRAM OFFICERS.

MONIES GIVEN TO THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE FOR THE SUPPORT OF ORGANIZATIONS THAT THE COLLEGE ADMINISTRATION BELIEVES IS WORTHY OF THEIR SUPPORT. THE USE OF THE FUNDS IS MONITORED IN THAT THE COLLEGE KNOWS THAT THE SPECIFIC INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK FOR THOSE ORGANIZATIONS ARE ON THE COLLEGE'S CAMPUS MINISTERING TO STUDENTS. REGARDING SCHOLARSHIPS, THESE ARE VERY SELDOM PAID IN CASH. THE SCHOLARSHIPS (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A FEW SMALL HONORS DAY AWARDS) ARE PLACED DIRECTLY ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS AND THE SCHOLARSHIPS NEVER EXCEED THE TOTAL COSTS CHARGED.

KFF OPERATES SOLELY FOR THE BENEFIT OF KCC. ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES ARE MADE BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS/REQUESTS FROM THE COLLEGE. EACH GRANT WILL ACCOMPLISH THE EDUCATIONAL GOALS AND PURPOSES OF THE COLLEGE. THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS BY MAINTAINING CONTINUAL CONTACT WITH RECEIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS.

The Academy provides scholarships to individuals to attend the Academy. Scholarship receipients are selected based on a written application which is reviewed by the Academy's faculty and staff. Scholarships are awarded based on a combination of student financial need, academic merit, and other factors and are applied directly to the student's account as a reduction in tuition and fees. The Academy monitors each recipient student to ensure that he/she remains an active, enrolled student and satisfies the academic and other criteria for maintaining the scholarship.

GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE MASTER OF DIVINITY PROGRAM AND ARE CHOSEN BASED ON NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS COMPLETED IN THE DEGREE PROGRAM, NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS TAKEN EACH TERM, AND FINANCIAL NEED.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNT AMOUNTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE POSTED DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE SUBSIDIARY ACCOUNT.

THE UNIVERSITY OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICIES AND DONOR GUIDELINES. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO MAINTAINS COMPREHENSIVE RECORD OF THE SAME.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE, FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND GRANT COORDINATOR, IF APPLICABLE, TO DETERMINE THAT REQUIRED CRITERIA ARE MET.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III SCH I, PART III, LINE 3
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT LOAN FORGIVENESS MIDWESTERN UNIVERSITY FROM TIME TO TIME FORGIVES THE LOANS OF FORMER STUDENTS DUE TO BANKRUPTCY, DEATH AND/OR DISABILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: MIDWESTERN UNIVERSITY AWARDS ITS INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. EACH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM HAS DIFFERENT ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, APPLICATION DEADLINES AND SEPARATE APPLICATION PROCEDURES. APPLICATIONS FOR THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ACCEPTED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS CAN RANGE FROM A FEW HUNDRED DOLLARS TO SEVERAL THOUSAND DOLLARS. ONCE THE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENT HAS BEEN SELECTED AND THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARD DETERMINED, THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES IS NOTIFIED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE OR DEPARTMENT. THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARD IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY HAS WRITTEN POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND MAINTAINS RECORDS FOR GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO ITS STUDENTS.

The college's financial aid office awards scholarships to students based on eligibility criteria predetermined by donors and college policies. All awards are applied to tuition and related education expenses only.

FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED OF THE RECIPIENT'S FAMILY. FINANCIAL INFORMATION AND SUGGESTED FINANCIAL NEED OF THE RECIPIENT'S PARENT(S) OR GUARDIAN(S) IS PROVIDED TO THE SCHOOL BY AN INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY.
THE COLLEGE AWARDS FINANCIAL AID PRIMARILY BASED UPON ACADEMIC MERIT. THE FUNDS ARE AWARDED VIA ADHERENCE TO A MATRIX WHICH DETERMINES THE AMOUNTS BASED UPON GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND SAT SCORES.
COLLEGETRACKS STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE GRANTS THROUGH COLLEGE TRACKS PARTICIPATE IN OUR COLLEGE SUCCESS PROGRAM, THROUGH WHICH WE MONITOR THEIR ACADEMIC AND OTHER PROGRESS THROUGH COLLEGE.
ALL GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BY THE UNIVERSITY.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DETERMINES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO THE UNIVERSITY'S ESTABLISHED ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA AND REGULATIONS.

DURING 2017-18, 72% OF THE TOTAL DICKINSON STUDENT BODY RECEIVED FINANCIAL AID FROM THE COLLEGE. SINCE MOST OF THE COLLEGE'S GRANT AWARDS ARE MADE TO STUDENTS WITH DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED, THE MAJORITY OF THESE FUNDS SUPPLEMENTED THE CONTRIBUTION THAT ELIGIBLE FAMILIES MADE TOWARD TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD CHARGES. THE COLLEGE'S INSTITUTIONAL METHODOLOGY USED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANT FUNDS CONSIDERS ADDITIONAL FACTORS BEYOND THE DATA ITEMS REQUESTED ON THE FAFSA. THESE INCLUDE (BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO) HOME EQUITY, A CONTRIBUTION FROM THE NONCUSTODIAL PARENT, AND IN THE CASE OF A FAMILY WITH MORE THAN ONE STUDENT IN COLLEGE, AN EVALUATION OF THE ACTUAL COSTS INVOLVED IN SUPPORTING THE OTHER STUDENT(S). PARENTS IN COLLEGE AND SIBLINGS IN GRADUATE SCHOOL ARE NOT NORMALLY COUNTED AS OTHER FAMILY MEMBERS IN COLLEGE. DICKINSON EXPECTS EACH FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENT TO WORK DURING THE SUMMER AND CONTRIBUTE A MINIMUM OF $2,000 TOWARD COLLEGE COSTS. STUDENTS ARE ALSO EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE A PORTION OF THEIR ASSETS EACH YEAR FOR EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES. SOME STUDENTS RECEIVE EDUCATIONAL BENEFITS FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES SUCH AS THE VETERANS' ADMINISTRATION AND STATE BUREAUS OF VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION OR FROM PARENTS' EMPLOYERS IN THE FORM OF TUITION REMISSION. SUCH BENEFITS MUST BE TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION WHEN DETERMINING THE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. THE FINANCIAL AID AWARD NOTICE WILL LIST ALL THE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS FOR WHICH THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE. THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID THAT THE STUDENT RECEIVES FROM THESE PROGRAMS DEPENDS ON THE STUDENT'S COMPUTED NEED. THE AMOUNT OF DICKINSON GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP AID MAY ALSO BE INFLUENCED BY THE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND PROMISE OF THE APPLICANT. STUDENTS' FINANCIAL NEED IS RECALCULATED FOR EACH YEAR OF ATTENDANCE; AS A RESULT, AWARDED AMOUNTS OF NEED-BASED AID MAY VARY AS NEED CHANGES. THE COLLEGE ATTEMPTS TO MAINTAIN APPROXIMATELY THE SAME AMOUNT OF DICKINSON GRANT FUNDS FROM YEAR TO YEAR UNLESS NEED CHANGES SIGNIFICANTLY. THE STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A PROFILE APPLICATION IF, AS A RESULT OF A SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IN FAMILY CIRCUMSTANCES, ADDITIONAL ASSISTANCE IS BEING REQUESTED.

GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER THE START OF EACH SEMESTER OR TERM. DOMESTIC GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS REPORTED ON SCHEDULE I INCLUDE FINANCIAL AID PROVIDED TO STUDENTS STUDYING AT THE MAIN CAMPUS IN CARLISLE OR AT OTHER DOMESTIC PROGRAM LOCATIONS. FOREIGN GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS REPORTED ON SCHEDULE F INCLUDE FINANCIAL AID PROVIDED TO STUDENTS STUDYING ABROAD.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR ALLOCATIONS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A VARIETY OF REQUIREMENTS THAT ARE RELATIVE ONLY TO THE PARTICULAR TYPE OF AWARD TO BE GRANTED. VARIOUS SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR ALLOCATIONS CAN BE AWARDED BASED ON THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT, THE STUDENT'S YEAR IN SCHOOL, OR ANY OTHER REQUIREMENT THAT MAY BE SPECIFICALLY NOTED IN AN ENDOWMENT.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 Scholarships and fellowships are awarded by Queens University of Charlotte to students based on their academic achievement, talent in the fine arts, and participation in intercollegiate athletics. The awards are based on their performance levels. Students are also awarded need-based scholarships and grants based on their need as established by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and, if applicable, by specific criteria and guidelines for other Institutional, federal and state programs.
All assistance to individuals is in the form of financial aid, grants, scholarships and tuition discounts awarded to students. Assistance is applied directly to the student's account balance.

THE COLLEGE OFFERS FINANCIAL AID TO ASSIST STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF FULL-TIME ENROLLMENT. FACTORS INFLUENCING THE AMOUNT AND TYPE OF AID AWARDED INCLUDE FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, LEADERSHIP AND OTHER PERSONAL QUALITATIVE ATTRIBUTES. THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA), WHICH HELPS TO ESTABLISH A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, SERVES AS THE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID. FILES DETAILING GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS AND CRITERIA ARE REVIEWED TO ENSURE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ELIGIBILITY BEFORE AWARDS ARE MADE. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE AGAINST ANY PERSON ON THE BASIS OF RACE COLOR, RELIGION, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, AGE, SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY OR EXPRESSION, DISABILITY, VETERAN STATUS, OR ANY OTHER LEGALLY PROTECTED BASIS.
ALL FINANCIAL AID THAT IS AWARDED IS CREDITED TO THE TUITION BILLING FOR THE STUDENT. ALL AID IS USED TO REDUCE THE TUITION PAYABLE.
The grants are distributed to the student accounts as payments to offset tuition costs.

THE RESEARCH FOUNDATiON AWARDS FUNDS TO INSTITUTIONS IN SUPPORT OF RESEARCH ACROSS THE CAROLINAS COLLABORATIVE. UNIVERSITY FACULTY MEMBERS ARE ENCOURAGED TO SUBMIT PROPOSALS DETAILING THEIR RESEARCH OBJECTIVES. PROPOSALS MEETING THE PREDETERMINED CRITERIA ARE APPROVED FOR FUNDING BY THE SELECTION COMMITTEE. FUNDS ARE DISBURSED ON A PREDETERMINED SCHEDULE BASED ON THE AGREED UPON MILESTONES. EACH RECIPIENT IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND SUBMIT PROGRESS REPORTS THAT INCLUDE ACTUAL COSTS INCURRED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Most grants are in the form of financial aid awarded to students. Grants are applied internally to the student's account with the University. The funds are used to pay the tuition, fees and room and board that are applied to the students' accounts. A small number of grants are made to faculty for research or curriculum development. Reports are required by the granting committee to ensure progress is made in concert with the grant proposal. All expenses of these grants are made through the University accounting system.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE INSTITUTION TRACKS THIS INFORMATION BY SOURCE IN ITS ENTERPRISE RESOURCE PLANNING SYSTEM.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MAINTAINS RECORDS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS AWARDED TO NCU STUDENTS IN THE POWERFAIDS DATABASE. THIS SYSTEM TRACKS ENROLLMENT AND AID ELIGIBILITY AND ENSURES THAT STUDENTS ARE NOT AWARDED AID THAT EXCEEDS THEIR COST TO ATTEND COLLEGE. IN ADDITION THESE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ALWAYS APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT IN OUR ACCOUNTING SYSTEM TO ENSURE AWARDED FUNDS GO FIRST TO COVER TUITION AND OTHER INSTITUTIONAL CHARGES.
STUDENT FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY IN ORDER TO ENSURE GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED APPROPRIATELY BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL AWARD CRITERIA.

THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THROUGH A SHARED APPROACH BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL BUDGETED TO ACTUAL GRANT ACTIVITY IS MONITORED ON A MONTHLY BASIS AND THE FINANCIAL AID FOR EACH STUDENT IS APPROVED PRIOR TO DISBURSING FUNDS. GRANT REPORTING AND COMPLIANCE ARE MONITORED BY THE BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO ENSURE ACCURACY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ISSUES GRANTS TO QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS. THE GRANT FUNDS ARE THEN USED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT AS PAYMENT TOWARDS THEIR COLLEGE EDUCATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part II GW HILLEL
ExplntnTxt: IN RECOGNITION OF THE SERVICES THAT GW HILLEL PROVIDES TO STUDENTS AT GW, GW AND GW HILLEL CONDUCTED A JOINT FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN FOR THE RENOVATION, MAINTENANCE, FURNISHINGS, AND ENDOWMENT OF GW HILLEL'S FACILITIES LOCATED ON THE GW CAMPUS. ALL RESTRICTED CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED BY GW UNDER THE CAMPAIGN ARE AWARDED AS GRANTS TO GW HILLEL UNDER THE TERMS OF THE JOINT FUNDRAISING AGREEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENT AND ORGANIZATIONS: GW MAINTAINS A FORMAL SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING POLICY WHICH APPLIES TO ALL SUBAWARDS ISSUED UNDER ALL SPONSORED PROJECTS AWARDED. THE POLICY APPLIES TO SUBRECIPIENTS WHO ARE ASSIGNED RESPONSIBILITY FOR CONDUCTING A PORTION OF GW'S SPONSORED PROJECT WORK. GW IS RESPONSIBLE TO THE SPONSOR FOR MANAGEMENT OF FUNDS AND FOR MEETING PERFORMANCE GOALS. GW HAS INTERNAL PROCEDURES FOR ASSESSING THE SUBRECIPIENT ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATUS AND INTERNAL CONTROLS IN ORDER TO DETERMINE WHETHER TO PROCEED WITH THE SUBRECIPIENT. BASED ON THE ASSESSMENT, TERMS AND CONDITIONS ARE ESTABLISHED IN THE SUBAWARD AGREEMENT TO BE CONSISTENT WITH THE LEVEL OF PERCEIVED RISK AND IDENTIFY SPECIFIC MONITORING ACTIVITIES. GW UNDERTAKES CERTAIN ACTIVITIES TO MONITOR SUBRECIPIENTS TO PROVIDE REASONABLE ASSURANCE THAT THEY ADMINISTER, PERFORM AND ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS, REGULATIONS, TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE PRIME AWARD AND GW'S SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS. RISK ASSESSMENT AND AWARD MONITORING PROCEDURES ARE DEFINED BY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES AT GW AND INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, THE PRINCIPAL INVEStigaTOR, DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATORS, CENTRAL RESEARCH, AND FINANCIAL OFFICES WITHIN GW. GW HILLEL ONLY - THE ORGANIZATION PRESENTED PLANS FOR THE RENOVATION, MAINTENANCE, FURNISHING, AND ENDOWMENT OF GW HILLEL'S FACILITIES LOCATED ON THE GW CAMPUS. DETAILS, SUCH AS BUDGETS, ARE PROVIDED TO GW ON REQUEST IN CONNECTION WITH ITS REVIEW. A REPORT WILL BE PROVIDED TO GW UPON COMPLETION OF THE RENOVATION. MEDICAL FACULTY ASSOCIATES, INC. JOINT FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN ONLY - MFA AGREES TO SPEND PHILANTHROPICALLY RAISED FUNDS CONSISTENT WITH DONOR INTENT AND TO PROVIDE ANNUAL REPORTS ON THE USE OF EXPENSED FUNDS AND RELATED DETAIL TO GW. HOME FOR THE HATCHET JOINT FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN ONLY - GW AND HOME FOR THE HATCHET AGREE TO COLLABORATE ON THE JOINT FUNDRAISING EFFORTS. IN DOCUMENTATION OF ITS USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS, HOME FOR THE HATCHET AGREES TO SUBMIT ITS BUDGET, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND MOST RECENT FORM 990 FILED WITH THE IRS TO GW ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE KEEPS RECORDS ON ITS INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEM THAT SUBSTANTIATES THE AMOUNT GRANTED TO EACH STUDENT, THE ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR EACH STUDENT, AND THE SELECTION PROCESS USED IN AWARDING ASSISTANCE. THE UNIVERSITY'S GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE INITIALLY CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT IN ITS INTEGRATED SOFTWARE SYSTEM IN ORDER TO PAY FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, AND/OR TEXTBOOK CHARGES. A CHANGE IN ENROLLMENT STATUS RESULTS IN WEEKLY REPORTS THAT FINANCIAL AID STAFF REVIEW FOR POSSIBLE ADJUSTMENTS. THE BALANCE OF AID IN EXCESS OF THE ABOVE CHARGES CAN BE REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT FOR LIVING EXPENSES. THE SYSTEM CHECKS THAT THE STUDENT IS STILL ENROLLED BEFORE ISSUING THE REFUND. AT THE GRADUATE LEVEL, AWARDS ARE INITIATED, CHECKED TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY AND APPROVED BEFORE AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO A STUDENT AND A STUDENT MUST ACCEPT THE AWARD BEFORE PAYMENT PROCESSES BEGIN. QUALIFICATIONS FOR ENDOWMENT AWARDS ARE CHECKED AND THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS FOR AWARDS ARE CHECKED FOR EVERY ENDOWMENT AWARDEE. PAPERWORK IS KEPT IN THE OFFICE FOR THREE YEARS AND THE AWARD LETTERS ELECTRONICALLY FOR FIVE YEARS. OUR ELECTRONIC SYSTEMS, BANNER AND EAS, HAVE THE RECORDS OF PAYMENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: DUE TO THE VARIOUS TYPES OF GRANT FUND EXPENDITURES THE UNIVERSITY USES MULTIPLE INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF U.S. GRANT FUNDS AND ASSISTANCE. FELLOWSHIPS, PRIZES AND STIPEND PAYMENTS ARE MADE THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL SERVICES AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. THE PROCESS REQUIRES PRE-APPROVAL BY A PARTICULAR DEPARTMENT-HEAD AND SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION AND AUTHORIZATIONS ARE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO PROCESS A PAYMENT. A MAJORITY OF PAYMENTS ARE MADE VIA CHECK. FOR DOMESTIC SCHOLARSHIPS, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE (FAO) MAINTAINS AN INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AID ACCOUNTING SYSTEM. THE FAO ADMINISTERS THE LISTING OF AWARD RECIPIENTS AND RECONCILES, ON A MONTHLY BASIS, THE CORRESPONDING EXPENSES WITH THE UNIVERSITY GENERAL LEDGER SYSTEM. THE CASH GRANTS ARE ALSO REFLECTED ON EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE INDEPENDENTLY RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS AFTER ALL REQUIRED SYSTEM-FEED DOCUMENTATION HAS BEEN RECEIVED. ADDITIONALLY, ALL FEDERAL SCHOLARSHIP ACTIVITIES ARE MONITORED SEPARATELY BY THE SPONSORED ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT (SPA). FOR SUBCONTRACT RESEARCH GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS A SPONSORED RESEARCH ACCOUNTING (SPA) DEPARTMENT WHICH HAS FINANCIAL OVERSIGHT FOR ALL GRANT AND CONTRACT ACTIVITY. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL ASPECTS OF A GRANT ALONG WITH THE COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES. SPECIFIC GRANT-RELATED EXPENDITURE ACTIVITIES ARE PROCESSED BY THE UNIVERSITY ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. SUB-RECIPIENT MONITORING: A PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) NEGOTIATES SUBCONTRACTS WITH SUB-RECIPIENTS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PROVOST. WHEN AN AGREEMENT IS FULLY EXECUTED, IT MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS ACCOUNTING (SPA) ALONG WITH A COMPLETED CONSULTANT PAYMENT FORM. ANY ISSUES REGARDING SUB-RECIPIENT PERFORMANCE ARE REPORTED TO THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PROVOST AND SPA. ALSO, SPA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THAT ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133 REQUIREMENTS.
The University makes occasional donations to charitable organizations which are not monitored beyond the original grant determination process.

EACH GRANTEE IS ONLY GIVEN FUNDS AFTER THEY PROVIDE THE COLLEGE-READY PROMISE WITH A DETAILED ACCOUNT OF WHAT THE FUNDS HAVE EITHER BEEN SPENT ON PREVIOUSLY OR WHAT THEY WILL BE SPENT ON IN THE FUTURE.

AFTER AN APPLICATION IS SUBMITTED BY THE STUDENT, FINANCIAL AID EVALUATES IT FOR NEED AND BASED ON THEIR ENROLLED COURSES, AND THIS IS RE-EVALUATED EACH YEAR AS NEED AND ENROLLMENT INDICATE. THE UNIVERSITY DOES MONITOR THE USE OF THE STUDENT AID AND IT IS APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT BILLING ACCOUNT IN THE UNIVERSITY'S SIS (STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM).

Pitzer College awards scholarships only to individual undergraduate students. These scholarships are awarded based upon academic achievement and/or demonstrated financial need. The Financial Aid Office, with the assistance of the Registrar's Office, monitor student enrollment each semester to ensure that students remain qualified for financial aid. The College also awards tuition to dependents of its employees who meet the requirements of the College's Tuition Remission Program. Employee dependent's must be enrolled at one of the undergraduate schools of The Claremont Colleges. Tuition is paid directly to the undergraduate college after grades are submitted to the Human Resources Office as evidence of course completion.

GRANTS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE THEN USED FOR TUITION AND OTHER EXPENSES RELATED TO EDUCATION (BOOKS, LAB EQUIPMENT, ETC). FUNDS ARE GENERALLY NOT ACTUALLY RELEASED TO THE STUDENTS, BUT ARE USED TO OFFSET TUITION COSTS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
OF THIS AMOUNT, $34,700 ARE FOR AWARDS THAT ARE RELEASED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE QUALIFICATIONS OF EACH RECIPIENT. THE GUIDELINES ARE PUBLISHED IN CONVERSE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CATALOG AND COMPLY WITH ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS PUBLISHED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. ANNUAL COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE COMPLETED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A LISTING OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT.

PIT STAFF (BUSINESS OFFICE, GRANT ADMINISTRATOR, VICE PRESIDENT AND PROVOST) HAVE MONTHLY MEETINGS TO REVIEW GRANT DISBURSEMENTS. THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR GOES TO CONFERENCES AS SCHEDULED. WHEN THE GRANT IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS, THEN FINANCIAL AID AND STUDENT SERVICES VERIFY STUDENT ELIGIBILITY. THE BUSINESS OFFICE KEEPS COPIES OF ALL DISBURSEMENTS AND PROVIDES COPIES TO GRANT ADMINISTRATORS. BUSINESS OFFICE STAFF TRACK ALL SALARIES COVERED BY GRANTS.

THE GRANTS ARE EXECUTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH EACH RESPECTIVE GRANT AGREEMENT. THEY ARE RECONCILED MONTHLY AS PART OF OUR MONTH END CLOSE PROCEDURE. EACH GRANT IS REPORTED TO ITS RESPECTIVE AGENCY AS REQUIRED IN THE GRANT AGREEMENT (I.E. MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ONE TIME).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form Sch I Part I Line 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS NEED-BASED AND MERIT-BASED AWARDS. THE NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE BASED ON THE FAFSA FORM THAT IS SUBMITTED BY UNIVERSITY STUDENTS AND AWARDED ACCORDING TO THEIR FINANCIAL NEED. MERIT-BASED AWARDS ARE BASED ON SAT, GPA AND OTHER TEST SCORES. UNIVERSITY AWARDS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS TO STUDENTS ACCORDING TO UNIVERSITY POLICIES. FUNDS ARE MANAGED BY THE OFFICES OF STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND FINANCIAL AFFAIRS TO COMPLY WITH ALL APPLICABLE COMPLIANCE REGULATIONS.
CASH GRANTS ARE CREDITS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

SCHEDULE I, Part I, Line 2 SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS ALL REQUESTS FOR USE OF GRANT FUNDS AGAINST THE SUBMITTED BUDGETS FOR THE RESPECTIVE GRANTS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF REQUESTS FOR REIMBURSEMENT, ADDITIONAL REVIEW OF EXPENDED FUNDS IS PERFORMED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT AND COLLEGE GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THE DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S MONITORING PROCEDURES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING STEPS: 1, PERFORM A RISK ASSESSMENT ON SUB-RECIPIENT 2, PERFORM SITE VISITS TO REVIEW FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC RECORDS 3, ENSURE THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR HAS REGULAR CONTRACTS 4, ENSURE A CURRENT CERTIFICATION OR A-133 AUDIT IS PERFORMED AND THE RELATED REPORT RECEIVED AND REVIEWED.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON THEIR FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC MERIT. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON THE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS POLICY INSTITUTED BY THE INSTITUTION. BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE RECONCILE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS EACH SEMESTER TO VERIFY THAT THEY INDEED ARE CORRECT ON THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT AND IN THE G/L SYSTEM.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: PART III GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS - REGARDING THE MONITORING OF GRANTS\SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS, ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED AND ELIGIBLE FOR THE AWARDED AMOUNTS. THE AWARDS ARE APPLIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED AND USED TO PAY FOR THE EDUCATIONAL COSTS AS DESCRIBED BY THE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS.

WHEN DETERMINING THE DISTRIBUTION OF GRANTS AND LOANS TO STUDENTS, THE CULINARY INSTITUTE OF AMERICA COMPLIES WITH THE GUIDELINES OF THE U.S. DEPT. OF EDUCATION - TITLE IV REGULATIONS, NY STATE BOARD OF REGENTS AND THE ACCREDITING COMMISSION OF CAREER SCHOOLS AND COLLEGES OF TECHNOLOGY (ACCSCT) AND MIDDLE STATES ASSOCIATION COMMISSION ON HIGHER EDUCATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND/OR ENROLLMENT STATUS. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS (SAP) IS THE MEANS USED TO MONITOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED. SAP MEASURES BOTH QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE PROGRESS. THE AWARDS ARE USED FOR TUITION, ROOM, AND BOARD.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BY REVIEWING STUDENT NEED BASED ON THE FAFSA REPORT, AWARDING BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED AID CRITERIA, AND MONITORING THE STUDENT STATUS EACH TERM.
LA SALLE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS RECORDS TO QUANTIFY THE DOLLAR AMOUNT OF THE STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AWARDED, THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS PER GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP, AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Disbursements in furtherance of the University's exempt programs are made in accordance with procedures or subject to conditions established by the institution's governing board designed to insure that individuals and organizations receiving disbursements from the organization in furtherance of its exempt programs are adequately investigated to insure that they are qualifying recipients. Students receiving scholarships, student loans, etc. are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial needs and other similar standards.

GRANTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS ARE MADE UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND THE ACADEMIC PROMISE OF STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID. ALL RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE MADE TO STUDENTS.

FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE INSTITUTE AND ARE USED TO OFFSET CHARGES TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. NO EXCHANGE OF FUNDS OCCURS. THE AWARD IS SIMPLY A CREDIT TOWARDS THE STUDENTS' TUITION BALANCES.

THE COLLEGE MAKES GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE. THE SELECTION OF GRANT RECIPIENTS IS MADE BASED UPON OBJECTIVE CRITERIA. NO ONE IS DISCRIMINATED AGAINST BASED UPON RACE, RELIGION, GENDER, ETHNIC BACKGROUND, AGE, HANDICAP OR ANY OTHER REASON. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ASSESSES AND MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. IT IS ASSISTED IN ITS ON-GOING REVIEW BY THE RESOURCES OF THE REGISTRAR AND STUDENT ACCOUNTS DEPARTMENTS.
SCHOLARSHIPS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF THE COLLEGE OR TRUST INSTRUMENT WHO ESTABLISHED THE SCHOLARSHIP FUND.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE SERVES AS THE COORDINATING DEPARTMENT FOR ALL TYPES OF FUND RAISING PROGRAMS AND FOR SOLICITATION OF GIFTS. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS/RESTRICTIONS ARE MADE AND MONITORED BY ADMISSIONS OFFICE AND DEANS. THE ACCOUNTING STAFF RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS IN SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART II, COLUMN H LINE 1 - SAINT ANNE'S SHRINE - THE CONTRIBUTION TO SAINT ANNE'S SHRINE WAS MADE TO PROVIDE SUPPORT OF THEIR MISSION TO SERVE AS A WELCOMING PLACE OF PEACE AND HOPE MINISTERING TO ALL GOD'S PEOPLE THROUGH PRAYER, DEVOTION, HOSPITALITY AND SPIRITUAL RENEWAL. THE SHRINE WAS DEVELOPED AND MAINTAINED FOR THE PAST 100+ YEARS BY THE SOCIETY OF SAINT EDMUND, THE CATHOLIC RELIGIOUS COMMUNITY WHICH IS ALSO THE FOUNDER OF SAINT MICHAEL'S COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE SHARES A SIMILAR MISSION TO CONTRIBUTE THROUGH HIGHER EDUCATION TO THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE HUMAN PERSON AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF HUMAN CULTURE IN THE LIGHT OF THE CATHOLIC FAITH. ADDITIONAL LAND WAS ACQUIRED BY THE SOCIETY AND LODGING WAS CONSTRUCTED TO PROVIDE OVERNIGHT FACILITIES TO CONDUCT PROGRAMMING NEEDS OF THE COLLEGE FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF CAMPUS MINISTRY, STUDENT LIFE, ATHLETICS AND ACADEMIC AFFAIRS. THE COLLEGE BENEFITS FROM USE OF THE FACILITIES AT THE SHRINE FOR CURRICULUM ENHANCEMENT, STUDENT AND STAFF RETREATS AND WORSHIP. EMPLOYEES FROM CAMPUS MINISTRY AND OTHER COLLEGE EMPLOYEES WORK TO DEVELOP, MONITOR AND IMPLEMENT PROGRAMMING GOALS ENSURING THAT DONATIONS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE. LINE 2 - VERMONT CARES - THE CONTRIBUTION TO VERMONT CARES WAS MADE TO SUPPORT THEIR MISSION TO WORK FOR AND WITH VERMONTERS AFFECTED BY HIV/AIDS TO PROMOTE WELL-BEING THROUGH A CONTINUUM OF PREVENTION, SUPPORT, AND ADVOCACY SERVICES. VERMONT CARES ENVISIONS A WORLD OF COMPASSIONATE NEIGHBORHOODS WHERE PEOPLE LIVE FREE OF THE STIGMA,POVERTY AND OPPRESSION ASSOCIATED WITH THE HIV/AIDS EPIDEMIC AND PEOPLE OF VERMONT MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT HIV PREVENTION, SERVICES AND TREATMENT. THIS ORGANIZATION WAS CHOSEN TO RECEIVE THIS DONATION BY THE COLLEGE'S STUDENT ASSOCIATION WHICH INVITES LOCAL NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO APPLY TO A $10,000 DONATION THROUGH AN APPLICATION PROCESS. THREE ORGANIZATIONS ARE THEN CHOSEN TO EACH MAKE A PRESENTATION TO THE STUDENT BODY DESCRIBING THEIR ORGANIZATION, ITS MISSION AND THE USE OF THE GRANT BY THE NON-PROFIT. THE COLLEGE'S STUDENTS THEN VOTE FOR THE ORGANIZATION THEY WANT TO RECEIVE THE DONATION. THE ORGANIZATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO COME BACK TO THE STUDENT ASSOCIATION IN TWO YEARS TO PRESENT THE IMPACT OF THE AWARD. VERMONT CARES IS USING THE GRANT FOR FUNDING FOR THEIR NEWLY INITIATED MOBILE TESTING STATION IN ORDER TO INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY FOR TESTING FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO MAY NOT OTHERWISE HAVE THE RESOURCES TO DO SO.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART III THE COLLEGE RECOGNIZES THE HIGH COST OF A PRIVATE EDUCATION AND ATTEMPTS TO ADDRESS AS MUCH AS WE PRACTICALLY CAN TO CLOSE THE GAP BETWEEN THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AND FAMILY RESOURCES USING A VARIETY OF SOURCES, INCLUDING FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL (COLLEGE) FUNDING. THE THREE TYPES OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WE EMPLOY INCLUDES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, LOANS AND STUDENT EMPLOYMENT. IN 2017-2018, THE COLLEGE ADMINISTERED OVER $56 MILLION IN ASSISTANCE, OF WHICH APPROXIMATELY $36 MILLION WAS PRIMARILY COLLEGE FUNDED AID, SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS. THE COLLEGE'S PRACTICE HAS BEEN TO AWARD AID BASED ON MERIT AND/OR NEED TO ALL STUDENTS ACCEPTED FOR ADMISSION. THE AMOUNT OF AID A STUDENT RECEIVES UPON INITIAL ENROLLMENT GENERALLY IS AWARDED FOR EACH YEAR HE/SHE ATTENDS SAINT MICHAEL'S COLLEGE.

Funds are directly applied to eligible student accounts who are registered for sufficient tuition credits according to federal guidelines. Credit balances on student accounts are refunded automatically to either the student or to the original source of the funds.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The college receives grant funds from the U.S. Department of Education through the Title III and IV programs. The college awards federal financial aid to students based on eligibility criteria specified by federal regulations. The college has sophisticated internal processes to determine a student's eligibility for federal financial aid, and to monitor compliance.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS ARE PUT INTO A SEPARATE AND UNIQUE FUND AND THE EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AGAINST THE PROPOSAL AND AWARD. THE COLLEGE MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE TWO MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE AMOUNTS GIVEN BY THE GRANT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. THE ALLOCATION OF GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS AND MUNICIPALITIES IS DETERMINED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BY THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION AND TREASURER. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. ELIGIBILITY FOR BOWDOIN GRANT ASSISTANCE IS "NEED BASEDDETERMINED THROUGH ANALYSIS OF A FAMILYS INCOME AND ASSETS. FAMILY INFORMATION IS COLLECTED THROUGH THE COLLEGE BOARDS CSS/FINANCIAL AID PROFILE FORM, FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND THE FAMILYS FEDERAL INCOME TAX RETURNS. EXCEPT FOR NATIONAL MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT OFFER MERIT BASED AID. THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A STUDENT AID OFFICE TO COUNSEL STUDENTS/FAMILIES ON HOW TO AFFORD A BOWDOIN EDUCATION AND TO ENSURE THAT AWARDS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ESTABLISHED POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, FINANCIAL AID HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENT TUITION BILLS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid Office follows Dept. of Education and other applicable regulations, subject to yearly A133 audit.

The University awards grants, scholarships & student loans based on various, predefined criteria. Students must qualify for the assistance. Student enrollment and continuing eligibility are verified on an ongoing basis. The University also grants funds to its supporting organization, Point Loma Nazarene University Foundation. The use of these funds is monitored through direct oversight of the Foundation. The finance department of the University maintains the books and records of the Foundation.

INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS ARE OFFERED TO ATTRACT AND RETAIN STUDENTS. DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROCEDURES OR ARE SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING BOARD DESIGNED TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS FROM THE COLLEGE, IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS EXEMPT PROGRAMS, ARE ADEQUATELY INVESTIGATED TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, AS DETERMINED THROUGH INFORMATION PROVIDED ON THE STUDENT FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). MANAGEMENT AWARDS MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS THAT QUALIFY, BASED ON DONOR STIPULATIONS (I.E. SPECIFIC MAJORS, LOCALITY, ETC.) AND AWARDS FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE NEED BASED AWARDS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES TO STUDENTS FOR THEIR HIGHER EDUCATION EXPENSES. INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING AWARDS ARE ON CAMPUS AND MEET WITH FINANCIAL AID COUNSELORS TO ENSURE STUDENTS ARE RESIDENTS WITHIN THE US AND ENROLLED AT THE INSTITUTION.
THE COLLEGE PROVIDES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO ITS FULL-TIME, DEGREE SEEKING STUDENTS, BY CREDITING SUCH AMOUNTS DIRECTLY TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS, TO BE ONLY USED AS AN OFFSET FOR TUITION.
SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THEIR ACCOUNT WITH THE COLLEGE TO OFFSET TUITION AND OTHER SIMILAR COSTS. NO CASH IS AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS.
RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON A VARIETY OF FACTORS, SUCH AS FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE AND COURSE OF STUDY, AS STIPULATED BY THE AWARD/ENDOWMENT CRITERIA.

The University provides funding to faculty and students for scholarships, research and other projects. Expenses must be substantiated under the Accountability Plan to ensure proper use of funds. Students must meet the requirements specified in the respective award program in order to receive the award. The requirements include criteria such as financial need, obtaining/maintaining the required grade point average and studying in a certain academic discipline, etc. If the scholarship is ongoing, the student must continue to meet the scholarship requirements in order to be awarded a scholarship in subsequent years. Financial need, grade point averages and other scholarship criteria are continually monitored to determine whether the student meets the criteria.

Procedures and conditions are designed to insure that individuals receiving disbursements are adequately investigated to insure that they are qualifying recipients. Students receiving scholarships and fellowships are judged worthy based on the institution's assessment of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards.
Student financial aid is credited to the individual student accounts and their net balances are monitored by the Business Office.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: TO ENSURE PROPER USE OF THE GRANTS AWARDED, USAC CREDITS THE GRANT AMOUNT DIRECTLY TO THE PROGRAM FEE ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT LIMITING ITS DIVERSION TO UNINTENDED USES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part II Grants and Other Assistance to Domestic Organizations and Domestic Governments
ExplntnTxt: PER SCHEDULE I INSTRUCTIONS, THE UNIVERSITY HAS INCLUDED DONATIONS TO DONOR ADVISED FUNDS (DAF) THAT EXCEEDED THE MINIMUM REPORTING THRESHOLD. IN TOTAL, THE UNIVERSITY REPORTED 43 NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES THAT RECEIVED DONATIONS FROM HARVARD UNIVERSITY THROUGH THESE DAF. AS WITH ANY DAF, DISTRIBUTIONS MADE FROM THE FUND ARE TYPICALLY MADE AT THE REQUEST OF THE DONOR ADVISOR AND MUST BE MADE TO AN IRC 501(C)(3) CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL DISBURSEMENTS MADE BY THIS INSTITUTION IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY AUTHORIZED COMMITTEES OR INDIVIDUALS. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY HARVARD'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICES. IN ADDITION, HARVARD UNIVERSITY IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PROGRAMMATIC AND FINANCIAL MONITORING OF ITS SPONSORED RESEARCH AWARD SUBRECIPIENTS. PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS AND PROJECT STAFF PERFORM ONGOING REVIEWS OF PROJECT ACTIVITIES. IN ADDITION, ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, UNIVERSITY RESEARCH ADMINISTRATORS REVIEW ALL ACTIVE SUBCONTRACTS AND INQUIRE FURTHER INTO THOSE THAT ARE DEEMED TO REQUIRE CLOSER SCRUTINY IN LIGHT OF A VARIETY OF ATTRIBUTES. UPON IDENTIFICATION OF SUBRECIPIENTS THAT MANDATE CLOSER SCRUTINY, HARVARD IMPLEMENTS ADDITIONAL MONITORING ACTIONS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH SUBAGREEMENT PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS, AND WITH ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.

The Office of Financial Aid administers the following policies to assure that institutional grants and scholarships are used for proper purposes: The aggregate of institutional funds that an individual student receives is restricted to an amount equivalent to tuition and fees; enrollment is confirmed each semester prior to disbursement of institutional funds; Eligibility for academic scholarships is limited to a maximum of eight (8) semesters. Renewal grade point average requirements are checked at the end of each academic year; Eligibility for institutional general grants requires a demonstration of need based on submission of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA); Endowed scholarships have selection criteria specific to each fund and the Director of Financial Aid oversees the selection of eligible students; when a student withdraws from school, the percentage adjustments made to institutional aid are the same as the percentage adjustments made to tuition as specified in the catalog.

GRANT PROPOSALS ARE REVIEWED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S GRANTMAKING COMMITTEE. IF THE PROPOSAL MEETS THE GRANT GUIDELINES THE COMMITTEE DECIDES ON WHETHER TO FUND THE PROJECT. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS BASED ON DIFFERENT CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL POLICIES AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AID PROGRAMS WHEN IT AWARDS FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS. THE UNIVERSITY REQUIRES THE GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS TO SUBMIT REPORTS TO SUPPORT THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS.
THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION WAIVERS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE APPLIED TOWARD THEIR TUITION.
STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION SHOWING FINANCIAL NEED. THE STUDENTS MUST USE THE SCHOLARSHIP AT THE CINCINNATI COLLEGE OF MORTUARY SCIENCE AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING.

SCHEDULE I, PART 1, LINE 2 PACIFIC UNIVERSITY AWARDS FEDERAL AND STATE AID ONLY TO U.S. CITIZENS AND ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS. ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS ARE DEFINED AS THOSE LIVING IN THE U.S. FOR "OTHER THAN A TEMPORARY PURPOSE THEY CAN POSSESS A VARIETY OF DOCUMENTS WHICH DEMONSTRATES THAT STATUS, INCLUDING I-551S AND I-94S WITH CERTAIN STAMPS. APPLICANTS WHO FILE A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) HAVE THEIR FAFSA DATA MATCHED WITH DATA IN SEVERAL FEDERAL DATABASES, INCLUDING THE SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION AND THE DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY. WHEN THOSE DATABASE MATCHES ARE NOT SUCCESSFUL, WE OBTAIN DOCUMENTATION FROM THE APPLICANTS TO ENSURE THAT WE ARE AWARDING FEDERAL AND STATE AID ONLY TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS. THAT DOCUMENTATION BECOMES PART OF THEIR FINANCIAL AID FILES AND IS RETAINED FOR AT LEAST FIVE YEARS. ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS MUST ALSO BE OREGON RESIDENTS TO RECEIVE STATE AID. INSTITUTIONAL AID ONLY IS AWARDED TO CERTAIN INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS WHO ARE IN THE U.S. SOLELY OR PRIMARILY TO PURSUE POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION. ON AN ON-GOING BASIS, STAFF IN FINANCIAL AID AND BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS THE ACTIVITY OF ALL AWARDING AND DISBURSEMENT ACTIVITY OF AWARDS AND LOANS ON A MONTHLY BASIS AT A MINIMUM. ANY DIFFERENCES OR ANOMALIES ARE INVESTIGATED IMMEDIATELY AND, IF NEEDED, CORRECTED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Based on financial need.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: FOR FOUNDATION SCHOLARSHIPS, THE FOUNDATION GENERALLY RECEIVES THE FUNDS DIRECTLY OR VIA THE DISTRICT CASHIER'S OFFICE AND DEPOSITS THEM INTO A "CONTRIBUTIONS" ACCOUNT TO TRACK THE REVENUE. THE MANAGER RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS MONITOR, REVIEW AND VERIFY THAT EXPENSES CHARGED TO THE SCHOLARSHIPS QUALIFY UNDER THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE DONOR. SCHOLARSHIP EXPENSES ARE CHARGED DIRECTLY TO OBJECT CODES WITHIN THE FOUNDATION FUNDS CALLED STUDENT AWARDS AND GRANTS OR GRANTS PAID.

Appalachian Bible College awards various scholarships to students for the purpose of assisting with tuition and related college expenses. Students must meet eligibility requiremetns before funds are awarded. Awards are applied directly to student accounts.

THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DETERMINES THE ELIGIBILITY OF ALL STUDENTS AT THE COLLEGE AND MAINTAINS APPROPRIATE RECORDS TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT PACKAGES AID BASED ON INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S NEED. ALL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS IS ELECTRONICALLY REPORTED TO THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.
GRANT FUNDS ARE RECORDED IN A PROJECT ACCOUNT SO THAT ALL ASSOCIATED REVENUES AND EXPENSES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR RELATED TO A SPECIFIC GRANT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRADUATE STUDENTS ADMITTED TO THE SEMINARY RECEIVE A FULL TUITION SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS ADMITTED TO THE KOLLEL LEARNING PROGRAMS MAY ALSO RECEIVE A STIPEND AND/OR HOUSING BENEFIT.SITE VISITS AND FOLLOW-UP DISCUSSIONS WITH THE MANAGEMENT OF GRANTEES ARE CONDUCTED TO ASSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED TAX-EXEMPT EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

To ensure that the grants made to individuals in the United States, other than work study grants, are used for proper purposes and are not otherwise diverted from the intended use, the faculty department that has budgetary control of the funds selects and monitors the recipients of these grants. For work study grants, the faculty or administrative department where the student's work was performed approves all student work hours and submits paperwork to the payroll office for payment to the student.

Name of organization or government: Ballykeel, Inc. (H) purpose of grant or assistance: Agnes Scott solely transfers to Ballykeel the funds to pay the annual lease payment for property held by Ballykeel, a supporting organization of Agnes Scott. The amount is determined pursuant to a review of the lease terms.

Regarding grants and assistance to students in the U.S.: the College determines the students' eligibility prior to releasing the grant, and then monitors their enrollment status and satisfactory academic progress.

The University's Business and Financial Aid offices ensure that appropriate controls are established and that grant requirements for documentation for proper tracking and reporting of expenditures are met. Independent reconciliations of this data is performed several times during the fiscal year between the two offices. An annual audit is performed by an external audit firm who examines the work of these two offices.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE INYTITUTE ASSIGNS RESPONSIBILITY FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ITS OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH. THIS OFFICE MONITORS ALL GRANT MAKING ACTIVITY INCLUDING ALL APPLICABLE COMPLIANCE REGULATIONS. MONITORING INCLUDES PERIODIC REVIEWS OF BUDGET TO ACTUAL REPORTS BY BOTH THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH AND THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE USED ACCORDING TO THE AGREEMENT. EXPENSES ARE ACCOUNTED FOR ON AN ACCRUAL BASIS.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, FINANCIAL AID HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENT TUITION BILLS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO BOSTON PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY, AS PART OF THE CITY OF BOSTON, WHICH ASSISTS THE ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP DOWNTOWN BOSTON AND SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS PURSUANT TO COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO CAMBRIDGE STREET DEVELOPMENT CORP, A 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION WHICH ASSISTS THE ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP THE CAMBRIDGE STREET AREA OF THE CITY OF BOSTON. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO EAST BOSTON HIGH SCHOOL FOR ITS ATHLETIC PROGRAMS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE FUND FOR PARKS AND RECREATION IN BOSTON FOR UPKEEP OF ATHLETIC FIELDS USED BY THE UNIVERSITY AS WELL AS THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS. ALL GRANTS AWARDED ARE BASED ON NEED AND/OR MERIT AND CONFORM TO FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON A THOROUGH REVIEW AND VERIFICATION OF A FAMILY'S INCOME, ASSETS, SIZE AND NUMBER OF DEPENDENTS ENROLLED IN COLLEGE. ANNUAL EXPENDITURE REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS FOR REVIEW. THE FUND EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE IN AN ANNUAL AUDIT CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM.

The College receives a report from the grantee organization on the progress of the program and the use of the funds. Scholarships are awarded according to scholarship protocols and are continually monitored for satisfactory progress. These scholarships are applied directly to each student's account at the College.

The College follows federal guidelines for determining the financial need of each student. The College Board Profile and the FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid) provides information to determine financial need. Grants and scholarships are awarded based on the demonstrated need of each student. The College has a Town Gown Committee which awards small grants to local community organizations based on submitted proposals. The total amount of such grants is less than $100,000.

PROCEDURES FOR APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID: WHENEVER POSSIBLE, CATAWBA COLLEGE WILL SUPPLEMENT THE FINANCIAL RESOURCES OF A STUDENT THROUGH MERIT, PERFORMANCE-BASED, AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. A POTENTIAL STUDENT APPLIES AND IS ACCEPTED TO CATAWBA COLLEGE. AT THE TIME OF THEIR ACCEPTANCE, MERIT AID IS DETERMINED BY THE ADMISSIONS COUNSELOR ACCEPTING THE APPLICATION BASED ON A MATRIX CHART THAT HAS BEEN SET UP WITH REGARD TO GPA AND SAT SCORES, LIVING ON OR OFF CAMPUS, AND A SEPARATE TRANSFER STUDENT MATRIX. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AND, THUS, MUST BE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. WITH REGARDS TO ATHLETICS AT CATAWBA COLLEGE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL ATHLETES TO MAKE SURE THEY DO NOT GO OVER CONFERENCE REGULATIONS REGARDING BOOKS AND SUPPLIES. CATAWBA COLLEGE REFERS TO THE NCAA DIVISION II MANUAL FOR POLICIES REGARDING STUDENT ATHLETES. THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR SIGNS OFF ON THE SQUAD LISTS AND CHECKS FOR ELIGIBILITY WITH THE COMPLIANCE DIRECTOR. THE ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENTERING THE ATHLETIC INFORMATION INTO THE CAI SYSTEM. THE CAI SYSTEM IS ALSO USED TO DETERMINE EQUIVALENCY COMPUTATIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO UNIVERSITY POLICY. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE MONITORED BY MANAGEMENT. RECONCILIATION BETWEEN FINANCIAL AID AND ACCOUNTING ARE DONE ON A MONTHLY BASIS. SCHEDULE I, PART III CASH GRANTS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS AND APPLIES CRITERIA BASED ON CIRCUMSTANCE, GRADE-POINT AVERAGE AND NEED. THE PROCESS IS APPLIED CONSISTENTLY TO ALL STUDENTS OF THE INSTITUTION.
MONITORING OF GRANT USE: ALL GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER VERIFYING ENROLLMENT STATUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

SPRING ARBOR UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING RESOURCES NECESSARY TO HELP STUDENTS COMPLETE THEIR EDUCATION. IN SELECTING THE STUDENTS TO RECEIVE THIS ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY PLACES PRIMARY EMPHASIS ON THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED. AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY THE UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. UPON ENROLLMENT VERIFICATION, THE AWARDS ARE USED TO OFFSET THE COST OF ATTENDANCE.

DETAIL OF SUBAWARDS IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS RESEARCH ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER MAKES SUB-AWARDS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT PERFORM RESEARCH IN CONNECTION WITH RESEARCH GRANTS AWARDED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT CATEGORIZE THESE SUB-AWARDS AS "GRANTS" FOR FORM 990, SCHEDULE I REPORTING, SINCE THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS PERFORM RESEARCH SERVICES FOR THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE CONSIDERED INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS WHICH SERVE THE DIRECT NEEDS OF THE UNIVERSITY. --------------------

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 AND PART III
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT SCHOLARSHIP, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE DISBURSEMENT OF GRANTS AND FEDERAL LOANS TO STUDENTS.STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER ARE SELECTED AND THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR LOANS DETERMINED BY OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY PROCESSES APPLIED TO ALL SIMILARLY SITUATED INDIVIDUALS. THE DECISIONS ARE MADE ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS THROUGH EVALUATING THE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED OF THE APPLICANT IN LIGHT OF THE FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR THIS PURPOSE. --------------------

Grants are only for scholarship and are substantiated in the Financial Aid Office on the basis of need and merit. The grants are applied directly to the tuition statements of the individual students. Only students enrolled at Lake Forest College receive grants.

INSTITUTIONAL GIFT AID IS AWARDED IN VARIOUS FORMS VIA THE FOLLOWING selection PROCESS: 1) ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS: THE SELECTION OF THESE STUDENTS IS MADE BY THE OFFICE OF THE UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE, PH.D. AND LAW ADMISSIONS, AND THE STUDENT'S APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION SERVES AS THE SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION; 2) TALENT AWARDS (ATHLETICS AND MUSIC): THE DECISION REGARDING THE AWARD RECIPIENTS IS MADE BY THE APPROPRIATE DEPARTMENT AND/OR COACH. STUDENTS ARE EITHER RECRUITED OR NOMINATE THEMSELVES FOR AWARD CONSIDERATION. SELECTION IS USUALLY BASED UPON PERFORMANCES AND AUDITIONS; AND 3) NEED BASED AWARDS: THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE FAFSA. SELECTION IS MADE WITHIN APPROPRIATE UNIVERSITY GUIDELINES. THUS, THE AWARDS ARE NOT REPORTED AS GRANTS. STUDENT LOANS: ST. MARY'S PARTICIPATES IN TWO FEDERAL LOAN PROGRAMS: 1) THE CAMPUS-BASED FEDERAL PERKINS STUDENT LOAN PROGRAM, IN WHICH SELECTION OF STUDENT RECIPIENTS IS MADE BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED UPON THE FAFSA AND FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AND 2) THE FFLEP PROGRAM, IN WHICH THE STUDENT SELF-SELECTS THE LENDER AND THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE CERTIFIES ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON FEDERAL REGULATIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: BY INSTITUTIONAL POLICY, TCU'S OFFICE OF SCHOLARSHIP AND FINANCIAL AID ACTS AS THE FINAL APPROVAL AUTHORITY FOR ALL FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATION. EACH STUDENT'S AWARD PACKAGE IS REVIEWED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS, AND IN THE CASE OF RESTRICTED INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS, WITH THE DONOR'S INTENT AND WISHES. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON A SCORING MATRIX THAT EVALUATES AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S SUCCESS USING NATIONAL TEST SCORES, RANK IN CLASS, AND HIGH SCHOOL GPA. THOSE WHO HAVE EXCELLED ACADEMICALLY ARE GENERALLY GIVEN THE LARGEST SHARE OF UNIVERSITY FUNDED DOLLARS. ELIGIBILITY FOR ALL FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDED FINANCIAL AID IS BASED SOLELY ON THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA. INSTITUTIONALLY FUNDED NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS ARE BASED ON ELIGIBILITY ESTABLISHED BY THE CSS PROFILE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ALSO WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE DONOR RELATIONS DIVISION OF UNIVERSITY ADVANCEMENT TO ENSURE THAT OUR DONORS' WISHES ARE MET WHEN MATCHING FUNDS TO STUDENTS. ALL DONORS OF ENDOWED AWARDS ARE PROVIDED WITH A "SCHOLARSHIP AGREEMENT" OUTLINING THE UNIVERSITY'S UNDERSTANDING OF THE DONOR'S INTENT. THESE AGREEMENTS MUST BE APPROVED BY BOTH THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID, AND THE VICE-CHANCELLOR FOR ADVANCEMENT, TO ENSURE THAT THE UNIVERSITY HAS THE CAPABILITY TO IDENTIFY APPROPRIATE RECIPIENTS. IN ADDITION TO INSTITUTIONALLY FUNDED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, TCU MANAGES AND ACCEPTS FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR A VARIETY OF FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDED FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. ELIGIBILITY FOR TITLE IV FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND STATE FUNDED NEED-BASED AID PROGRAMS IS DETERMINED USING FEDERAL METHODOLOGY AND REQUIRES THE SUBMISSION OF THE FAFSA. PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT, EACH RECIPIENT MUST PASS A VARIETY OF EDIT CHECKS, OR "DISBURSEMENT RULES" TO ENSURE THAT THE STUDENT IS ENROLLED IN CLASSES AND HAS SUBMITTED ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION NEEDED TO SATISFY PROGRAM ELIGIBILITY. AFTER DISBURSEMENT, STUDENT AID RECIPIENTS ARE REVIEWED AT THE END OF THE 100% TUITION REFUND PERIOD FOR A FINAL ENROLLMENT STATUS DETERMINATION. STUDENTS WHO RECEIVED AID BASED ON PROJECTED FULL-TIME ENROLLMENT, BUT WHO HAVE DROPPED BELOW 12 CREDIT HOURS, ARE SUBJECT TO AN ADJUSTMENT OF THEIR AID PACKAGE. AT THE END OF THE 25%, AND FINAL REFUND PERIOD, STUDENTS ARE AGAIN REVIEWED AND SUBJECT TO AID ADJUSTMENT BASED ON FINAL COSTS FOR THE TERM. AID RECIPIENTS ARE MONITORED ON A REGULAR BASIS THROUGHOUT THE ACADEMIC YEAR. FILES ARE REVIEWED WEEKLY TO IDENTIFY UPDATED FAFSA APPLICATIONS FROM THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR AND ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE WHEN REQUIRED. REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE TEXAS HIGHER EDUCATION COORDINATING BOARD PERIODICALLY FOR REVIEW OF STATE AID RECIPIENTS, AND THE UNIVERSITY IS SUBJECT TO PERIODIC AUDITS AND REVIEWS FROM BOTH ENTITIES. ACADEMIC SUCCESS IS THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF ALL AID PROGRAMS, AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS REVIEWED AT THE END OF EACH TERM. AT A MINIMUM, FULL-TIME STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AT LEAST 75% OF ATTEMPTED HOURS AND OBTAIN A 2.00 GPA TO MEET RENEWAL REQUIREMENTS. MOST TCU FUNDED AWARDS REQUIRE A MINIMUM GPA OF 2.50. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRE A 3.25 GPA. ONCE POSTED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS, THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES ALSO MONITORS AWARD AMOUNTS IN RELATION TO SPECIFIC CHARGES. AWARD AMOUNTS THAT APPEAR TO BE OUT OF NORM ARE REFERRED BACK TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOR REVIEW.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WHOSE STAFF IS TRAINED AND CONTINUOUSLY EDUCATED REGARDING FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE STAFF OF THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT AND DETERMINES THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT CAN BE AWARDED TO THE STUDENT BASED ON FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF ALSO AWARDS GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ENDOWED GIFTS THAT COMPLY WITH THE TERMS OF THE ENDOWED GIFTS.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STUDENTS AND DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 2 - PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE QUALIFICATIONS OF EACH RECIPIENT. THE GUIDELINES ARE PUBLISHED IN LIMESTONE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CATALOG AND COMPLY WITH ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS PUBLISHED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. ANNUAL COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE COMPLETED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. AS FUNDS ARE RECEIVED, THEY ARE POSTED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON ESTABLISHED FEDERAL AND COLLEGE POLICIES. AWARDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AT THE COLLEGE AS CREDITS TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES.

CLEVELAND CHIROPRACTIC COLLEGE OF LOS ANGELES IS A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION OF CLEVELAND UNIVERSITY - KANSAS CITY. DUE TO THE OVERLAP OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS BETWEEN THE TWO ORGANIZATIONS, NO MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS NECESSARY AFTER THE FACT.

MANOR COLLEGE AWARDS STUDENTS ATTENDING THE COLLEGE WITH SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE. THE AWARDS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AT MANOR COLLEGE THEREFORE ENSURING THE PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS.

THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID RECORDS AND FOLLOWS APPROPRIATE SELECTION CRITERIA FOR ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO STUDENTS. THE UNIVERSITY HAS AN ANNUAL COMPLIANCE AUDIT CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133 EACH YEAR. FOR THE YEAR ENDED 6/30/2018, THE AUDIT REPORTED THAT THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIED, IN ALL MATERIAL RESPECTS, WITH THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF ITS MAJOR FEDERAL PROGRAMS.
THE SCHOOL HAS GRANT RECIPIENTS SIGN THE AWARD LETTER TO ACCEPT CONDITIONS OF THE GRANT.

GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS REQUIRE QUARTERLY PROGRAM REPORTING INCLUDING A NARRATIVE AND FINANCIAL SUMMARY THAT IS REVIEWED BY THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY THE COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE COLLEGE'S POLICY.
NSF SUBAWARD - STEP CENTER/INTEGRATE: INTERDISCIPLINARY TEACHING OF GEOSCIENCE FOR A SUSTAINABLE FUTURE

PACIFIC LUTHERAN UNIVERSITY OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

Grants and aid are tracked in the accounting system in a temporarily restricted fund or reimbursed according to a qualified reimbursement policy. An audit of funds granted is conducted when deemed necessary. Funds are given and monitored by the mission trip teams that are sent to work with Del Camino and Iteams each year. The funds are specifically used for the work done during the mission trips. Life Promotions funding goes to sponsor the annual Lifest Conference in Wisconsin. The University's Admissions team monitors the use of funds.
ALL GRANT AND CONTRACT ACTIVITY IS MONITORED TO ASSURE THAT IT IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE REGULATIONS. ALL EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED ON A WEEKLY BASIS FOR ALLOWABILITY.
ALL GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BY THE UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: grants or other assistance in the united states
ExplntnTxt: form 990, schedule i, part i, line 2 Elizabethtown College provides scholarships to students matriculating at the College. Students receiving scholarships are not permitted any discretion on how to spend those funds as all amounts are used to satisfy tuition costs. Accordingly, all funds granted are used to defray the cost of tuition and no further monitoring of the grants is required.

Although students and their families bear the primary responsibility for meeting costs, many find they cannot pay the full cost of an education by themselves. In most cases a financial aid package will involve family contributions, acceptance of federal assistance (including grants and loans), and financial aid from John Brown University. These financial assistance programs help fill the gap between the amount a family is expected to pay and the total educational cost. The amount the family is expected to pay is based on information provided on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). The tuition assistance is applied to the student's account and therefore, no cash changes hands.

All grant funds received by the university are overseen by our Financial Aid Department. The Director of Financial Aid works closely with the Dept of Education and our Student Accounts Department to ensure proper management of the students' funds. As funds are approved and released, disbursement reports are given to our Student Accounts Department and funds are electronically uploaded to the individual student tuition accounts and verified for accuracy. All funds are uploaded within the prescribed window of three business days and all funds are available to the student with 14 days of disbursement to their account.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY PRIMARILY CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED AND MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS BASED UPON A NUMBER OF DIFFERENT CRITERIA, INCLUDING MERIT, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND FINANCIAL NEED. 1,372 STUDENTS RECEIVED FINANCIAL AID DURING THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR FROM A COMBINATION OF ALL SOURCES (FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL). OF THE 1,372 STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID, 1,372 RECEIVED FUNDING FROM INSTITUTIONAL SOURCES.

THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL PLANNING MONITORS ALL AWARDS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. ADDITIONALLY, THE COLLEGE ENGAGES AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB A-133.
GRANTS AWARDED ARE PART OF AN OVERALL SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IN WHICH CRITERIA AND AMOUNTS AWARDED ARE RECORDED BY GRANTEE.

The financial aid planning office requires students to complete the free application for federal student aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based on certain academic credentials or performance in a university sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the university catalog and the university website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University. Scholarships are applied directly to each student's account.

THE MAJORITY OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE AWARDED ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE POLICIES OUTLINED BY THE FUNDING SOURCE. TYPICALLY, GRANT MONEY IS RECEIVED BY THE COLLEGE AND IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE FEDERAL WORK-STUDY PROGRAM DOES ALLOW FUNDS TO BE DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENT STUDENT. GIFTS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE CHARITABLE IN NATURE AND DO NOT REQUIRE FORMAL MONITORING OF THE USE OF FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE MONITORED COLLABORATIVELY BY THE OFFICE OF THE REGISTRAR, OFFICE OF THE BURSAR, FINANCIAL PLANNING, AND THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE TO VERIFY ELIGIBILITY, APPROPRIATE SELECTION CRITERIA AND APPLICATION OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS. FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.
THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS THE GUIDELINES FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS TO ENABLE THEM TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY. ALL FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BASED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY AWARDING THOSE FUNDS ONLY TO ENROLLED STUDENTS TO BE USED FOR STUDENTS' TUITION AND FEES. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO AN AUDIT BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR ON AN ANNUAL BASIS PURSUANT TO OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

THE COLLEGE BASES AWARDS ON FINANCIAL AID BY SEVERAL CRITERIA; MERIT, NEED, PERFORMANCE, EMPLOYEE DISCOUNT, ATHLETIC, FEDERAL FUNDED AND OTHER AID. ONLY STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED IN CLASSSES ARE AWARDED AID.

THE MAJORITY OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD FOR ITS STUDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BASED ON A COMBINATION OF MERIT AND NEED. THEY ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: BENEDICTINE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTERS FEDERAL TITLE IV, STATE, PRIVATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS IN THE FORM OF STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, WAIVERS AND AWARDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID FOLLOWS SPECIFIC GRANT PROGRAM CRITERIA TO: DETERMINE STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION; MONITOR APPROPRIATE HANDLING OF FUNDS, AND; MEET REPORTING AND RECORD RETENTION REQUIREMENTS. DOCUMENTATION OF ALL STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FUNDING IS MAINTAINED IN THE STUDENT'S AID FILE AND UNIVERSITY COMPUTER SYSTEM.

THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTERS, RECONCILES, AND REPORTS ALL AID TO STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH GRANT AGENCY PROCEDURES. FUNDS ARE VERIFIED, REVIEWED, AND RECONCILED TO ENSURE APPROPRIATE RECORDING.

STUDENTS AWARDED WITH AN HONOR SCHOLARSHIP MUST BE PART OF THE UNIVERSITY'S HONOR PROGRAM AND THIS PROGRAM HAS SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS THAT THE STUDENTS MUST MEET EVERY TRIMESTER IN ORDER TO RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS AWARDED WITH AN ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIP MUST MEET CERTAIN REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED BY THE ATHLETIC DEPARTMENT. STUDENTS ARE SELECTED BY A COMMITTEE PART OF THE VICE PRESIDENCY OF STUDENTS AFFAIRS.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS A SET OF CRITERIA BY WHICH COLLEGE AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS OF ALL STUDENT AID AWARDED AND SUBSTANTIATION FOR THE AWARDS.
FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BY FINANCIAL PROFESSIONAL IN ACCORDANCE WITH COLLEGE POLICIES.

Shorter Univerity participates in the student financial assistance programs through the U.S. Department of Education. Funds are awarded and applied to student accounts based on the Department of Education guidelines set forth by the Title IV programs.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DETERMINES IF A STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A SCHOLARSHIP FROM THE UNIVERSITY AND, IF ELIGIBLE, WILL APPLY THE APPROVED SCHOLARSHIP PAYMENT TO THE RESPECTIVE STUDENTS TUITION ACCOUNT. NO CHECKS ARE ISSUED TO THE STUDENTS DIRECTLY. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS TO ENSURE THEY ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

All students seeking need based financial assistance are required to complete the FAFSA. Eligibility, or need, is determined through federal methodology and resulting Expected Family Contribution as set against standard cost of attendance. Need based aid is awarded based on federal and/or state eligibility requirements and institutional aid is awarded according to institutional policy. Amounts of aid awarded are in compliance with governing regulations or institutional policy. In compliance with Title IV regulations, total aid from all sources cannot exceed need or the annual cost of attendance, regardless of the level of need. Aid awards are posted to student accounts as an offset to semester charges. Institutional policy prohibits the release or refund of aid to students unless total charges for the semester have been paid.

PROCESS FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A COMPUTERIZED SYSTEM WITH INTEGRATED CONTROLS TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED CRITERIA AS APPROVED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND FEDERAL AND STATE AUTHORITIES, AS APPROPRIATE. A SERIES OF REPORTS HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED AND ARE USED BY MANAGEMENT TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS ANY EXCEPTIONS. ANNUALLY, THE COLLEGES FINANCIAL AID COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL GUIDELINES IS AUDITED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE COLLEGE ISSUES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO ARE REQUIRED TO MATRICULATE AT THE COLLEGE. THE STUDENT DOES NOT HAVE ANY DISCRETION ON HOW FUNDS ARE USED; ALL FUNDS ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COSTS OF PARTICIPATING IN THIS PROGRAM, THEREFORE, THE COLLEGE IS NOT REQUIRED TO FURTHER MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. PROCESS FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. IN EACH CASE, THE COLLEGE IS AWARE OF THE CHARITABLE USE OF THE FUNDS, WHICH IS TYPICALLY FOR THE GENERAL PURSUIT OF THE RECEIVING ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSES AND NOT EARMARKED FOR A SPECIFIC USE. THE COLLEGE BELIEVES IN EACH INSTANCE THAT THESE FORMS OF ASSISTANCE ARE IN THE COLLEGE'S BEST INTEREST IN PROMOTING ITS IMAGE AND THE PURSUIT OF ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE.
