PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: MARIAN UNIVERSITY IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROL REQUIREMENTS OF OMB-A133 AND FOLLOWS ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES. INSTITUTIONAL AND PRIVATELY FUNDED FINANCIAL AID IS DETERMINED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOLLOWS ALL REGULATIONS WHEN AWARDING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY IS REVIEWED EACH TERM TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH AWARDING INSTITUTIONAL, FEDERAL AND STATE AID WITH POLICY AND PROCEDURES. THE COLLEGE ALSO FILES ANNUAL STATE GRANT YEAR END REPORTING, FISAP AND IPEDS DATA. STUDENTS ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON THEIR PER TERM STANDING AND AID IS EVALUATED BASED ON THEIR ENROLLMENT.

GIFTS/SPONSORSHIPS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS WHICH SUBSTANTIATE ELIGIBILITY AND THE AMOUNT OF ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO STUDENTS. NEED BASED ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED BY USING INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA, AND MERIT BASED STUDENT AID IS DETERMINED USING VARIOUS FACTORS TO ASSESS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF THE STUDENT.

The University does not provide grants or assistance to organizations other than assistance in the form of student scholarships. Should the University consider future grants awards to organizations, monitoring will be done in accordance with OMB Uniform Guidance and sub-recipient monitoring procedures.

THE SEATTLE SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY & PSYCHOLOGY MAINTAINS SCHOLARSHIP RECORDS IN THE FINANCIAL AID MODULE OF CAMPUS VUE, OUR STUDENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. THE AMOUNTS ARE SUBSTANTIATED, RECORDED, AND TRACKED BY USING THE STUDENT'S NAME AND SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER OR STUDENT ID. AFTER THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE HAS MET AND DETERMINED THE RECIPIENTS, THE NAMES ARE SENT TO THE STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE; WE THEN AWARD, BATCH AND DISBURSE THE FUNDS TO THE INDIVIDUAL RECIPIENT'S LEDGER CARD. ALL FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR OUTSTANDING BALANCE DUE ON THEIR LEDGER CARD. NO FUNDS ARE RELEASED TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF CASH.

ALL FIRST-TIME STUDENTS TO MITCHELL COLLEGE ARE REVIEWED FOR MERIT AID. THERE IS NO SEPARATE APPLICATION PROCESS. IF STUDENTS ARE AWARDED MERIT AID, THE NOTIFICATION LETTER WILL BE SENT ABOUT TWO WEEKS AFTER THEIR ACCEPTANCE LETTER ARRIVES. MERIT AID IS BASED ON ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND/OR COMMUNITY SERVICE INVOLVEMENT. STUDENTS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN OBTAINING NEED BASED AID, EITHER FROM FEDERAL AND STATE RESOURCES OR MITCHELL COLLEGE'S OWN FUNDS MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AT WWW.FAFSA.ED.GOV. FINANCIAL AID, SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS AWARDED IS APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH A REDUCTION IN TUITION CHARGES.

MONITORING GRANT FUNDS: GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE USED FOR TUITION AND ALLOWABLE EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES. AWARDS ARE BASED ON NEED DETERMINED FROM A FEDERAL FAFSA APPLICATION. GRANT FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE TUITION AND FEES OF THE AWARDEE AND DO NOT LEAVE POSSESSION OF THE COLLEGE, THEREFORE NO MONITORING IS NECESSARY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grants distributed by Dartmouth consist primarily of scholarships, fellowships and related support given to Dartmouth students. Scholarships are awarded based on the financial need of the student. Scholarship applications are reviewed by a financial aid officer. Financial aid officers are expected to recuse themselves from any case in which they either have a personal interest or feel they cannot be impartial. A random sampling of cases read by each undergraduate financial aid officer is reviewed by the Associate and Senior Associate Directors to ensure compliance with federal regulations, adherence to Dartmouth policies, consistency in results and accuracy. Scholarships are credited to an individual student's account through the Banner Student Information system after the student has enrolled for the term (these credits are included in "non-cash assistance" in Part III above) Scholarship funds are withdrawn if the student ceases to be enrolled. Fellowships are granted in support of a student's educational or research endeavors. All educational and research work is monitored by Dartmouth faculty. The Dartmouth Entrepreneurial Network (DEN) has educational and funding programs that promote entrepreneurship within the Dartmouth College community. Prizes and awards reported in Part II represent DEN programs that include startup competitions which are open to Dartmouth College students, faculty, staff and alumni. Entries are evaluated by a group of Dartmouth College alumni, entrepreneurs and expert business practitioners, on the basis of which businesses are most likely to create significant social and/or economic value.
Grants received are applied directly to student tuition invoices. The grants are used to gap the bridge between financial aid and the full amount of tuition due.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY OF DAYTON IS AN INDEPENDENT UNIVERSITY THAT PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS. THE STUDENTS QUALIFY TO RECEIVE THIS AID BASED UPON THEIR FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC TALENT. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED THAT DOCUMENT THE STUDENTS' FINANCIAL NEED, ELIGIBILITY TO QUALIFY FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS AND THE AMOUNTS AWARDED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS HAWAI'I PACIFIC UNIVERSITYS OFFICES OF FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS OVERSEE FEDERAL AND UNIVERSITY GRANT, SCHOLARSHIP, LOAN AND WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS. FEDERAL PROGRAMS ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE LAWS, RULES AND REGULATIONS ISSUED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, OR OTHER GRANTING AGENCY. UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES IMPLEMENTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITYS ENROLLMENT PLAN. THE OFFICES AWARD AID BASED ON THE FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION TO VERIFY A STUDENTS ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED BASED PROGRAMS AND SCHOLARSHIPS WHERE NEED IS A CRITERIA. IN ADDITION, STUDENTS ARE REVIEWED BASED ON ACADEMIC AND TALENT QUALIFICATIONS FOR MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IN AREAS SUCH AS DANCE, ATHLETICS, MUSIC, DEBATE AND OTHER AREAS. PRESIDENTS SCHOLARS SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT, GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND RECOMMENDATIONS. FINANCIAL AID AND THE SCHOLARSHIPS OFFICES MONITOR THE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY OF STUDENTS FOR AWARDS. OCEANIC INSTITUTE FOLLOWS ITS SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO MONITOR THE USE OF FUNDS DISBURSED TO SUBRECIPIENTS. THE PROGRAM MANAGER, GRANT SPECIALIST AND ASSOCIATE CONTROLLER REVIEW ALL SUBRECIPIENT INVOICES AND SUPPORTING RECEIPTS. THE PROGRAM MANAGER REVIEWS THE SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS TO DETERMINE IF THE EXPENSES ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE AWARDS SCOPE OF WORK. THE GRANT SPECIALIST COMPARES ACTUAL EXPENSES WITH BUDGETED EXPENSES. THE ASSOCIATE CONTROLLER DETERMINES IF THE COSTS CLAIMED ARE ALLOWED AND APPROVES THE DISBURSEMENT.
Scholarships

Goucher College's institutional grant funds are limited to need-based and merit-based financial assistance for attendance at the College. Goucher College's comprehensive program of need-based and merit-based financial assistance is managed by the Office of Student Financial Aid. Financial need is determined by subtracting the Expected Family Contribution - as calculated on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) from the student's total cost of attendance. Financial aid is awarded for one year only and must be renewed annually. Need-based aid is renewed to continuing students who demonstrate need and who are making satisfactory progress toward their degrees. Institutional merit-based scholarship requirements vary depending on the award. Compliance with those requirements is also overseen by the Office of Student Financial Aid.

ALL FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BALANCE AT THE COLLEGE. USE IS INTERNALLY CONTROLLED BY THE COLLEGE. NECO SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRE A "GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING."

FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND STUDENT ACCOUNTING AND IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

Each year Albany Law School awards a number of merit and diversity scholarships funded from restricted and unrestricted endowment funds, annual giving by alumni and friends and other sources. The Admissions Committee awards the scholarships to first year students in the form of scholarships in varying amounts. Financial Aid personnel, in conjunction with Development and Business Office personnel, are responsible for monitoring compliance with restrictions associated with the endowment funds. All scholarships are merit-based and awarded on the basis of academic promise and individual characteristics that strengthen the applicant pool. The Admissions Committee also offers merit-based scholarships to students from diverse backgrounds including those minorities who historically have been under-represented in the legal profession. A scholarship may be retained from year to year without re-application upon achievement of grades set forth as conditions of the award. Monitoring of continued awarding for second and third year students is performed by the Financial Aid Office in conjunction with the Registrar's Office.
The Organization awards grants to students to be used for educational purposes by debiting the student's account directly. This system ensures the funds are used appropriately.
THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS ITS CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS IN A SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNT.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON EITHER THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA OF THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING, ACADEMIC MERIT, OR TALENT. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS SCHOLARSHIP FUND AVAILABILITY, MAKES SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS, AND MAINTAINS AN ON-GOING AWARENESS OF STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: CENTRAL COLLEGE EMPLOYEES ANNUALLY REVIEW COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE GRANTS RECEIVED. IN ADDITION, CENTRAL COLLEGE IS REQUIRED TO PARTICIPATE AND FILE THE FEDERAL SINGLE AUDIT OF FINANCIAL AID PERFORMED BY OUR EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: After the initial review and approval by the appropriate employees at the grant department level, the paperwork for grant expenditures are then passed on to the next review and approval level by an applicable College or Departmental Administrator of grant expenditures. Upon approval, the paperwork is sent to the Senior Grants Accountant for review and approval prior to payment processing of the grant expenditures. The scholarships to students are administered by the financial aid office. The scholarship amounts are internally credited to the individual students' billed tuition to ensure funds are used for their intended purpose.

ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE THAT ARE PROVIDED BY THOMAS AQUINAS COLLEGE ARE PART OF A NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM THAT ASSISTS STUDENTS WITH THE COST OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. BESIDES GRANTS, THE ONLY OTHER ASSISTANCE OFFERED IS A NEED-BASED EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE, THE GRANTEE'S ELIGIBILITY FOR THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE, AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA USED TO AWARD THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE. ALL GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE CAREFULLY MONITORED BY THOMAS AQUINAS COLLEGE. THE AMOUNTS ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY INTO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND CONSEQUENTLY, THE COLLEGE HAS FULL CONTROL OVER HOW THE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE USED.

ALL INSTITUTIONAL MONEY, GRANTS, ETC. FOLLOW THE FINANCIAL AID MATRIX THAT WAS DESIGNED AND APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET, OR IF MONEY WAS DONATED FOR SPECIFIC PURPOSES, BY THE WISHES OF THE INDIVIDUAL DONOR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 SYRACUSE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED APPROXIMATELY $317 MILLION IN INSTITUTIONAL AID TO UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS IN THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018. THE AID PROVIDED CONSISTS OF A COMBINATION OF NEED-BASED AND MERIT-BASED GRANTS. STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR THESE FINANCIAL AID AWARDS BY COMPLETING TWO FORMS THAT ESTABLISH ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED AID: THE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE FINANCIAL AID PROFILE; AND THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. THESE ARE STANDARD FORMS USED IN HIGHER EDUCATION FOR THIS PURPOSE. BOTH NEED-BASED AND MERIT-BASED AID PROVIDED TO STUDENTS IS APPLIED BY SYRACUSE UNIVERSITY DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GENERALLY LIMITED TO THE AMOUNT OF TUITION. STUDENTS REACHING THE "TUITIONARE INELIGIBLE FOR ADDITIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS FROM SYRACUSE UNIVERSITY. NEED-BASED AID CAN BE USED FOR ALL EDUCATIONAL RELATED EXPENSES IN ADDITION TO TUITION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART II SYRACUSE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES AND RECEIVED ACKNOWLEDGEMENT THAT MONIES REPRESENT CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS FOR EACH ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE.

PART III, COLUMN B THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS WHO RECEIVED SCHOLARSHIPS WAS DERIVED BY QUERYING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT DATABASE IN THE STUDENT RECEIVABLE SYSTEM FOR ACADEMIC TERMS WITHIN THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018. THE QUERY LOOKED FOR TUITION DISCOUNT (FINANCIAL AID) AND OTHER ASSISTANCE USING THE DEFINITION OF SUCH ITEMS AS REPORTED IN SYRACUSE UNIVERSITY'S AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THIS PRODUCED A REPORT OF ALL STUDENTS WHO RECEIVED AID. RECOGNIZING THAT A STUDENT COULD BE RECEIVING AID IN MORE THAN ONE ACADEMIC TERM, THE INFORMATION WAS THEN SORTED BY INDIVIDUAL AND THE STUDENT WAS COUNTED ONLY ONCE PER FINANCIAL AID TYPE.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING MCPHERSON COLLEGE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE NON-CASH AWARDS, REQUIRING THE AWARDS TO BE USED AS A DIRECT REDUCTION IN TUITION COST.
Hiram College awards aid per the regulations set forth. The aid is administered by professionals and the programs comply with all regulations as attested in the Single Audit.

ALL STUDENT AID AWARD LETTERS ARE PREPARED BY LINDENWOOD COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. EACH AWARD LETTER HAS A STATEMENT OF CONDITIONS AND IS SIGNED BY THE STUDENT. THE BUSINESS OFFICE POSTS ALL AID TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR ACADEMIC USAGE. BOTH THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITOR THESE FUNDS.
Scholarships are awarded based on established criteria, including donor restrictions.

ST. EDWARD'S UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS USING A TASK FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT, COMPLIANCE AND FUNDS MANAGEMENT, AND ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDITS. THE ENROLLMENT COMMITTEE REVIEWS AWARDING AND RENEWAL POLICIES FOR THE UNIVERSITY GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AND ESTABLISHES FRESHMEN AND TRANSFER ENROLLMENT GOALS ALONG WITH THE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING STRATEGY NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS. THE COMMITTEE ENGAGES A NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED LEADER IN THE ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT CONSULTING FIELD TO ASSIST IN THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MONITORING OF FRESHMEN AND TRANSFER ENROLLMENT GOALS AND FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING. EACH COMMITTEE MEMBER AND OTHER KEY UNIVERSITY PERSONNEL RECEIVE WEEKLY REPORTS THROUGHOUT THE FINANCIAL AID AWARDING CYCLE. THE TASK FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT IS COMPRISED OF THE PROVOST, VICE PRESIDENT STUDENT AFFAIRS, VICE PRESIDENT FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION, VICE PRESIDENT ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT, VICE PRESIDENT MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS, VICE PRESIDENT INSTITUTIONAL EFFECTIVENESS AND PLANNING, ASSOCIATE VICE PRESIDENTS ACADEMIC SERVICES, ASSOCIATE VICE PRESIDENTS ACADEMIC AFFAIRS, ASSOCIATE VICE PRESIDENT ATHLETICS AND THE DIRECTOR OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE AND PROPER FUND MANAGEMENT, THE UNIVERSITY USES AN ENTERPRISE SOFTWARE TO TRACK ALL FUNDING SOURCES FOR SCHOLARSHIPS FROM UNIVERSITY, FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL AND PRIVATE SOURCES. THE SOFTWARE HAS A COMPREHENSIVE COMPLIANCE AND FUNDS MANAGEMENT MODULE AND ALLOWS STAFF TO ADD ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONALITY AS NECESSARY. THE COMPLIANCE MODULE IDENTIFIES GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP OFFERS THAT FAIL TO MEET AWARDING CRITERIA AND PREVENTS FINANCIAL AID FROM BEING APPLIED TO A STUDENT IF THE STUDENT DOES NOT MEET THE DISBURSING CRITERIA. FINANCIAL AID RECORDS AND UNIVERSITY GENERAL LEDGER RECORDS ARE RECONCILED USING THE FUNDS MANAGEMENT FUNCTION. ADDITIONAL MONITORING IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH DIAGNOSTIC REPORTS BY FINANCIAL AID IDENTIFYING CODES, TYPES OF GRANTS, FORMS OF GRANTS AND INDIVIDUAL FUNDING SOURCES. ANNUAL AUDITS ARE PERFORMED BY AN INDEPENDENT PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM THAT RENDERS AN OPINION AS TO WHETHER FEDERAL AND CERTAIN STATE FUNDED FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS ARE EXERCISED IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS AND REGULATIONS GOVERNING SAID PROGRAMS.
THE UNIVERSITY GRANTS SCHOLARSHIPS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS AND MAINTAINS RECORDS AS TO THEIR ELIGIBILTY AND QUALIFICATIONS.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS TO HELP DEFRAY THE COST OF ATTENDANCE. SUCH ASSISTANCE IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS AND DONOR STIPULATIONS.
THE COLLEGE PROVIDES TUITION DISCOUNT ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS AFFILIATED WITH CERTAIN ORGANIZATIONS AND PROGRAMS. SUCH ASSISTANCE IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S BILLING ACCOUNT.

CMU DISTRIBUTES LIMITED FINANCIAL AID AND GRANT FUNDS TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. BASED ON A STATISTICAL MODEL THAT TAKES INTO ACCOUNT A STUDENT'S INTENDED COLLEGE MAJOR, ACADEMIC AND ARTISTIC TALENTS, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL NEED. FOR STUDENTS, SUCH FUNDS ARE TYPICALLY APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION AT CMU. OTHER TYPES OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE MIGHT INCLUDE, FOR EXAMPLE, RECIPIENTS OF PRIZES AND AWARDS WHO HAVE MET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR THE PARTICULAR PRIZE OR AWARD TO BE SELECTED. IN THE CASE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS, THE RECIPIENT IS OFTEN REQUIRED TO UTILIZE THE FUNDS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION AND RESEARCH AT CMU. GRANTS ARE ALSO MADE IN THE CONTEXT OF ACADEMIC OR RESEARCH PROGRAMS AND RECIPIENTS SPEND THEIR GRANT FUNDS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE PROGRAM FOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. SPONSORED PROJECT FUNDS ARE PASSED THROUGH TO SUB-GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS BY CARNEGIE MELLON WHEN SUCH SUB-GRANTEE ARRANGEMENTS ARE APPROVED BY THE PRIMARY GRANT SPONSOR. FUNDS ARE SPENT UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS AND ARE ACCOUNTABLE TO FEDERAL AND SPONSOR TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SATISFACTORILY FILL OUT A PRE-GRANT REQUEST APPLICATION CONFIRMING THE INTENDED USE OF THE FUNDS FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES CONSISTENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION. THE GRANTEE ALSO ACKNOWLEDGES IN WRITING THEREIN THE REQUIREMENT THAT ALL FUNDS BE USED FOR SUCH PURPOSES, PERIODIC REPORTING ON EXPENDITURES, AND THAT FUNDS WILL NEED TO BE RETURNED TO GRANTOR IF NOT USED OR TO BE USED IN FURTHERANCE OF THE CHARITABLE PURPOSE. THESE PROVISIONS OF THE APPLICATION COINCIDE WITH THE PRIVATE FOUNDATION EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF IRS REGULATIONS. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS MONITORED AS FOLLOWS: "FINANCIAL NEED" IS THE BASIS FOR ASSIGNING MOST INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP, BASED ON ANALYSIS OF FAMILY FINANCES FOR TUITION AFFORDABILITY. SOME INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP IS BASED ON INTERN WORK EXCHANGE SOME INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP IS BASED ON MERIT ASSIGNED FOR DIFFERENT PURPOSES FOR DIFFERENT SCHOLARSHIPS, FOR INSTANCE, A DONOR MAY SPECIFY SOME CRITERIA FOR SOME SPECIFIC DONATED SCHOLARSHIP

YORK COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO HAVE SPECIAL QUALITIES AND/OR TALENTS. INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS DURING RECRUITMENT EFFORTS. RECOMMENDATIONS ARE MADE TO THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR FOR AWARDING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE THAT IS PROVIDED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY TO STUDENTS IS DESIGNATED FOR TUITION, FEES, BOOKS, AND OTHER DIRECT EDUCATIONAL COSTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND FINANCE OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS AND CONTROLS DISBURSEMENT OF ALL ASSISTANCE.
APPLICATIONS ARE RECEIVED AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED FOR NEED BASED ELIGIBLE STUDENTS AND FOR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 CONTRIBUTIONS MADE TO OTHER CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS ARE MADE PURSUANT TO UNIVERSITY POLICY. CONTRIBUTIONS BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE MADE WHERE THEY FURTHER THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION OR ITS ROLE AS A GOOD COMMUNITY CITIZEN. IN MAKING A CONTRIBUTION, CONSIDERATION IS GIVEN TO THE ALIGNMENT OF THE RECIPIENT ENTITY'S VALUES WITH THOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY AND THE APPROPRIATENESS OF MAKING A CONTRIBUTION. ALL GRANTS, INCLUDING SUB-GRANTS, ARE ACCOUNTED FOR SEPARATELY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING SYSTEM AND EACH IS MANAGED BY A PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR. FINANCIAL ACTIVITY REPORTS ARE PROVIDED TO PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS ON A DAILY BASIS, WITH RECONCILIATION OF FINANCIAL REPORTS REQUIRED ON A MONTHLY BASIS. SUB-GRANTS ARE FURTHER MONITORED BY OBTAINING A GRANTEE'S A-133 AUDITS AND EVALUATING THE GRANTEE'S ABILITY TO COMPLY WITH THE TERMS OF THE SUB-GRANT. ALL GRANT MONITORING IS SUBJECT TO THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE UNIVERSITY, WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO MEET FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS. THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL COMPLIANCE, OFFICE OF RESEARCH SERVICES, RESTRICTED ACCOUNTING AND OTHERS ARE CHARGED WITH ENSURING THAT ALL DEPAUL EMPLOYEES ARE AWARE OF THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES IN DEVELOPING AND MAINTAINING A COMPLIANCE-CONSCIOUS ENVIRONMENT. ADDITIONALLY, THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL COMPLIANCE, OFFICE OF RESEARCH SERVICES, RESTRICTED ACCOUNTING, PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS AND OTHERS ARE CHARGED WITH ENSURING THAT THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, AS WELL AS LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL LAWS ARE FOLLOWED. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH CONDUCTING RISK ASSESSMENTS, MONITORING OPERATIONAL ACTIVITIES, PROVIDING ONLINE, CLASSROOM AND/OR ONE-ON-ONE TRAINING AND OTHER TOOLS WHICH FOSTER COMPLIANCE. GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS REPRESENTS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID SYSTEM. INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S INTERNAL ACCOUNT AND REPRESENT AN OFFSET TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES ASSESSED BY THE UNIVERSITY. GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO UNIVERSITY STAFF AND THEIR ELIGIBLE SPOUSE, DEPENDENTS, OR AN UNRELATED SECOND DOMICILED ADULT REPRESENT STAFF TUITION WAIVERS, PURSUANT TO A WRITTEN BENEFITS PLAN. STAFF TUITION WAIVERS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S BENEFITS SYSTEM AND, LIKE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS, ARE CREDITED TO THE INDIVIDUAL'S INTERNAL ACCOUNT TO OFFSET TUITION CHARGES. TAXABILITY OF TUITION WAIVERS IS DETERMINED PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 127 AND 117(D) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND THEIR ACCOMPANYING REGULATIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE NETTED AGAINST STUDENT TUITION ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GEISINGER COMMONWEALTH SCHOOL OF MEDICINE PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS INCLUDING SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. GCSOM FORMED A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE TO REVIEW AND SELECT SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ACCORDING TO CRITERIA SPECIFIED BY THE DONOR. THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE IDENTIFIES ALL STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA AND THOSE STUDENTS ARE THEN SUBMITTED TO THE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE DETERMINED AND AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AFTER A REVIEW OF QUALIFIED APPLICANTS. THERE IS AN EXTENSIVE REVIEW PROCESS CONDUCTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO DETERMINE THE RECIPIENTS OF SUCH AID, INCLUDING SCHOLARSHIPS, IS SUPPORTED BY INTERNAL FUNDS, GIFTS FROM PRIVATE DONORS AND INCOME EARNED ON ENDOWMENT FUNDS, DONOR RESTRICTED SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER STUDENT AID. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED ONLY TO GCSOM'S TUITION AND FEES. NO CASH PAYMENTS ARE MADE TO STUDENTS FOR THESE SCHOLARSHIPS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: CAMPBELL UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT PROGRAMS. ALL GRANT PROGRAMS INCLUDE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AND FUND MANAGEMENT REGULATIONS AND GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED ACCORDING TO EACH PROGRAM'S GUIDELINES ONCE ELIGIBILITY HAS BEEN DETERMINED FOR THAT FUND. ELIGIBILITY IS REVIEWED BEFORE TRANSMITTAL/DISBURSEMENT TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. EACH FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAM HAS PREDETERMINED REPORTING GUIDELINES AND STANDARDS. THE FUNDS ARE RECONCILED AND FUND BUDGETS ARE REVIEWED MONTHLY.

NEED BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FEDERAL AND/OR STATE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND INSTITUTIONAL AID IS AWARDED ACCORDING TO INSTITUTIONAL POLICY. AMOUNTS OF AID AWARDED ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH GOVERNING REGULATIONS OR INSTITUTIONAL POLICY. IN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV REGULATIONS, TOTAL AID FROM ALL SOURCES CANNOT EXCEED NEED OR THE ANNUAL COST OF TUITION, REGARDLESS OF THE LEVEL OF NEED. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT ACCOUNT AND FUNDS ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS. OVERPAYMENT OR CREDIT BALANCES OF STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES ARE ANALYZED PRIOR TO DISTRIBUTING REFUNDS TO STUDENTS TO ENSURE THAT GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROPERLY AWARDED AND UTILIZED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM SCH I PART I LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS MERIT AND TALENT SCHOLARSHIPS ON A COMPETITIVE BASIS TO ALL STUDENTS. THESE AWARDS DO AFFECT CONSIDERATION FOR NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID. IF ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AID, THESE AWARDS WILL BE COUNTED AS RESOURCES AND WILL BECOME PART OF THE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO OFFERS ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS TO ALL STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS WHO FILE THE FINANCIAL AID FROM WILL AUTOMATICALLY BE CONSIDERED WHEN FINANCIAL NEED IS REQUIRED. GRANTS ARE AVAILABLE ANNUALLY FROM CURRENT FUNDS TO FULL-TIME STUDENTS WITH DOCUMENTED FINANCIAL NEED. FINANCIAL AID CONSISTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND PAID EMPLOYMENT. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS DO NOT HAVE TO BE REPAID. LOANS ARE OFFERED AT LOW INTEREST RATES ON THE CONDITION THAT THEY BE REPAID. PAID EMPLOYMENT IS AN EARNING PROGRAM. THE AMOUNT OFFERED IS THE AMOUNT THAT THEY MAY EARN. THE STUDENT IS PAID AN HOURLY RATE FOR WORK ACTUALLY PERFORMED.

The University utilizes several procedures and reports on an annual basis to monitor financial aid. The University has internal controls in place to ensure amounts are awarded to students who continue to meet and maintain eligibility requirements. These controls are administered through the Financial Aid office. Also, Independent Auditors complete the A-133 Audit relating to federal and state student aid.

The University's Office of Financial Aid monitors all recipients of scholarship awards to determine both initial and confirming eligibility based on the criteria for each type of award, which may include academic performance, financial need, and criteria established by donors of endowed scholarship funds, etc.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE THAT SELECTS ALL SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS. THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON BOTH MERIT AND NEED.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THESE CRITERIA INCLUDE FINANCIAL NEED, GRADE POINT AVERAGE, AND OTHERS AS ESTABLISHED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP DOCUMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS TO PAY TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD EXPENSES.

A FILE IS CREATED FOR EACH GRANTEE. WE DETERMINE EACH STUDENT'S DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED BASED ON THEIR COST OF ATTENDANCE MINUS EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION ACCORDING TO THE INSTITUTIONAL STUDENT INFORMATION RECORD FROM THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR. WE ATTEMPT TO MEET EACH STUDENT'S DEMONSTRATED NEED WITH A COMBINATION OF MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, NEED-BASED GRANTS, FEDERAL COLLEGE WORK-STUDY, AND STUDENT LOANS. FINANCIAL AID MAY BE AWARDED FROM FEDERAL, STATE, INSTITUTIONAL, AND PRIVATE SOURCES. WE MONITOR AND MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE MONITORS AND MAINTAINS SEPARATE FUND ACCOUNTS FOR EACH AWARD CATEGORY AND PROVIDES THE NECESSARY REPORTS TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES.

The University is contributing funds to charitable oganizations in accordance with endowment agreements that govern the distribution of the underlying funds. The University also verifies that the grants given to the charitable organization are for the benefit of individual students for scholarships.
Student awards, grants and loans are awarded on basis of need. Scholarships are awarded based upon need and academic or special achievements.

FINANCIAL AID IS AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WHO CAN SHOW FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, LEADERSHIP/SERVICE, ATHLETICS ABILITY, AND/OR TALENT. ACADEMIC AND LEADERSHIP AWARDS ARE DETERMINED THROUGH THE ADMISSIONS AREA, ATHLETICS AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY THE RESPECTIVE COACH, TALENT/DEPARTMENTAL AWARDS ARE DETERMINED THROUGH THOSE ACADEMIC AREAS, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE COORDINATES ALL AWARDS WITH FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL NEED-BASED AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The Office of Financial Aid awards grants to students that are applied to the student's account. Grants are awarded based on need or merit.

THE COLLEGE REVIEWS ALL AMERICAN SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA'S EXPENDITURES FOR WHICH ITS GRANTS ARE INTENDED. ASSISTANCE FOR INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS IS PROVIDED THROUGH FEDERAL, STATE AND COLLEGE PROGRAMS AND EXTERNAL AGENCIES. THE COLLEGE ADMINISTERS THESE PROGRAMS. TYPICALLY, FINANCIAL AID FUNDS ADMINISTERED BY THE COLLEGE ARE AWARDS ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED (AS DETERMINED BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, STATE AGENCIES, THE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICES, AND BARD COLLEGE), ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND PROMISE. THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID DISTRIBUTIONS. STUDENTS APPLY FINANCIAL AID BY COMPLETING A FASFA FORM WHICH DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY. STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS PERIODICALLY MONITORED TO ENSURE THAT GRANT AWARDS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE MAJORITY OF GRANTS GIVEN TO STUDENTS IN THE UNITED STATES PRIMARILY CONSIST OF NEED-BASED GRANTS. STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR THESE FINANCIAL AID AWARDS BY COMPLETING TWO FORMS THAT ESTABLISH ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED AID. THESE ARE STANDARD FORMS USED IN HIGHER EDUCATION FOR THIS PURPOSE: COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE FINANCIAL AID PROFILE AND FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR AMOUNTS GIVEN TO STUDENTS AS FINANCIAL AID ARE APPLIED BY THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE. HAMPSHIRE COLLEGE GRANT AID ASSISTANCE IS GENERALLY LIMITED TO THE AMOUNT OF TUITION. THE COLLEGE ALSO OFFERS FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE ARE SIMILARLY APPLIED BY THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE AND DO NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNT OF TUITION.
RECORDS VERIFYING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED YEARLY FOR EACH ORGANIZATION

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarship Funds, both budgeted and investments, are monitored by the Board of Directors and appointed staff, with dividends being awarded as scholarships by decision of the Financial Aid Office and/or the Scholarship Committee, and distributed through the Business Office.
THE COLLEGE REVIEWS AND MAKES SURE ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING GOVERNMENT GRANTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THOSE GRANTS BEFORE DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANT FUNDS ARE GIVEN TO THE FILING ORGANIZAION'S SUPPORTING/CONTROLLED ORGANIZATION.

SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED BASED ON ESTABLISHED MERIT AND NEED BASED CRITERIA. THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AND ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT HEADS WORK TOGETHER TO SELECT RECIPIENTS OF IN-HOUSE SCHOLARSHIPS. QUALIFICATIONS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS VARY. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED TO STUDENTS BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT, ATHLETIC MERIT, AND ACADEMIC DISCIPLINE. STUDENT LOANS ARE AWARDED BASED ON FEDERAL ELIGBILITY GUIDELINES AS PROVIDED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION DIRECT LENDING PROGRAM. STUDENT ATHLETICS MUST FOLLOW THE RULES SET FORTH BY THE NCAA. ONCE A SCHOLARSHIP HAS BEEN AWARDED, THE UNIVERSITY CHECKS THE RECIPIENT'S GRADE POINT AVERAGE AT THE END OF EACH SCHOOL YEAR TO DETERMINE IF HE/SHE IS MEETING THE ACADEMIC STANDARD SET FORTH BY THE SCHOOL OR DONOR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AT JCSU IS RESPONSIBLE FOR CHECKING EACH ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENT'S GRADES BEFORE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED FOR THE NEXT SCHOOL YEAR. STUDENTS NOT MEETING SAP (SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROCESS) WILL LOSE THEIR ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPERS. FOR NEEDS BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS, THE PARENTS OR RECIPIENTS ARE REQUESTED TO SUBMIT A COPY OF THE TAX RETURN EACH YEAR TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BEFORE NEW NEEDS BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED. STUDENTS RECEIVING ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS MUST MAINTAIN A 2.0 OR HIGHER GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND MUST PASS AT LEAST 6 CREDIT HOURS IN THE FALL SEMESTER AND 24 CREDIT HOURS FOR THE SCHOOL YEAR. THE ATHLETICS COMPLIANCE COORDINATOR CHECKS THE GRADE REPORT FOR EACH STUDENT ATHLETIC. EACH STUDENT ATHLETE'S GRADE REPORT IS EXAMINED AT THE END OF THE SEMESTER TO SEE IF HE/SHE IS MEETING THE SET STANDARDS. IF THEY ARE NOT MEETING STANDARDS, HE/SHE WILL LOSE THEIR SCHOLARSHIP. FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS, IF A STUDENT WITHDREW FROM THE UNIVERSITY BEFORE COMPLETING 60 PERCENT OR MORE OF A SEMESTER, HIS/HER FINANCIAL AID INCLUDING INTERNAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PRORATED BASED ON THE R2T4 (RETURN OF TITLE 4 FUNDS) CALCULATION.

OUR FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON SUBMITTED FAFSA DATA AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING COMPLIANCE WITH ALL RELEVANT STATE AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS RELATIVE TO GRANT-BASED AID. THIS SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS REDUCES THE NET AMOUNT PAYABLE TO THE COLLEGE.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED EACH YEAR BY FINANCIAL AID IN CONJUNCTION/CONSULTATION WITH THE ADVANCEMENT DEPARTMENT.

IONA COLLEGE GIVES AID TO STUDENTS IN TWO FORMS: MERIT AID AND NEEDS BASED AID. THE AMOUNT OF MERIT AID A STUDENT RECEIVES IS BASED ON A CALCULATED ACADEMIC INDEX THAT IS DERIVED FROM THEIR GPA & SAT SCORES. NEED BASED AID IS DETERMINED FROM THE STUDENT EFC. STUDENTS ARE GIVEN THESE AWARDS UPON ACCEPTANCE TO THE COLLEGE AND THE AWARDS ARE RENEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS ASSUMING THE STUDENT MEETS THE REQUIRED CUMULATIVE GPA AND THEIR NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA HAS NOT CHANGED. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ISSUED BY THE COLLEGE ARE INTENDED TO BE USED TO DEFRAY TUITION COSTS AND ENABLE STUDENTS TO MATRICULATE AT IONA COLLEGE, THE STUDENT HAS NO DISCRETION ON HOW TO EXPEND THOSE FUNDS. ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT FORMALLY MONITOR THE USE OF THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS SINCE IT IS REQUIRED THAT SUCH FUNDS BE USED TO OFFSET TUITION COSTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. FUNDS YRE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

GRANTS ARE ACCOUNTED FOR IN THE UNIVERSITY'S ACCOUNTING RECORDS, INCLUDING SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION FOR ALL EXPENDITURES. GRANT MANAGERS ARE REQUIRED TO ASSERT THAT FUNDS HAVE BEEN SPENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS.

FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 LONG ISLAND UNIVERSITY OFFERS A NUMBER OF INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS ENROLLED IN DEGREE PROGRAMS. EACH GRANT OR OTHER FORMS OF ASSISTANCE HAVE SPECIFIC AWARDING CRITERIA AND INDIVIDUAL RULES FOR SELECTION BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND/OR PERFORMANCE. THE CAMPUS ENROLLMENT SERVICES OFFICES ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR PREPARING INDIVIDUAL STUDENT AWARD PACKAGES. THE DISBURSAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS SEGREGATED AND PERFORMED BY THE CENTRAL FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE POSTS TRANSACTIONS TO EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. IN ADDITION, INTERNAL CONTROLS ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE AMOUNTS ARE AWARDED ACCURATELY TO STUDENTS WHO PROPERLY MEET AND MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. ACCOUNTING TRANSACTIONS ARE ROUTINELY RECONCILED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S ERP SYSTEM AND STUDENT ACCOUNTS ARE CONSISTENTLY MONITORED BY ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND FINANCIAL NEED, AND ARE GIVEN TO CURRENT SCHOLARS. THEY ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE OFFICES OF ADMISSIONS AND STUDENT SERVICES.

DEPENDING ON THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE FUND SOURCES, FINANCIAL AID AND ALL TITLE IV AND STATE REGULATIONS ARE MONITORED, RECONCILED AND FOLLOWED DAILY BY TRAINED AND EXPERIENCED PROFESSIONAL STAFF THAT STAY UP TO DATE ON ANY CHANGES IN REGULATION THOUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TRAINING.
STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. TRAVEL AND STUDENT RESEARCH GRANTS REQUIRE SUBSTANTIATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III: ACCOUNTING FOR CASH AND NONCASH ASSISTANCE
ExplntnTxt: PAYMENTS/REIMBURSEMENTS DIRECTLY TO RECIPIENTS ARE CONSIDERED CASH ASSISTANCE. PAYMENTS TO VENDORS TO BENEFIT RECIPIENTS, OR THE PURCHASE OF NONCASH ITEMS TO BE GIVEN TO RECIPIENTS, ARE CONSIDERED NONCASH ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, COLUMN B: NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS IS BASED ON FINANCIAL AID RECORDS OF RECIPIENTS. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR PRIZES AND AWARDS IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE NUMBER OF PAYEES (CASH PRIZES/AWARDS), AND THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS BENEFITTED OR NUMBER OF ITEMS PURCHASED (NONCASH PRIZES/AWARDS). THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR STUDENT RESEARCH AND TRAVEL GRANTS IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE NUMBER OF PAYEES (CASH GRANTS), AND/OR THE NUMBER OF RESEARCH PROJECTS FUNDED (CASH AND NONCASH GRANTS).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS MONITORED THROUGH A GRANT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF MERIT AND NEED. FIRST YEAR STUDENTS MAY BE AWARDED SPECIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON NEED AND MERIT AS DETERMINED BY THE APPLICANT'S APPLICATION AND AUDITION. SECOND YEAR AND ACADEMY COMPANY STUDENTS MAY APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS BY WRITING TO THE ACADEMY'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WHICH MAKES ALL SCHOLARSHIP DECISIONS. DETAILS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

ALL GRANTS AND AWARDS MADE BY CENTRAL CHRISTIAN COLLEGE IN KANSAS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE UNDER THE GUIDELINES AND REGULATIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. ALL SUCH GRANTS, AWARDS, AND SCHOLARSHIPS APPEAR ON THE INDIVIDUAL AWARD LETTERS THAT ARE SIGNED BY THE STUDENT RECIPIENTS. THESE SAME GRANTS AND AWARDS CAN BE TRACED DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AND ON THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTING SYSTEM.

GTU'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS NEED BASED AWARDS AND ASSISTANCE USING THE FAFSA DATA AND STANDARD RANKING TO DETERMINE NEED. GTU'S FACULTY DEAN'S OFFICE AWARDS MERIT BASED AWARDS USING ESTABLISHED CRITERIA AND/OR ANALYSIS BY COMMITTEE OF WRITTEN APPLICATIONS. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS POSTED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND APPLIED TO TUITION AND FEE EXPENSES.

ALL GRANTS ARE SCHOLARSHIPS MADE TO STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN ENROLLMENT AND CERTAIN REQUIREMENTS TO MAINTAIN THEIR SCHOLARSHIPS. STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT FINANCIAL INFORMATION TO ESTABLISH QUALIFICATIONS FOR NEEDS BASED SCHOLARSHIPS.

DISBURSEMENTS FOR GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY MANAGEMENT PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT. PERIODIC REPORTS ON THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS ARE RECEIVED FROM THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION TO ENSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE EXPENDED ACCORDING TO THE STATED PURPOSE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 2 - Grants and Allocations:
ExplntnTxt: APPROXIMATELY 52 PERCENT OF TRINITY COLLEGE UNDERGRADUATES ARE RECEIVING ASSISTANCE FROM THE COLLEGE, FEDERAL OR STATE FUNDS. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS THE DISBURSEMENT OF FINANCIAL AID. SCHEDULE I, PART III: THE CASH GRANT INCLUDES CREDITS ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

Boricua College Scholarship (BCS) Scholarships are only awarded to studenYs that attend the College and are reviewed annually for compliance and need by the School committee that oversees the selection process. Criteria for Eligibility and Selection: Academic Excellence: A student must be in good academic standing and should have acquired 12-15 credits per term with acceptable G.P.A. Financial Need: This is a Non Need-Based Fund therefore distribution of funds will be determined based on tuition costs after all conventional financial sources have been exhausted. Procedure: The College will notify the student of the intended award. If student accepts the award, the students account is credited via a financial aid award letter. Priority: Preference may be given to students: 1.In Bachelors and Masters Programs. 2.Who may have exhausted all conventional SFA award eligibility. 3.Determined ineligible based on SFA agencies conventional methodology 4.With recommendations from academic administrators and Faculty Facilitators.

The college's financial aid department determines all federal and state financial aid for students based on the respective laws and regulations. The remaining need for financial assistance is then determined by the college and is based on criteria such as student activities (athletics, etc.), the academic program the student is enrolled in, the student's academic performance, and the income level of the student. These factors are then considered along with the available insitutional scholarship and grant funds in determining institutional financial assistance provided to the students.
THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, WHICH DIRECTLY OFFSETS TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE OF MONITORING USE OF GRANTS TO GOVERMENTAL AGENCIES & GOVERMENTS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS ITS GRANT FUNDS IN INDIVIDUAL GRANT ACCOUNTS AND IS REQUIRED TO BE AUDITED ANNUALLY. IN ADDITION, THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED RESEARCH POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS GUIDELINES TO PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS IN MANAGING THEIR GRANT AT BRANDEIS UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE OF MONITORING USE OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS
ExplntnTxt: PART III THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS AND APPLIES THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTLY CREDITING EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING ALL FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID BY COMPLETING A FAFSA FORM WHICH CAPTURES THE DATA REQUIRED DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY BASED ON FEDERAL AND/OR STATE REGULATIONS. DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY IS KEPT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ON FILE IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. WHEN FUNDS ARE AWARDED, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S OPERATIONAL SYSTEM AID MODULE TO ENSURE THERE ARE NO CHANGES IN STATUS THAT MIGHT AFFECT THEIR ONGOING ELIGIBILITY. TOTAL GRANT FUNDS AWARDED ARE TRACKED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH AUTHORIZED AMOUNTS FROM THE FUNDING AGENCY. THE COLLEGE ALSO IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT AN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT A-133 AUDIT TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS FOR GRANT ASSISTANCE. THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING ALL INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE. CONTINUING STUDENTS APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIP AID BY COMPLETING A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION FORM WHICH CAPTURES THE DATA REQUIRED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY BASED ON INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. ENTERING STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED FOR SCHOLARSHIP BASED ON THE COLLEGE'S AUDITION AND INTERVIEW PROCESS. DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY IS KEPT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ON FILE IN THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE. WHEN FUNDS ARE AWARDED, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S OPERATIONAL SYSTEM SCHOLARSHIP MODULE TO ENSURE THERE ARE NO CHANGES IN STATUS THAT MIGHT AFFECT THEIR ONGOING ELIGIBILITY. TOTAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AWARDED ARE TRACKED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH BUDGETED AMOUNTS. THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE REVIEWS ALL AWARDS EACH SEMESTER TO DETERMINE THAT THE STUDENT IS STILL ELIGIBLE FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA ON AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT BASIS.

Grant funds are monitored through an electric packaging program for all students. This electronic program determines the eligibility for federal, state and institutional grant funding against a series or pre-established eligibility criteria. Once the program determines each student's eligibility for federal, state and institutional grant funding. The information is also checked by a member of the Student Financial Planning staff.
THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES BY ONLY DONATING TO THE RELATED ORGANIZATIONS LISTED UNDER SCHEDULE R.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: 1. PERFORM A RISK ASSESSMENT ON SUB-RECIPIENTS; 2. PERFORM SITE VISITS TO REVIEW FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC RECORDS; 3. ENSURE THAT PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR HAS REGULAR CONTACTS; 4. ENSURE A CURRENT CERTIFICATION OR AN A-133 AUDIT IS PERFORMED AND THE RELATED REPORT RECEIVED AND REVIEWED.

The University's Office of Financial Aid monitors all recipients of scholarship awards to determine both initial and continuing eligibility based on the criteria for each type of award, which may include academic performance, financial need, criteria established by donors of endowed scholarship funds, etc.

AS GIFTS AND GRANTS ARE RECEIVED, INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ARE ESTABLISHED IN OUR GENERAL LEDGER SYSTEM TO PROCESS THE GRANT REVENUE AND EXPENSE. A FINANCIAL MANAGER IS ASSIGNED TO REVIEW AND OVERSEE THE ACTIVITY OF THE FUND. IN ADDITION, OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE DEPARTMENTS ALSO PROVIDE SERVICES TO PROCESS, REPORT AND REVIEW THE GRANT INFORMATION. IN THE CASE OF PRIVATE GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS A FORMALIZED GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS TO VERIFY THAT THE UNIVERSITY UNDERSTANDS THE GRANT OBLIGATION AND PURPOSE BEFORE THE APPLICATION IS SENT TO THE GRANTOR ORGANIZATION. MANY PRIVATE AND GOVERNMENT GRANTS ARE RECEIVED FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. OUR ENROLLMENT SERVICES DEPARTMENT FOLLOWS A DETAILED POLICY AND PROCEDURES MANUAL THAT DESCRIBES HOW EACH SCHOLARSHIP IS AWARDED, INCLUDING SELECTION CRITERIA. THESE PROCEDURES FOLLOW GUIDELINES SET BY THE UNIVERSITY'S SENIOR LEADERSHIP. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS PROCESSED UNDER INDIVIDUAL GRANT FUNDS WITHIN OUR ACCOUNTING SYSTEM (AS DESCRIBED ABOVE), AND THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS ALSO PROCESSED UNDER EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. THIS APPROACH TO RECORD FINANCIAL AID BY FUND AND BY STUDENT ACCOUNT, PROVIDES A DETAILED RECORD OF HOW THE FUNDS ARE SPENT ACCORDING TO DONOR AND GOVERNMENTAL REQUIREMENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS STUDENT ACCOUNT ACTIVITY TO VERIFY THE STUDENT'S ENROLLMENT AND USE OF THE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS. GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO ESTABLISHED ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE EDUCATIONAL AND/OR CHARITABLE AND THE UNIVERSITY IS IN CONTACT WITH THOSE ORGANIZATIONS TO ENSURE THE GRANTS FUNDS ARE EXPENDED APPROPRIATELY.

GRANTS (FEDERAL/STATE) PASSED THROUGH TO STUDENTS ARE MONITORED USING OUR INTERNAL APPLICATION (POWERFAIDS), THE STATE (PHEAA) AND FEDERAL (COD-COMMON ORIGINATION AND DISBURSEMENT) ELECTRONIC SYSTEMS. A VALIDATION OF RECORDS AMONG ALL THREE SYSTEMS IS CONDUCTED PERIODICALLY THROUGHOUT THE ACADEMIC YEAR AND FOR SEMESTER END RECONCILIATIONS. THOSE SYSTEMS VERIFY THE CRITERIA FOR THE GRANS HAVE BEEN MET AND THE DOLLAR AMOUNTS RECEIVED HAVE BEEN DISTRIBUTED APPROPRIATELY.
SELECTION OF STUDENTS IS BASED ON ESTABLISHED CRITERIA OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP FUND AND STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS ON ACCOUNT THROUGH FINANCIAL AID.

GRANTS AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITIES' POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS WELL AS LAWS AND REGULATIONS.
The use of grant funds is monitored through the student financial aid and billing process.

THE PROCEDURES FOR NEED-BASED AWARDS INCLUDE REVIEW AND RESOLUTION OF ALL FEDERAL-PROCESSOR-IDENTIFIED ELIGIBILITY CONFLICTS, AND 100% VERIFICATION OF REPORTED PARENT AND STUDENT INCOMES. FOR ALL FUNDS, THERE IS A SEPARATION OF THE AWARDING AND DISBURSEMENT FUNCTIONS (DIFFERENT INDIVIDUALS RESPONSIBLE FOR EACH), MONTHLY RECONCILIATIONS BETWEEN STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND THE COLLEGE'S GENERAL LEDGER, AND AN ANNUAL AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133.
THE CASH GRANT IS REFLECTED ON STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Institutional need and merit awards, government grants and outside scholarships provided aid to 4,189 students during the year. Subsidized loans are awarded to eligible students based on need. Over $20 million was paid directly to students (Form 990, Part III, line 4a) with the remainder applied internally to tuition, fees, and room and board.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEEDS ASSESSMENTS AND/OR PERFORMANCE. ONCE THE STUDENT HAS BEEN APPROVED TO RECEIVE THE GRANT, THE AMOUNT IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S BAKER COLLEGE ACCOUNT. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE MONITORS THE STUDENT TO MAKE SURE THE AWARD STAYS IN COMPLIANCE. IF THE STUDENT DOES NOT CONTINUE TO MEET THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS, THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT MAY BE REDUCED. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES ARE BUDGETED EACH YEAR BY THE BAKER COLLEGE CAMPUS. THE CAMPUS PRESIDENT(S) DETERMINES WHICH ORGANIZATION BENEFITS FROM A GRANT BASED ON THE COMMUNITY'S NEEDS. IF THE GRANT EXCEEDS THE BUDGET, THE BOARD OF REGENTS MUST APPROVE THE FUNDING. THESE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE AWARDED TO OTHER TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS TO BE USED IN ANY WAY THE RECIPIENTS SEE FIT TO FURTHER THEIR MISSION AND TAX EXEMPT PURPOSE; THE USE OF THESE FUNDS IS NOT MONITORED BY BAKER COLLEGE.
STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, OR OTHER ASSISTANCE, ARE EVALUATED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES IS IN THE FORM OF DONATIONS IN-LIEU OF REAL ESTATE TAXES. THE AMOUNTS ARE INTENDED TO HELP FUND SERVICES NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE ENTITIES.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED. COLLEGE FUNDED INSTITUTIONAL AND ENDOWED GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC MERIT. THE COLLEGE MONITORS THESE GRANTS AND AWARDS BY SEMESTER TO VERIFY THAT RECIPIENTS ARE MAINTAINING THE MINIMUM STANDARDS REQUIRED TO RECEIVE THE GRANT OR AWARD.

Need based financial aid comprises the larger part of the grants described in Part III. The staff in the Financial Aid Office make the determination of amount of grants awarded to individual students based on documentation provided. Need based grants is the larger part of the grants and are awarded for a maximum of eight semesters, subject to satisfactory academic progress. Merit based aid comprises the remainder of grants and requires maintaining a minimum GPA of 3.0.

SAINT LOUIS UNIVERSITY OFFERS A NUMBER OF INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. EACH PROGRAM HAS SPECIFIC AWARDING CRITERIA AND INDIVIDUAL RULES FOR AWARDING SET UP IN THE BANNER (ERP) SYSTEM. INITIALLY, AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES OR THE DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATORS WILL DETERMINE AND NOTIFY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES. AWARDS ARE THEN POSTED ACCORDINGLY AND DISBURSED ONTO A STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. STUDENTS REGISTERED IN THE BANNER (ERP) SYSTEM WILL BE AWARDED AND PAID USING THE STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM DISBURSEMENT RULES. CONTROLS ARE IN PLACE TO MONITOR OR DESIGNATE IF CHARGES AND RESULTING PAYMENT OF AID IS APPLICABLE TO THE TYPE OF PROGRAM OR FEE BY USE OF SEPARATE DETAIL CODES FOR EACH PROGRAM.

THE OFFICES OF ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL AID OVERSEE THE AWARDING OF BOTH NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID AND MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. ONCE A STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION PROCESS AND IS FOUND ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED AND/OR MERIT BASED AID, THE STUDENT WILL RECEIVE A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE DETAILING THE COMBINATION OF SOURCES USED TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. USAGE IS MONITORED BY VIRTUE OF DIRECT ACCOUNT POSTING.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE COLLEGE'S ONLY GRANT-MAKING ACTIVITY IS TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO THOSE STUDENTS THAT MEET CERTAIN FINANCIAL AND MERIT CRITERIA. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DEDUCTED FROM EACH RECIPIENT'S BILL FOR TUITION AND FEES. AS SUCH, THE COLLEGE IS ASSURED THAT ITS GRANTS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE OF HELPING STUDENTS WITH EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID AND ADMISSION OFFICES. ANNUAL REVIEW OF QUALIFICATIONS FOR EACH LEVEL OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS DONE AFTER THE SPRING TERM. SATISFACTORY PROGRESS GUIDELINES FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION ARE FOLLOWED FOR ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING ANY TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP AID. OUR ADVANCEMENT OFFICE ASSIGNS ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS (FUNDED INSTITUTIONAL AID) REPRESENTS LESS THAN 20% OF OUR AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College undergoes the Uniform Guidance audit annually.

BETHANY COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS ON EVERY INDIVIDUAL WHO RECEIVES FUNDS. THESE RECORDS INCLUDE THE AMOUNT RECEIVED AND QUALIFICATIONS MET IN ORDER TO RECEIVE THOSE FUNDS. THEY ARE KEPT FOR THE DURATION OF TIME AS SPECIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND ARE PROPERLY DIPOSED OF AFTERWARDS. THE COLLEGE ALSO HAS A POLICIES AND PROCEDURES MANUAL WHICH STATES HOW SPECIFIC GRANT MONIES, SUCH AS THE KANSAS COMPREHENSIVE GRANT AND THE SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT, ARE AWARDED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO TUITION AND FEES INCURRED AT THE UNIVERSITY AND NOT PAID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS. MONITORING CONSISTS OF RECORD KEEPING FOR INTERNAL USE AND REVIEW OF ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III, LINE 1F:
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IN CONFORMANCE WITH ESTABLISHED POLICIES ON THE BASIS OF BOTH NEED AND SCHOLASTIC MERIT. TUITION DISCOUNTING IS BASED ON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY APU'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. AWARDS TO STUDENTS WITH NEED ARE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID FILED WITH THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR. THE APU APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION CONTAINS INFORMATION UTILIZED FOR SCHOLARSHIP AWARD. AID IS DETERMINED AND AWARDED ON AN EQUAL BASIS TO RECIPIENTS WITH SIMILAR ATTRIBUTES. PART III(B) NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS: RECIPIENTS HAVE RECEIVED ONE OR MORE AWARDS FOR WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE.

THE ADMISSIONS DEPT. ORIGINATES MERIT AWARDS AND DISCOVERY DAY DISCOUNTS FOR NEW STUDENTS, AND THE OFFICE OF DIVERSITY AWARDS THE DIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS. FINANCIAL AID WORKS WITH A SCHOLARSHIP COMM. TO EVALUATE APPLICATIONS AND SELECT RECIPIENTS FOR OTHER INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. NOTICES OF AVAILABLE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE POSTED OUTSIDE THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AS WELL AS VARIOUS INTERNAL PUBLICATIONS AND ON THE UNIVERSITY WEBSITE. RECORDS ARE MAINT. IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, AND ALL AWARDS AND DISCOUNTS ARE POSTED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH FINANCIAL AID.
A committee is assigned to consider student applicants and assign scholarships on a non-discriminatory basis.
STUDENTS RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS AS CREDITS AGAINST TUITION. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS CAN BE BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, AND/OR ATHLETICS.
Scholarships and other types of financial assistance are monitored through internal transfer of funds within the university.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 The awarding of student financial aid grants under the U.S. Department of Education's Student Financial Assistance Program is monitored by the College's Financial Aid Office, which ensures that the College meets the compliance requirements of Title 2, US Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 200, Uniform Administrative Requirements, Cost Principles and Audit Requirements for Federal Awards. The College's Financial Aid Office is responsible for establishing and maintaining effective internal control over compliance with the requirements of laws, regulations, contracts, and grants applicable to federal programs. Monitoring of federal and foundation grants supporting College operating activities is coordinated between the Financial Aid Office, the Chancellor's office, the Controller's office and the VP of Institutional Advancement. These offices and individuals ensure that appropriate controls are established and that grant requirements for documentation, tracking, expenditure of funds and reporting are met. All students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, athletic ability and other similar standards.

MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO WYOMING CATHOLIC COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT, REGARDLESS OF FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT ALL REQUIRED INFORMATION (INCLUDING A STANDARD APPLICATION FORM, ESSAYS, RECOMMENDATIONS, AND STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES) TO APPLY FOR A MERIT SCHOLARSHIP. APPLICATIONS ARE SCREENED BY A COMMITTEE. DETAILED RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED OF ALL APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS FOR MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS. NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO WYOMING CATHOLIC COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED SOLELY ON FAMILY FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT ALL REQUIRED INFORMATION (INCLUDING A STANDARD APPLICATION FORM AND FEDERAL TAX INFORMATION) TO APPLY FOR A NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP. APPLICATIONS ARE SCREENED BY A COLLEGE REPRESENTATIVE AND A STANDARD FINANCIAL AID CALCULATOR IS USED. DETAILED RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED OF ALL APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS.

GRANTS ARE PRIMARILY MONITORED IN THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF WRITTEN AND ELECTRONIC DOCUMENTATION. STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DEEMED WORTHY BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED.

AS UNION DOES NOT USUALLY PROVIDE GRANT FUNDS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, STANDARD POLICIES AND PROCEDURES ARE NOT IN PLACE FOR GRANTING FUNDS. BOTH GRANTS REPORTED WERE GRANTED FROM PROGRAM SPECIFIC FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS PARTNERING WITH UNION TO DELIVER MISSION CENTRIC PROGRAMMING. GRANTEES ARE SUBJECT TO ALL COMPLIANCE AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AS UNION. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS THE RECORDS RELATED TO THE GRANTS APPLICATION. THE PROCEDURE IS AS FOLLOWS: THE STUDENTS APPLY ANNUALLY FOR GRANTS BASED ON THEIR FAMILIES' FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. EACH APPLICATION IS THEN REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF GRANT THAT IS NEEDED. THE GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FROM APPROPRIATE SOURCES AND APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S BILL FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD AND OTHER CHARGES.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ESTABLISHED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS CAN BE INCREASED THROUGH CONTRIBUTIONS OR BY A BOARD RESOLUTION TO ADD A PORTION OF ANY SURPLUS IN A GIVEN YEAR TO A FUND.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS ONLY FOR TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD. THE FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AND CANNOT BE USED FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

Criteria is established for the awarding of individual scholarships. Students must complete an application and scholarships are awarded after all external scholarships and grants have been applied, not to exceed the cost of attendance. Scholarships are applied directly to the student account. A listing of scholarships and general scholarship policies can be found on the SCU website, www.swcu.edu.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO ADMITTED STUDENTS BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF THEIR ACADEMIC PROFILE AND A CAREFUL ANALYSIS OF THEIR DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS AWARDED GRANT FUNDS MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND REMAIN ENROLLED AT THE UNIVERSITY ON A FULL TIME ACADEMIC BASIS. AT THE END OF EVERY TERM, EACH STUDENT'S ACADEMIC STATUS (I.E., GPA) IS MONITORED TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY FOR ALL GRANT FUNDS RECEIVED. FOR MONITORING PURPOSES, ELECTRONIC REPORTS GENERATED FROM OUR DATABASE ARE UTILIZED FOR THE AWARD DETERMINATION AND STATUS REVIEW PROCESS. THE UNIVERSITY ENSURES THAT ITS GRANT FUNDS ARE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES BY CREDITING THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL AID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS RATHER THAN ISSUING CHECKS.

GRANTS ARE FOR TUITION AND FEES THAT ARE DISBURSED IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ENSURES THAT THE STUDENTS ARE WITHIN THEIR BUDGET ALLOWANCE. ADDITIONAL GRANTS ARE GIVEN TO PAY FOR BOOKS.

WAGNER COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES BY ENSURING THAT ALL STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIP MONIES ARE ALWAYS REGISTERED AS STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE. MANY DEPARTMENTS WITHIN THE COLLEGE WORK IN CONJUNCTION TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE MONITORED EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY. THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE REVIEWS ALL STUDENT APPLICATIONS, AND DETERMINES WHO IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS. THE FINANCE AND BUSINESS OFFICE DRAWS DOWN FUNDS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS, AND THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE MONITORS AND MAINTAINS ALL RECORDS REGARDING THE REGISTERED STATUS OF STUDENTS. PART III, LINE 1, COLUMN B WAGNER COLLEGE ESTIMATES THAT APPROXIMATELY 90% OF ALL FULL-TIME STUDENTS RECEIVE SOME SORT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM THE COLLEGE. THEREFORE, THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS OF GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE BY WAGNER COLLEGE IS ESTIMATED BY TAKING 90% OF THE TOTAL FTE ENROLLMENT FOR THE FALL 2017 SEMESTER (2,123 FTES), RESULTING IN APPROXIMATELY 1,911 RECIPIENTS.
WMED REQUIRES DETAIL LISTINGS OF ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES. ADDITIONALLY WMED MAY REQUEST DETAIL SUPPORT TO SUBSTANTIATE GRANT EXPENDITURES.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND MAKES AWARDS FOR NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDS ACADEMIC MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. BOTH OFFICES PERFORM POST AWARD MONITORING TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY. THE RESEARCH AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES OFFICE (RAS) PERFORMS SUB-RECIPIENT MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICY. RAS AND PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS MONITOR STATEMENT OF WORK COMPLETION, PROGRESS REPORTS, DELIVERABLES, CHANGE TO SCOPE AND BUDGETS. THEY ALSO REVIEW AND APPROVE SUB-RECIPIENT INVOICES.

THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE DETERMINES AND APPROVES ALL AWARDS ELIGIBILITY FOR A NEW YORK THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIP IS PRIMARILY BASED ON NEED AND AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. APPLICANTS MUST BE REGISTERED FOR A MINIMUM OF EIGHT CREDITS PER SEMESTER. A CREDIT FOR THE AWARDED AMOUNT IS APPLIED TO THE RECIPIENT'S ACCOUNT, NO ACTUAL CASH IS AWARDED DIRECTLY TO RECIPIENTS.
Schedule I, Part I, Line 2- Financial aid assistance is awarded based on US Federal, State, and Private guidelines as required by the corresponding type of assistance.
NEED-BASED GRANTS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL AID NEEDS ANALYSIS. OTHER GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BASED ON MEETING REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH BY THE DONOR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AIDS TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE COLLEGE'S POLICIES. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ADHERES STRICTLY TO ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROLS REPORTS AS REQUIRED BY TITLE 2 U.S. CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS PART 200, UNIFORM ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS, COST PRINCIPLES, AND AUDIT REQUIREMENTS FOR FEDERAL AWARDS AND GOVERNMENT AUDITING STANDARDS AND RELATED INFORMATION (FORMERLY OMB A-133).
MARIST COLLEGE VOLUNTARILY CONTRIBUTES TO THE FAIRVIEW FIRE DISTRICTS ANNUAL FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN AND CONTRIBUTES FUNDS FOR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS.

GRANTS ARE PROVIDED ON THE BASIS OF VERIFIED FINANCIAL NEED OR MERIT AND THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT UNLAWFULLY DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, RELIGION, AGE, SEX, DISABILITY OR PRIOR MILITARY SERVICE. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS MONITORED SO THAT IT IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH AWARDING TERMS AND CONDITIONS. EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED FOR ALLOWABILITY AND COMPLIANCE. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTS PRIOR TO APPROVAL. PART III: CASH GRANTS ARE CREDITS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPRESENTS ONLY THE NUMBERS OF STUDENTS RECEIVING INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING. OUTSIDE GRANTS, OR APPLICATIONS OF FUNDS PROVIDED BY OUTSIDE AGENCIES (E.G., FEDERAL LOAN PROGRAMS), ARE NOT INCLUDED.

THE COLLEGE HAS ESTABLISHED POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND CONTROLS OVER THE AWARDING, DISBURSING, AND MONITORING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE OF NEW YORK REGULATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS. SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE NOT PROVIDED DIRECTLY TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS; INSTEAD THEY ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION INVOICE AS A CREDIT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANTS FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 SMITH COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS AND LOANS TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. EACH FAMILY SUBMITS A CONFIDENTIAL QUESTIONNAIRE THAT IS ASSESSED WITH THE GUIDELINES ISSUED BY THE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE TO DEFINE NEED. SMITH MEETS THE FULL DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED OF ITS STUDENTS WITH A COMBINATION OF LOANS AND GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS SEVERAL MERIT-BASED GRANTS. WORK STUDY OPPORTUNITIES AND PAID INTERNSHIPS BASED IN RIGOROUS ACADEMIC CRITERIA ARE OFFERED. EMERGENCY AND OTHER STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AVAILABLE DEPENDENT ON THE CIRCUMSTANCE WITH THE OBJECTIVE TO MEET THE STUDENT'S FULL DEMONSTRATED NEED. GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE ONLY MADE TO THOSE RECOGNIZED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AS BEING DESCRIBED IN INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) AND 501(C)(6).

Various forms of student financial aid are posted as credits to individual student accounts receivable in accordance with institutional policies and are funded through the unrestricted fund as discounts, restricted and endowed scholarships, and publicly funded grants and scholarships through the US Department of Education, and awarded on the basis of information provided by students and their families through the FAFSA.

THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES AND INTERNAL NON-DISCRIMINATORY GUIDELINES FOR INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING. INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING IS BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS AND INSTITUTIONAL PROGRAM NEEDS AND IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
ALL FINANCIAL AID THAT IS AWARDED IS CREDITED TO THE TUITION BILLING FOR THE STUDENT. ALL AID IS USED TO REDUCE THE TUITION PAYABLE.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THAT A STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE AN AWARD. WHEN FUNDS ARRIVE, THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF DETERMINES THAT THE STUDENT IS ENROLLED FOR THE SAME NUMBER OF HOURS THAT THEY WERE PACKAGED FOR, AND THAT THEY ARE MEETING THE GUIDELINES OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE THEN NOTIFIES THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS DEPARTMENT THAT THE AWARD NEEDS TO BE CREDITED TO A STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR THAT TRIMESTER.
FINANCIAL AID FUNDS ARE AWARDED AND MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID Department. RESEARCH AWARDS ARE MONITORED BY THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH.

IN THE UNITED STATES SOKA UNIVERSITY OF AMERICA SERVES AS A CONDUIT TO RECEIVE AND DISBURSE STUDENT AID FUNDS FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES SUCH AS THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION UNDER THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS: - FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT - FEDERAL PELL AWARD GRANT PROGRAM - FEDERAL WORK STUDY - GI BILL INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS ARE AWARDED BY SOKA UNIVERSITY OF AMERICA TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WHO MEET SPECIFIC ACADEMIC AND ACHIEVEMENT CRITERIA. THE PURPOSES OF THESE GRANTS ARE CLEARLY COMMUNICATED TO THE RECIPIENTS AND ARE INTERNALLY USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN (B) THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED IN COLUMN (B) IS DETERMINED BY REVIEWING THE EXACT NUMBER OF STUDENTS WHO RECEIVED THE TYPE OF AID INDICATED.

Financial aid awards are granted to students based on the general criteria for institutional financial aid. No cash changes hands as financial aid is applied directly to student accounts through the college's academic management system.
To be considered for need based aid, a student is required to complete a Free Application for Federal Student Aid. Financial aid awards are not automatically renewed each year.

THE ORGANIZATION GAVE NON-CASH TUITION REDUCTION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET CRITERIA FOR SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO GAVE A CASH GRANT TO A RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION WITH WHICH IT HAS A WORKING RELATIONSHIP. THE ORGANIZATION WILL MONITOR THE GRANT TO ENSURE IT IS USED FOR CHRISTIAN EDUCATION.

ORGANIZATION PROVIDES NEEDS BASED SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS APPLYING FOR SCHOLARSHIPS MUST PROVIDE EVIDENCE OF NEED. EACH APPLICATION IS REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT.ORGANIZATION PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON NEED OF INDIVDUAL.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: BIOLA UNIVERSITY AWARDS BOTH MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS AT THE GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE LEVELS. MERIT AWARDS ARE BASED ON ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC, ATHLETIC, AND MUSIC ABILITIES. THESE TYPICALLY HAVE ACADEMIC OR PARTICIPATION REQUIREMENTS FOR RENEWAL. CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY BASED ON STATED REQUIREMENTS IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OR BY THE OFFICE THAT MAKES THE AWARDS. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE TYPICALLY AWARDED BASED ON SPECIFIC FORMULAS THAT ARE BASED ON AN INSTITUTIONAL OR FEDERAL COST AMOUNT COMBINED WITH THE FEDERAL EFC DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA. CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY IS NORMALLY CONTINGENT ON ONGOING NEED IN SUBSEQUENT YEARS. MOST OF THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BY BIOLA ARE FUNDED FROM GENERAL FUNDS; HOWEVER, A PORTION ARE FUNDED FROM RESTRICTED FUNDS THAT HAVE BEEN PROVIDED BY DONORS, AND ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE DONORS. SOME OF THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED BY VARIOUS CAMPUS DEPARTMENTS, AND SOME THROUGH AN APPLICATION PROCESS ADMINISTERED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS CLOSELY WITH ACCOUNTING AND FINANCE OFFICES TO MONITOR AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS FROM BOTH THE GENERAL FUND AND RESTRICTED FUND ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND AUDITED ANNUALLY BY THE A133 AUDIT.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS ON A FISCAL YEAR BASED ACCORDING TO THE OVERALL YEARLY BUDGET. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS ARE PACKAGED BASED ON AN OVERALL COLLEGE STRATEGY EMPLOYING NEED AND MERIT CRITERIA. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH OUTSIDE CONSULTANTS TO PREPARE PACKAGES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH STUDENTS TO ACCEPT AND/OR ADJUST INDIVIDUAL GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO PROVIDES CHARITABLE SUPPORT TO U.S. SECTION 501(C)(3) PUBLIC CHARITIES IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS MISSION.

The College uses a validation process to review eligibility to receive awards and to ensure compliance with grant requirements. Major grant programs are audited annually to ensure compliance with grant requirements and financial reporting.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 1 THE GRANTS DEPARTMENT AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OVERSEE ALL GRANTS, GOVERNMENT LOANS AND SCHOLARSHIP EXPENDITURES. ALL GRANT EXPENSES ARE APPROVED AND REIMBURSED IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICY. AN ANNUAL AUDIT IS CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH GOVERNMENTAL REGULATIONS. TO THE EXTENT THE INSTITUTE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS TO ITS STUDENTS, THOSE FUNDS MAY ONLY BE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF MATRICULATION AND MAY NOT BE SPENT AT THE STUDENT'S DISCRETION.

Manhattan College awards Federal and State financial aid to students who demonstrate financial need. The College also provides institutional aid based on academic achievement and/or financial need. The College has a limited number of Athletic scholarships. The College also awards scholarships through its Endowment and donor contributions. These are awarded based upon the donors written restrictions. The Financial Aid Office verifies the academic achievements and the personal income data provided on the FASFA to determine each students need based award and continuously monitors student eligibility and academic progress.

BAY PATH UNIVERSITY RECEIVES GRANT MONEY FROM FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. THIS GRANT MONEY IS DISBURSED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AS IT IS RECEIVED BY THE UNIVERISITY. STUDENT AWARDS ARE BASED ON THE FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES FOR EACH TYPE OF GRANT. GRANTS TO CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL POLICIES

Marshall University Research Corporation submits proposals to funding agencies and awards scholarships, stipends, and sub-grant awards in a pass through capacity. The recipients are in accordance with grant award documents.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY VALIDATING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS COMPLETION OF EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

PCOM MAINTAINS RECORDS OF AMOUNTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS, ELIGIBILITY FOR WHICH IS DETERMINED BY FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT REQUIREMENTS. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ISSUED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED AGAINST STUDENTS' TUITION ACCOUNT. NO CASH IS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY'S USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL AID TO OUR STUDENTS. WE MONITOR THE USE OF THESE UNIVERSITY FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED LEVELS OF AWARDS BASED ON A STUDENT'S MERIT CLASSIFICATION AND ON AN ANNUAL BUDGET. THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL REGULATIONS RELATIVE TO THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WHICH IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

The College follows federal, state, and institutional policies and regulations to monitor grants and funds: 1) the student applies for the grants; 2) grants are awarded from the various funding sources depending on need and/or academic standing; 3) the students eligibility is verified through federal, state, and institutional requirements, matriculation, registration, attendance, and academic progress; 4) grants and awards are processed into the student's account; 5) where loans are involved, the College follows up with the regulatory requirements after graduation. The Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) is an integral part of this process.
The scholarships are awarded to Spertus students and are used to offset their tuition costs.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE COLLEGE HAS A FAIR, EQUITABLE AND CONSISTENT AWARDING POLICY THAT MEETS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL REQUIREMENTS. STUDENTS ARE OFFERED A COMBINATION OF FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL AID. PACKAGING PARAMETERS ARE PERIODICALLY REVIEWED WITH THE HELP OF AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT TO EVALUATE THE MMC GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAMS OFFERED TO ALL STUDENT POPULATIONS AT MMC. MMC'S AWARDING POLICY IS REVIEWED BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR EACH YEAR TO ENSURE OUR COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS AT MMC. STUDENTS ARE MONITORED EACH SEMESTER TO ENSURE THEY MEET THE REQUIREMENTS ATTACHED TO THE AID THEY ARE RECEIVING. THE REVIEW INCLUDES BOTH ENROLLMENT AND ACADEMIC PROGRESS COMPONENTS. MMC STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN THEIR GPA AND COMPLETE THEIR CREDITS AS DESCRIBED IN THE COLLEGE CATALOGUE UNDER ACADEMIC SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS STANDARDS. ADDITIONALLY EACH GRANT RECEIVED HAS UNIQUE STANDARDS (SEE COLLEGE CATALOGUE) WHICH MUST BE MAINTAINED FOR CONTINUED AWARDING. A REVIEW IS CONDUCTED EACH SEMESTER BY THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF UNDER THE DIRECT SUPERVISION OF THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE ADMINISTERED AND MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY. SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS FOR FYE 6/30/18 WERE APPLIED TO STUDENT BALANCES OWED TO THE UNIVERSITY IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ASSURANCE OF VOLUNTARY COMPLIANCE (AVC) AGREEMENT ENTERED INTO WITH THE KENTUCKY ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE.

Keck Graduate Institute awards scholarships only to individual graduate students enrolled at the Institute. The scholarships are awarded in the admissions process based upon academic merit, financial need, and availability of funds. The Institute monitors that each student receiving a scholarship maintains satisfactory academic progress. In awarding donor-funded scholarships, the Institute also monitors that students selected for those scholarships meet any donor stipulations as to academic preparation or field of study.

Every full-time traditional undergraduate student is considered for merit-based financial aid. Merit-based aid is determined by the Admissions and Financial Aid Department's analysis of a student's academic credentials, such as standardized test scores and high school transcripts.
